story:
For years I have been inspired by individuals who put their fears aside and drop everything to embrace adventure. January of 2017 I will be embracing an adventure of my own. The journey starts in Bangkok, Thailand and my goal is to make it to Indonesia! Travel has always been a passion of mine and the opportunity to fulfil this dream excites me everyday. While backpacking through SE Asia I will be volunteering all over the region teaching English, helping to build villages, farming and assisting at different hostels. I will also be filming a documentary about traveling alone in SE Asia and will be blogging along the way on my new website beardedbackpacker.com which will launch in January.

Every dollar counts! thank you for your contribution!

story:
InMarket is a Dutch Design company, we have been designing and producing our own designs for over 10 years. The ikiPele burner is one of our product designs which we really like ourselves. It combines outdoor living, cooking and playing with fire, what is not to love?

IkiPele means small volcano in Hawaiian, it is a small and compact burner that can fit anywhere. It offers a beautiful fire and a cozy atmosphere. The heat radiating from the ikiPele will give your outdoor living more comfort and fun. The ikiPele uses CO2 neutral wood pellets.Short Summary

OUTDOOR LIVING

You can use the ikiPele in your garden or balcony, but you can also take it with you on a short trip or vacation.

SIMPLE COOKING

The ikiPele can also be used for preparing food or just keeping your food hot. With the included cross at the top you can place a pan or pot on your ikiPele.

ROASTING

The ikiPele radiates heat which can be used to roast perfect marshmallows. After about 45 minutes of burning, the pellets will glow for another 45 minutes, this is the perfect time to start roasting.

IGNITE

To start the ikiPele, just light the starter and place the wind cover. As the firestarter starts to burn it will ignite the wood pellets.

 

BURN

During combustion the solid pellets are converted into heat and wood gas. In a normal fire this wood gas is not used, but not with the IkiPele. The wood gas is extracted from the fire and is injected again in the top of the fire where it ignites. The result of this is a smoke free fire with very high efficiency and high temperature.

 

GLOW

After the burning process is finished, the pellets will still glow and radiate heat for +/- 45 minutes.

During the IndieGoGo campaign we still offer the ikiPele against the reduced crowdfunding price.

 

When we started to develop a terrace heater for the hospitality market, we  soon noticed that this would be too cumbersome for this market. However playing with fire is very addictive, so instead of abandoning the idea, we thought of how we could develop a small fire place that is perfect for personal home/travel use.

We started with steel prototypes to figure out the most efficient way to convert pellets into fire. After almost setting off the smoke alarm in our building we quickly noticed that smoke free fire is a must. At our small workshop we started making prototypes out of steel, glass and stone. After a lot of testing we made our first real models using cast iron. These models did not turn out as good as we hoped. We had to take a step back and redesign the ikiPele. The next pre-production model worked perfect, so we asked friends to test it the ikiPele at home or on vacation.

 

InMarket Design team consists of 4 product developers, from left to right Jan Willem, Casper, Hugo and Martijn.

 

Risks and challenges

The IkiPele already finished a successful Kickstarter campaign and production has already started.

We are a small design team with more than ten years of experience in product development and mass production. For production and distribution of our products we work together with several Dutch partners.

For US backers we work together with a US based fulfilment company. If you are a US citizen, your package will be sent directly from their warehouse.

The production molds are already finished and the first models have been fully tested. Although we do everything we can to prepare all steps, we are aware that unexpected situations might occur. We promise to keep our backers updated at all times.

story:
The Kistler Series 3 uses 0.5 mm aerogel insulation and weighs less than one pound, which is best for casual wear and outdoor activities in cold weather.

The Kistler Series 5 with 2mm aerogel insulation is the best option for people who are looking for a warm, hooded jacket for ski, a winter hike and any outdoor activities in cold weather. (Note: 515 is a longer version of 503.)

The Kistler Series 7, has a 3mm aerogel insulation layer, however with reasonable weight of 1.5kg — 50 percent lighter than the leading aerogel jacket on the market.

Series R uses the first single-layer aerogel composite jacket in the world, which gives apparel companies a new alternative to design sleek, fashionable outerwear.

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us take our business to the whole new level. We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a Kistler Aerogel Jacket, if you’re a supporter of Kistler, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of! Thank you!
story_txt:
Aerogel was first created by Samuel Stephens Kistler in 1931. It’s an extremely durable and flexible material that is much more effective than other insulators such as down. It is the lightest solid in the world, and even NASA trusts aerogel technology to be used in their spacesuits, which are put through some of the universe’s harshest conditions. 
However, various challenges such as stiffness and powder leakage made aerogel less ideal for daily clothing.

Our company’s Co-founder Dr. Lu encountered aerogel when he was studying his PhD at Imperial College in London back in 2012. Impressed by this “material of space era”, Dr. Lu and the team started the ideation process to bring it to daily use.
The team created an ultra-thin 3D mesh composite of aerogel, which is placed between the outer layer and the inner lining of the jacket, providing the perfect amount of heat insulation while staying light and soft.  
The Kistler Series 3 uses 0.5 mm aerogel insulation and weighs less than one pound, which is best for casual wear and outdoor activities in cold weather.The Kistler Series 5 with 2mm aerogel insulation is the best option for people who are looking for a warm, hooded jacket for ski, a winter hike and any outdoor activities in cold weather. (Note: 515 is a longer version of 503.)The Kistler Series 7, has a 3mm aerogel insulation layer, however with reasonable weight of 1.5kg — 50 percent lighter than the leading aerogel jacket on the market.Series R uses the first single-layer aerogel composite jacket in the world, which gives apparel companies a new alternative to design sleek, fashionable outerwear.





  We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us take our business to the whole new level. We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a Kistler Aerogel Jacket, if you’re a supporter of Kistler, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of! Thank you!

story:
My name is Lesley Hilling and I have started this campaign because I was a close friend of Anthea's and knew how much she enjoyed Brockwell Park.  It was her main walk for her and her dog Rufus.

It's going to be a good way to remember Anthea, as a meeting place and as a quiet place of reflection, which will be there for everyone.

It costs £1500 for a park bench - they are made of steel and set into a concrete base with a brass plaque.  The close friends of Anthea have already donated £500 so we are hoping to raise a further £1000 from others who knew her.  Thankyou.

story:
Nautalytics was born out of the desire of two racing sailors looking for a reliable and simple-to-use digital magnetic compass.  Founders, Quinn Schwenker and Justin Coplan, are accomplished sailors which means their ability to craft and supply a solution that works for sailors, our customers, and friends, is as good as it gets.

  • Quinn is the trimmer for the J-24, Nautalytics, 2018 North American Champion, 2018 - 2017 Kiel Week Champion, 2013 US National Champion, and has nine top ten finishes at  J-24 World Championships.
  • Justin is a  silver medalist at the 2015 Pan American Games and  at the 2013 Lightning World Championships.  He is also the tactician for  the J-24, Nautalytics, 2018 North American Champion, 2018  Kiel Week Champion, and has many top ten finishes at  J-24 World Championships.

 

J-24 team Nautalytics:  Quinn, Justin, Marianne, Mike and Max at 2018 Kiel Week

We are racing sailors that wanted a dependable digital magnetic compass with big numbers that are easy to see, for a good price, and that is class legal.

We couldn't find one on the market that met our needs, so we made one.

(photos taken through polarized lenses)

We have all experienced it: a beautiful sailing day in the morning, and a storm front comes through the racecourse in the afternoon. We wanted a compass that we could see in all conditions with your polarized sunglasses on or off. 

We developed our compass with an easy to see LCD display with large 1.4” high numbers that are visible in ALL weather conditions. Our compass has three primary features:

  • Filters to allow use of polarized sunglasses with minimal black out zones
  • A faceplate that doesn't create rainbows with polarized sunglasses
  • Anti-glare coating
  • Large numbers

 

  • Count down timer for starts. Hit the GUN button to start the countdown, hit it again to synchronize down to the next whole minute. Set the timer between one- and nine-minutes. After the timer has counted down the compass is displayed.

  • Back light for night sailing.

  • Brackets for a mast or deck. Every compass gets your choice of an anodized aluminum bracket with a means of attachment. Universal mast attachment includes a 2” wide hook and loop strap and a mast slug that fits inside your mast bolt rope track. Deck bracket includes 3M Dual Lock™.

 

  • Nautalytics SIMPLE Compass
  • Universal mast bracket or deck bracket and everything you need to attach it to your boat
  • Soft case
  • Back plate

Compass with Deck Bracket

Compass with Mast Bracket

See wind shifts: While racing sailboats, we use the compass to detect headers and lifts when sailing upwind. The ability to see the wind shift allows the crew to take advantage of the change in wind direction and sail less distance. Using a compass for racing is a fundamental skill for competitive sailing.

Navigation: Our compass can be used for navigation by anyone. Because it is a magnetic compass, it is affected by ferrous metals and is not ideal for all locations. This compass was not designed to be a primary navigation device nor to be used in aviation.

During our Indiegogo Campaign, we are offering a compass and bracket for as low as $230 USD,  With all the features and attention to detail we provide, this is an amazing value. We offer up to 39% off our normal pricing, making this opportunity priced at 50% below of our competitor's pricing.

We launched our prototype in 2016 and our first-generation compass sold out, validating that our solution has merit and appeal in the sailing community. 

Fast-forward a couple of years, and our startup has achieved good traction among sailors who, like us, were not happy with the compasses available on the market and have embraced our solution.

Racing teams have been using and winning with our magnetic compass. They provided valuable feedback which we have incorporated into the design of the this new and improved Nautalytics SIMPLE Compass.

We invite you to be part of the next chapter of Nautalytics!

 

 

Our goal is to raise $50,000 through sales of the Nautalytics SIMPLE Compass.  Our first two production runs totaling over 400 units sold out,  We are undertaking this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to ramp up production and manufacture the Nautalytics SIMPLE compass at an economy of scale that allows us to pass significant savings on to other sailors. We are raising money to create the next generation of electronics. We are raising money to help teach how to use a compass through digital media.

We have stock on hand, ready to ship!  Depending on how soon you place your order, you can be sailing with your SIMPLE compass within a week.  All sales will be fulfilled in the order they are received.  So order early to get the most savings and the quickest shipping!

 

 

Olympic Coaching for your Fleet:

  • Your fleet gets a weekend of Olympic Coaching.
  • We will supply the right Olympic coach for your fleet to cover topics from the basics to the highest level of sail boat racing and Nautalytics will be there to help facilitate the weekend.
  • Your fleet will also receive ten (10) Nautalytics SIMPLE compasses and brackets.  If you need more than 10, let us know and we will craft a package to meet your specific needs.
  • Your fleet and Nautalytics will donate ten (10) Nautalytics compasses to the US Sailing Olympic Development team to support our junior sailors.
  • Not a fleet in the USA? Please contact us and we will develop a similar package to benefit you and your national sailing program.

 

We are lifelong sailors passionate about our sport. We are also entrepreneurs that developed a product to help our sport, especially the classic boats most of us sail. A successful Indiegogo campaign will enable us to ramp up production to get to an economy of scale that will allow us lower pricing, to continue to improve our product, and to do our part to help improve the sport of sailing around the world.

If you can't or choose not to support us financially, you can  help us in one of the following ways:

  • Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nautalytics/
  • Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nautalytics
  • And use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you've made it all the way to the bottom of this page, then you're awesome! Thank you so much!

story:
Greetings, we are a group of 20 students from the Universidad Simón Bolívar Sede Litoral (USB -SL). We, students of aviation technology , mechanical, electrical, electronics and engineering maintenance, request support for a technology - academic project. As a group Aerodesing USB SAE Sede Litoral. For the first time, our office wants to represent the University and Venezuela in the prestigious event "SAE AERO DESIGN BRAZIL 2014 " organized by Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE Int) to be held in the city of Sao Jose Dos Campos, Brazil on October 2014.

Competition "SAE Aero Design " is held annually where different universities in South America commit to meet a number of objectives that are given. The first one is to develop a radio controlled aircraft, powered by an electric motor and built by University students, which will be governed under the rules of the competition SAE BRAZIL 2014 in MICRO category, in addition to flying this aircraft , you have to move the maximum amount of tennis balls you can handle.

For the first time the Universidad Simón Bolívar Sede Litoral participate in a contest in this category and importance, our goal is to prove our knowledge and improve ourselves through experience to leave a legacy for future student who wishes to continue with our project in future competitions, highlighting that this is a task that is motivated for our passion to our dream to represent our country, especially our state Vargas and USB Sede Litoral, which is growing, we want to give our commitment to the development of new aircraft technologies to collaborate human and technological development of our social environment. And to show that this technology can both assist in various technological advances, recognition, film, tourism and conservation of the environment, as long as it is given a good use to this type of technology.

We say goodbye, but not before inviting you to collaborate with us and if you can not help us economically, we can accept aeronautical design materials, bibliographic material and construction in our project. You can also contact us at our email and phone number if you have another type of help you can offer.

Contacto:

aerodesignusblitoral@gmail.com

Twitter: @aerodesignusbsl 

Whatssap:+58 416-3419218, +58 416 4255042

Skype: aerodesignusblitoral 

+5804163419218

Line: +58 412 9777175

BBM: 21233480   y  798B33A7

Camuri Grande, Estado Vargas,  Venezuela.

_________________________________________________________________________

Los saludamos un grupo de 20 estudiantes de la Universidad Simón Bolívar Sede Litoral (USB-SL). Solicitamos apoyo a un proyecto tecnológico-académico que llevamos a cabo estudiantes de: tecnología aeronáutica, mecánica, eléctrica, electrónica e ingeniería en mantenimiento. Como grupo Aerodesing SAE USB Sede litoral. Por primera vez, nuestra sede desea representar a la Universidad y a Venezuela en el prestigioso evento “SAE AERO DESIGN BRASIL 2014”, organizado por Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE Int.), a celebrarse en la ciudad de São José Dos Campos, Brasil en octubre de 2014. 

La competencia “SAE Aero Design” es celebrada anualmente en donde las diferentes universidades de América del Sur se dan cita para cumplir una serie de objetivos, el primero de ellos es elaborar una aeronave radio controlada, propulsada a través de un motor eléctrico y construida por estudiantes de la Universidad, la cual tendrá que regirse bajo el reglamento de la competencia SAE BRASIL 2014, en la categoría MICRO, esta aeronave además de volar, tiene que trasladar la máxima cantidad de pelotas de tennis que pueda soportar.

Por primera vez la Sede Litoral de la USB, participara en una competencia de esta categoría e importancia, nuestra meta es demostrar nuestros conocimiento y superarnos a través de la experiencia para dejar un legado a el futuro estudiantil que desee continuar con nuestro proyecto en futuras competencias, destacamos que es una labor motivada en la mística y pasión por nuestro sueño de representar a nuestro país, sobretodo a nuestro estado vargas y sede litoral USB, que esta en crecimiento, queremos dar nuestro empeño en el desarrollo de nuevas tecnologías aeronáuticas que colaboren al desarrollo humano y tecnológico de nuestro entorno social. Y demostrar que este tipo de tecnología puede colaborar en distintos avances tanto tecnológicos, de reconocimiento, cinematográficos, turismo y conservación del medio ambiente siempre que se le de un buen uso a este tipo de tecnología. 

Nos despedimos no sin antes invitarle a que colaboren con nosotros y si no pueden ayudarnos de forma económica podemos aceptar materiales aeronáuticos de diseño, bibliográfico y de construcción en nuestro proyecto. También pueden consultarnos a nuestro correo y números de teléfonos si tienen otro tipo de ayuda que nos puedan ofrecer. 


Contacto:

aerodesignusblitoral@gmail.com

Twitter: @aerodesignusbsl 

Whatssap:+58 416-3419218, +58 416 4255042

Skype: aerodesignusblitoral 

+5804163419218

Line: +58 412 9777175

BBM: 21233480   y   798B33A7

Camuri Grande, Estado Vargas,  Venezuela.

can offer.Contacto:aerodesignusblitoral@gmail.comTwitter: @aerodesignusbsl Whatssap:+58 416-3419218, +58 416 4255042Skype: aerodesignusblitoral +5804163419218Line: +58 412 9777175BBM: 21233480   y  798B33A7Camuri Grande, Estado Vargas,  Venezuela._________________________________________________________________________Los saludamos un grupo de 20 estudiantes de la Universidad Simón Bolívar Sede Litoral (USB-SL). 
Solicitamos apoyo a un proyecto tecnológico-académico que llevamos a cabo estudiantes de: tecnología aeronáutica, mecánica, eléctrica, electrónica e ingeniería en mantenimiento. Como grupo Aerodesing SAE USB Sede litoral.
Por primera vez, nuestra sede desea representar a la Universidad y a Venezuela en el prestigioso evento “SAE AERO DESIGN BRASIL 2014”, organizado por Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE Int.), a celebrarse en la ciudad de São José Dos Campos, Brasil en octubre de 2014. La competencia “SAE Aero Design” es celebrada anualmente en donde las diferentes universidades de América del Sur se dan cita para cumplir una serie de objetivos, el primero de ellos es elaborar una aeronave radio controlada, propulsada a través de un motor eléctrico y construida por estudiantes de la Universidad, la cual tendrá que regirse bajo el reglamento de la competencia SAE BRASIL 2014, en la categoría MICRO, esta aeronave además de volar, tiene que trasladar la máxima cantidad de pelotas de tennis que   pueda soportar.Por primera vez la Sede Litoral de la USB, participara en una competencia de esta categoría e importancia, nuestra meta es demostrar nuestros conocimiento y superarnos a través de la experiencia para dejar un legado a el futuro estudiantil que desee continuar con nuestro proyecto en futuras competencias, destacamos que es una labor motivada en la mística y pasión por nuestro sueño de representar a nuestro país, sobretodo a nuestro estado vargas y sede litoral USB, que esta en crecimiento, queremos dar nuestro empeño en el desarrollo de nuevas tecnologías aeronáuticas que colaboren al desarrollo humano y tecnológico de nuestro entorno social. 
Y demostrar que este tipo de tecnología puede colaborar en distintos avances tanto tecnológicos, de reconocimiento, cinematográficos, turismo y conservación del medio ambiente siempre que se le de un buen uso a este tipo de tecnología. Nos despedimos no sin antes invitarle a que colaboren con nosotros y si no pueden ayudarnos de forma económica podemos aceptar materiales aeronáuticos de diseño, bibliográfico y de construcción en nuestro proyecto. También pueden consultarnos a nuestro correo y números de teléfonos si tienen otro tipo de ayuda que nos puedan ofrecer. Contacto:aerodesignusblitoral@gmail.comTwitter: @aerodesignusbsl Whatssap:+58 416-3419218, +58 416 4255042Skype: aerodesignusblitoral +5804163419218Line: +58 412 9777175BBM: 21233480   y   798B33A7Camuri Grande, Estado Vargas,  Venezuela.

story:
My name is Andrew. I'm a photographer living in Greensboro, NC. My wife's name is Lindsey. She is an incredible event coordinator and she also stays at home to raise our sweet daughter, Sybil. 

We are passionate about people, justice, and love...and we love seeing all three come together in unexpected places.


We are headed to Hyderabad, India this January in order to shoot and produce a book of portraits. The book will visually tell the heartbreaking stories of several young children, teenagers and adults who have been rejected and orphaned by their families at a young age. Our hopes are, that through this project, we will be able to meet these people and share their unheard stories, revealing a life of heartbreak, trial, and a hope within them that overcomes it all. We seek to show God's love to them and also help further fund the efforts of the orphanage where they live.

Through the production of this book, we hope to also create an awareness of the reality of orphanhood worldwide, show the beauty of the Indian culture, and display the glory of what God is doing in the hearts of His children. Which brings me to my next point:

We need your help! The only way we can accomplish this project is with you by our side.

View more photos from our trip in 2007 



What We Need and How You Benefit

- We need money for the plane tickets to Hyderabad. We also need to purchase a mobile light kit for shooting the portraits. Lastly, the remainder of the money we bring in will go to the cost of producing/printing the books for YOU :)

- We're giving away awesome prizes if you can help get us there!

  • Full copy of the portrait book in iBook/PDF format
  • 8X10 Soft Cover Portrait Book (Book ships to U.S. only)
  • iPad Mini Retina, 16GB Wifi, Space Grey
  • iPad Air 16GB Wifi, Space Grey
  • MacBook Air 13" 


- This project impacts the future of India. After these kids turn 18 years old, they are sent back out into India as missionaries of the Gospel of Jesus. This project may help more people come to know Jesus through these powerful testimonies.

- Please believe in us and our passion for this project! We believe investing in us and the people we'll be encountering will be worth your while, now and eternally.


Even if you cannot contribute financially, help by sharing.

- SHARE this campaign on Facebook and Twitter to help us get funded so we can make this happen. (Copy and paste this link)

- Pray for our team in preparation for the trip and while we are in India.

story:
Thank you to everyone who contributed to and  helped spread the word about our campaign. These funds are crucial to helping Stellaris develop our next product. If you are still interested in purchasing a ClearCharge, you can do so on our website:

http://www.stellarissolar.com/clearpower/clearcharge.php

 

Who We Are 

Stellaris is a small solar energy company located in Massachusetts. At Stellaris, we have a very different approach to making solar modules, which greatly reduces the cost of solar energy. Our module is made entirely of plastic, with small lenses that focus light onto solar cells. Not only is the plastic cheaper than conventional construction, but also the lenses reduce the amount of solar cells needed almost threefold.With this technology, Stellaris hopes to make solar energy more affordable for everyone. 

Our Mission

Stellaris’s overall goal is to make cheap and efficient solar modules to power your homes and offices. However, as a tiny startup, we just can't jump into the mainstream and compete with billion dollar solar module manufacturers. So we decided to start small, making consumer electronic products with our technology with a plan to evolve into other products with larger markets. 

 

The ClearCharge

Our first product is the Stellaris ClearCharge, a solar USB power supply. It can be used to charge all low voltage devices, such as cell phones, e-readers, and MP3 players. The ClearCharge allows for convenient charging in your home, or while outside. The ClearCharge is great for outdoor trips where an outlet might not be available, such as trips to the beach, camping, or all day sporting events. In addition to conveientce, the ClearCharge is doing its part to help the enviornment by using only solar power.

What We Need and Why You Should Contribute

Right now, we are making our solar chargers in our lab.  Each charger is currently made by hand. This process is great for learning about our devices and reducing assembly time and cost, which will be important when we have prefected the product enough to move into automated assembly. 

This is where you come in. A contribution from you will allow for us to continue making improvements to ClearCharge. With your contribution, you will receive your very own ClearCharge. Not only will the ClearCharge be convenient for charging away from outlets, but by using it, you will be doing your enviornmental duty by using less fossil fuel power. 

Even if our goal is not reached completely, any contribution you make can help us continue to improve ClearCharge and Stellaris's technology. 

 Future Directions

While we are quite fond of our novelty solar USB charger, Stellaris is excited for the day when our technology will be able to power buildings. After ClearCharge, Stellaris already has two products on the drawing board: Photovoltaic tiles for windows and rooftop solar modules. Though the most revolutionary concept of Stellaris’s technology is the ability to use only 1/3 of the amount of photovoltaic material, Stellaris products are also made of inexpensive plastic. This not only reduces the cost, but also reduces the cost of roof installation, as the product is light and can be more easily installed.

Impact

Stellaris is proud of the impact that our technology will have on both the solar and alternative energy markets. Because our products are so inexpensive, solar energy will now be an option to families and companies who could not initially afford it. Additionally, because our products can be mounted on windows, solar will also available to consumers who previously could not purchase solar because a roof was not an option. 

Stellaris is excited to play a part in increasing the availability of solar energy and playing our part to help the environment, and we hope you are too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute to Stellaris financially, you can still help by spreading the word.

You can like our facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Stellaris-Corpor...

And of course you can share our Indegogo page using the Indegogo share tools.

FAQ

Does the ClearCharge work inside?

Yes, the ClearCharge works inside, when hung on a window. However, like all solar products,  it works better outside, as any material such as window glass decreases the efficiency of the module.

Does the ClearCharge work when there is no sun?

Yes. The ClearCharge comes equipped with 3 rechargeable batteries, so even if the sky becomes overcast, your electronics can continue to be charged with no delay. When the sun comes out again, it returns the batteries back to full charge.

 

Our Team

Jim Paull- Founder & CEO

Head of technology for Stellaris Corporation and inventor of Stellaris’ core technology. Over seventeen years as president and head of technology at Industrial Energy Corporation. Seven years as independent consultant specializing in electric utility energy conservation and efficiency analysis. Holds five patents in solar energy, solar power electronics and energy recovery. MS degrees from Tufts University and University of Massachusetts; AB and BE degrees from Dartmouth College.

Peter Morse- Senior Engineer

Senior engineer concentrating on product design, construction of jgs and fixtures for manual assembly.  Seven years experience at Evergreen Solar.Principal Module Area Engineer, defined machines, procedures and panel tolerances for 75MW Fort Devens, MA, PV factory.  Designed, built and debugged second generation machines at Marlborough, MA factory. BS, Mechanical Engineering, Tufts University


James Paull- Operations Manager

With a background in human resources for high end consultants in medical device, pharmaceutical, nuclear, aerospace and other industries, James oversees Stellaris’  materials procurement, establishing and maintaining vendor relationships, accounting, human resources, IT coordination, managing intellectual property and technical applications. BA, in English from University of Massachusetts Lowell.


Jackie Brew- Intern

Currently an undergraduate at Massachusetts Institute of Technology, majoring in Chemical Engineering and minoring in Energy Studies, due to graduate in 2014. Primary roles: dicing, soldering and testing of silicon cells, improving fixtures as precursor to automated assembly, and some public relations. Prior to Stellaris, Jackie worked in a chemical engineering laboratory at MIT studying a biofuel cell.

story:
[ Für einen deutschen Text bitte nach unten scrollen! ]

The Future of 3D Printing!

Imagine an interactive kiosk device where you just go to and get the object of your choice - similar to a StarTrek Replicator!

  • Print your objects from smart phone, tablet, USB key or network
  • OR draw&design models ad-hoc and get the physical object immediately!
The future of 3D printing will be a large multi-function unit in your area. Around the corner, in a shopping mall for example - always ready and easy to use.

In Person

My name is Ingo. I'm a computer engineer and software developer, living in Jena, Thuringia, Germany. In 2006, during my study at the TU Berlin we built a 3D foam cutter in a student project StyroFoamRobot. We also developed an interactive desktop program to easily design objects by their rotationally shape. There is also a project report available which is in German.

 

  

 

Help to fund the contruction of a new 3D Foam Cutter!

Large, precise, fast - simply better!

The Perks

For 10€
you get a lovely Thank-You card by mail! Pictures of it follow at this place soon! Stay tuned, Register at indiegogo and add the project as favorite to get updates!

 
 

For 25€
you get the Berlin TV Tower in raw material or in a color of your choice (for 35€)! It's approximately 20cm tall. A Thank-You card by mail is included, of course!

 
 

For 50€
you get the Puppy in raw material or in a color of your choice (for 75€)! It's approximately 20cm in size. A Thank-You card by mail is included, of course!

 

Available colors

white black yellow orange red violet purple light blue blue

If you like to get another color or perk object, from the videos for example, just let me know! Nearly everything is possible!

To thank you for the long-term all supporters get benefits for future offers by the project!

Help to Fund the Required Materials!

You can do this by

  • claiming one or more perks of your choice! They already include international shipping, if needed. It costs nothing extra. The perks will be made and shipped as soon as the device is functional or if a possibility arises to make the objects with another device. It is difficult to pin the date but it should be possible until Christmas 2012 - I keep you updated.
  • sharing this campaign and spreading the word! Just emailing this video to 10 friends, reposting on your Facebook page, or Tweeting about it could make a significant difference.

Funding Use

The funding will be used to develop and construct a stable device for development and to make objects, of course!

If there is more

Additional funding will be used to make the foam cutter accessible by anyone. A website will be created to let everyone design and order objects. If there is even more funding it will be used for hardware development, as well as tests and planning for a larger cutter because there are no size restrictions with polystyrene foam.

Found a favorite perk?

Did you tell your friends about the project?

Thank you very much for your attention and best regards!

[Please note if the payment fails with a newly created Paypal-Account without credit card: As stated by the Paypal-Hotline in most cases the first transaction works only with a balance which was transferred from your bank account first or by transfer from another Paypal-Account.]

Die Zukunft des 3D-Drucks!

Stell dir ein interaktives Kioskgerät vor, zu dem du einfach gehst und dir ein Objekt deiner Wahl erstellen lässt - wie bei einem StarTrek-Replikator!

  • Drucke deine Objekte von Smartphone, Tablet, USB-Stick oder WiFi
  • ODER entwerfe&zeichne sie direkt am Gerät und erhalte sie sofort!

Die Zukunft des 3D-Druck wird ein größeres Multi-Funktionsgerät in deiner Nähe sein. Um die Ecke, zum Beispiel in einem Einkaufszentrum - immer bereit und einfach zu nutzen.

In Person

Mein Name ist Ingo. Ich bin Computer-Ingenieur und Software-Entwickler und lebe in Jena, Thüringen, Deutschland. Während meines Studium an der TU-Berlin im Jahr 2006, bauten wir einen 3D-Styroporschneider: StyroFoamRobot. Wir entwickelten auch ein interaktives Desktop-Programm mit dem man sehr einfach 3D-Objekte entwerfen kann auf Basis ihrer Rotations-Kontur. Vom Projekt gibt es auch einen Projektbericht in deutsch.

 

  

 

Unterstütze die Konstruktion eines neuen 3D Styroporschneiders!

Größer, genauer, schneller - einfach besser!

Als Dankeschön

Ab 10€
bekommst du eine kreativ gestaltete Dankeschön-Karte per Post! Bilder dazu gibt es zeitnah an dieser Stelle! Bleibe gespannt, melde dich bei indiegogo an und füge das Projekt als Favorit hinzu, um Updates zu erhalten!

 
 

Ab 25€
bekommst du den Berliner Fernsehturm in Rohmaterial oder in einer Farbe deiner Wahl (ab 35€)! Er hat eine Höhe von etwa 20cm. Eine Dankeschön-Karte gehört natürlich auch dazu!

 
 

Ab 50€
bekommst du das kleine Hündchen in Rohmaterial oder in einer Farbe deiner Wahl (ab 75€)! Er hat eine Größe von etwa 20cm. Eine Dankeschön-Karte gehört natürlich auch dazu!

 

Available colors

weiß schwarz gelb orange rot violett lila hellblau blau

Wenn du dir eine andere Farbe oder ein anderes Dankeschön-Objekt wünschst, zum Beispiel aus den Videos, dann lass' es mich wissen! Fast alles ist möglich!

Als langfristiges Dankeschön erhalten alle Spender Vorteile bei zukünftigen Angeboten aus dem Projekt!

Helfe das benötigte Material zu finanzieren!

Das kannst du tun indem

  • du ein oder mehrere Dankeschöns deiner Wahl auswählst und anforderst! Sie beinhalten bereits internationalen Versand, wenn nötig, keine Extrakosten. Die Dankeschön-Objekte werden erstellt und versendet sobald das neue Gerät funktioniert oder sobald ein Nutzung eines anderen Geräts zustande kommt. Es ist schwierig einen genauen Termin dafür festzulegen, es sollte aber spätestens zu Weihnachten 2012 möglich sein - Ich halte dich auf dem Laufenden.
  • teile die Kampagne und erzähle sie weiter! Das Video einfach nur an 10 deiner Freunde zu senden, auf Facebook zu posten oder zu twittern macht einen gewaltigen Unterschied!

Verwendung der Finanzierung

Der gesammelte Betrag wird genutzt um ein stabiles und benutzbaren Styroporschneider zu entwickeln und zu bauen - und natürlich um Objekte zu schneiden!

Wenn es mehr wird

Zusätzliche Mittel werden verwendet um den Styroporschneider jedem zugänglich zu machen. Eine Webseite wird erstellt, auf der jeder Objekte entwerfen, zeichnen und bestellen kann. Weitere Finanzierung wird verwendet um die Hardware des Geräts weiterzuentwickeln und einen größeren Schneider zu planen, da es keine Größenbeschränkungen gibt bei der Verwendung von Polystyrolschaum (Styropor).

Bereits ein Lieblingsobjekt gefunden?

Deinen Freunden schon vom Projekt erzählt?

Vielen Dank für die Aufmerksamkeit und beste Grüße!

[Hinweis wenn die Zahlung mit einem neu eröffneten Paypal-Konto ohne Kreditkarte nicht klappt: Laut Paypal-Hotline kann die erste Transaktion nur mit einem Guthaben durchgeführt werden, das entweder per Überweisung an Paypal oder von einem anderen Paypal-Konto gesendet wurde.]

In Person
 Mein Name ist Ingo. Ich bin Computer-Ingenieur und Software-Entwickler und lebe in Jena, Thüringen, Deutschland. Während meines Studium an der TU-Berlin im Jahr 2006, bauten wir einen 3D-Styroporschneider: StyroFoamRobot. Wir entwickelten auch ein interaktives Desktop-Programm mit dem man sehr einfach 3D-Objekte entwerfen kann auf Basis ihrer Rotations-Kontur. Vom Projekt gibt es auch einen Projektbericht in deutsch.
 
  
 
Unterstütze die Konstruktion eines neuen 3D Styroporschneiders!
Größer, genauer, schneller - einfach besser!
Als Dankeschön
Ab 10€bekommst du eine kreativ gestaltete Dankeschön-Karte per Post! Bilder dazu gibt es zeitnah an dieser Stelle! Bleibe gespannt, melde dich bei indiegogo an und füge das Projekt als Favorit hinzu, um Updates zu erhalten!
 

 

Ab 25€bekommst du den Berliner Fernsehturm in Rohmaterial oder in einer Farbe deiner Wahl (ab 35€)! Er hat eine Höhe von etwa 20cm. Eine Dankeschön-Karte gehört natürlich auch dazu!
 

 

Ab 50€bekommst du das kleine Hündchen in Rohmaterial oder in einer Farbe deiner Wahl (ab 75€)! Er hat eine Größe von etwa 20cm. Eine Dankeschön-Karte gehört natürlich auch dazu!
 
Available colors
weiß schwarz gelb orange rot violett lila hellblau blau
Wenn du dir eine andere Farbe oder ein anderes Dankeschön-Objekt wünschst, zum Beispiel aus den Videos, dann lass' es mich wissen! Fast alles ist möglich!
Als langfristiges Dankeschön erhalten alle Spender Vorteile bei zukünftigen Angeboten aus dem Projekt!

Helfe das benötigte Material zu finanzieren!
Das kannst du tun indem


du ein oder mehrere Dankeschöns deiner Wahl auswählst und anforderst! Sie beinhalten bereits internationalen Versand, wenn nötig, keine Extrakosten. Die Dankeschön-Objekte werden erstellt und versendet sobald das neue Gerät funktioniert oder sobald ein Nutzung eines anderen Geräts zustande kommt. Es ist schwierig einen genauen Termin dafür festzulegen, es sollte aber spätestens zu Weihnachten 2012 möglich sein - Ich halte dich auf dem Laufenden.

teile die Kampagne und erzähle sie weiter! Das Video einfach nur an 10 deiner Freunde zu senden, auf Facebook zu posten oder zu twittern macht einen gewaltigen Unterschied!


Verwendung der Finanzierung
Der gesammelte Betrag wird genutzt um ein stabiles und benutzbaren Styroporschneider zu entwickeln und zu bauen - und natürlich um Objekte zu schneiden!
Wenn es mehr wird
Zusätzliche Mittel werden verwendet um den Styroporschneider jedem zugänglich zu machen. Eine Webseite wird erstellt, auf der jeder Objekte entwerfen, zeichnen und bestellen kann. Weitere Finanzierung wird verwendet um die Hardware des Geräts weiterzuentwickeln und einen größeren Schneider zu planen, da es keine Größenbeschränkungen gibt bei der Verwendung von Polystyrolschaum (Styropor).
Bereits ein Lieblingsobjekt gefunden?
Deinen Freunden schon vom Projekt erzählt?
Vielen Dank für die Aufmerksamkeit und beste Grüße!
[Hinweis wenn die Zahlung mit einem neu eröffneten Paypal-Konto ohne Kreditkarte nicht klappt: Laut Paypal-Hotline kann die erste Transaktion nur mit einem Guthaben durchgeführt werden, das entweder per Überweisung an Paypal oder von einem anderen Paypal-Konto gesendet wurde.]

story:
THE SUMMARY

In the early days of my career I trained as a paramedic and disaster response technician. This experience convinced me that my vocational path was destined to help prepare people for life in big cities.

I started my business over a decade ago driven by a desire to help people foster an authentic sense of belonging and deeper social connection to the urban environment. Urban Expeditions brings to market customizable 4-hour city tours and experiential games that make learning about cultural diversity fun and engaging.

We currently live in an age where 50% of the planet's human population live in cities. At the same time, the travel and tourism industry represent almost 10% of the global GDP. Now more than ever, I feel there’s a need for our brand of urban travel service that helps provide thoughtful cultural immersion.

 

 

 

THE ASK AND THE PLAN

I'm trying to raise at least $125,000 to achieve 3 key business goals over the next 12 months. Primarily, I aim to expand our experience architecture into 5 new North American cities including San Francisco, Miami,  Seattle, Phoenix and Vancouver. I'll also optimize our local marketing efforts and hire up to seven part-time staff. An outlying 2018 goal is to assemble an influential panel of 5 travel industry advisors who can steer Urban Expeditions toward global sustainability within the next 36 months.

A capital injection of $125,000 will help Urban Expeditions become more competitive in the global tourism marketplace. Our team will use a total of $25,000 to leverage marketing efforts that put a premium on acquiring local cultural knowledge and experience.  These activities include targeted social media advertising and public relations activities for not-for-profits, universities and corporate groups. 

Up to $75,000 will be used to hire and train new staff. These human resources will be cultivated from university hospitality and tourism programs. This allows us to help move the concept of formal education in tourism beyond hotel and restaurant management and assist students in building relevant professional networks in their local community.

The balance of the crowdfunding, or $25,000, will be used for product and service development. This includes traveling to the five new North American cities mentioned above, conferencing, networking and producing the framework for up to 20 new city tours and experiential games.

Your investment in this project will help people learn about new cities and urban cultures quickly, safely and from a first person perspective. You should consider your financial contribution as paying-it-forward for your next urban adventure. Because, as one of our incredible crowd-funders, you'll be entitled to participate in any city tour or experiential game in ANY city we serve.

 

 

 

HOW WE BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY

All to often, the unintended circumstance of living in the city is the emotional stress due to social pressures and the cost of living. This stress can have an adverse impact on a person's mental health.

Urban Expeditions benefits the community by creating practical opportunities for youth, adults and seniors that combine health and wellness with dynamic learning. Our city tour and game service encourages people of all ages to get outside, stay physically fit and have fun experiencing the advantages of cultural diversity.

We're not tour guides. We're brokers of practical local information. We separate this information into 4 categories and create a series of 4-hour grassroots experiences. Each 4-hour experience is designed to  reduce social barriers and transform our customers into locals as quickly as possible. 

Over the years, we've designed exciting activities that showcase local heritage, promote student success and enhance the outreach efforts of charitable organizations. In 2017, our city tours and experiential games drove almost 4000 people through a network of 100 local businesses.

 

 

 

 

 

 

THE CURRENT MARKETPLACE

Urban Expeditions uses technology to share information about our services, conduct point-of-sale transactions and monitor the quality of our experiences. But the two most exciting ways in which we use technology is game play and city tour customization. 

Our experiential game Unlockthecity uses a digital game-board and social media to help players explore the city and score points for a chance to win great prizes. We also use a digital passport to help our city tour guests customize their own urban adventures from the comfort of home or office. Both digital assets use the Google Maps platform to help create the experience architecture. Customers can access the Urban Expeditions online experience by linking to our website, our Facebook page, TripAdvisor property and via the Airbnb experience platform.

 

 

Urban Expeditions is currently based in Toronto, but we also offer city tour and Unlockthecity game experiences in Ottawa, Montreal, New York  and Las Vegas.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Our greatest business challenge is time. It takes approximately 250 hours to produce each experiential game and 400 hours to cast each city tour. There are few efficiencies we can leverage when distilling the authenticity of our experiences because our value proposition is customization. I've discovered that automation can be counterproductive when producing  genuine cultural experiences.  

Our chemistry of success is found in the way we blend technology with practical opportunities  to show our customers what takes place beyond a city's main attractions. Companies like Airbnb present the greatest challenge to our business model because of how they use their proprietary technology to retail accommodations, experiences and now restaurant bookings. We overcame this obstacle by becoming a part of their platform.

Our city tours and experiential games are not expensive bucket-list activities that our customers actively save their money for over a period of time. We offer an affordable service that enhances the local urban lifestyle.

 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Thanks for taking the time to consider this crowd-funding proposal. You can continue to help this initiative by spreading the word on your social media networks, commenting on what you think we could do better and, of course - investing some money.

Over the last few years, an incredible amount of effort has gone into producing our socially innovative prototypes and now it's time to conduct a fitting launch. Our experiential formula removes cultural barriers, promotes relevant urban activities and empowers people from all walks of life to get outside, stay active and engage the city.

The notable physician and entrepreneur Dr. John Evans was once quoted as saying that 'a brilliant idea in isolation is not enough to create a real breakthough.' I need your support. I hope that this campaign will start a conversation related to how we reflect on our history and value the uniqueness of each other.

If we inherit the earth from our parents and borrow it from the children, then the limited time that we spend in between should be used to join the two in a positive cultural narrative. Our city tour and game experiences do just that. Be part of the movement.

 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

Life in the big city can be relentless and uncompromising. This is why Urban Expeditions exists: to help make the human experience a bit easier. Like the first explorers who created maps and charts so that others may follow. Because, one day you may feel just as intimidated by the thriving metropolis as your grand parents who've watched the city expand around them.

story:
No Lights No Lycra Perth – keep us cool, keep us loud.

No Lights No Lycra (NLNL) is a weekly lights-off dance jam in the dark for the pure joy of dancing. It’s a place to shake out the stresses of the week, let go of your inhibitions and completely be yourself. It began in Melbourne in 2009, and has now spread to over 60 locations around the globe! NLNL provides a judgement-free space in the dark for you to dance. Some dance for fitness, some to dance out their stress, some to belong to something, and some just to let loose and express themselves!

At NLNL Perth, we need to keep things cool, and keep things loud. We dance like no-one is watching (because no-one is!) and that means we get HOT! Due to changes at our venue, we require some industrial fans to keep us cool over the coming hot Perth nights. We are also in desperate need of an upgrade to our sound system to make sure our music is LOUD - without leaving with ears ringing. It is vital that we provide these upgrades to ensure the vibrant and dynamic nature of the Perth NLNL community can continue to thrive, while making sure our dance space is safe and comfortably cool.

At NLNL we keep entry fees low (only $7 a session!) so that cost isn't a barrier if you want to boogie. This is why, instead of raising fees to cover these upgrades, we're reaching out through crowd-funding for some extra help. We know our wider community is vibrant, enthusiastic and generous, and can see the value of a good dance in the dark!

What We Need & What You Get

After looking high and low for the best deals out there, we are seeking to raise $3000. About half of this will be used to purchase a quality sound system consisting of two JBL powered speakers, cables and a Behringer mixer to produce the best beats and smoothest tones at the best volume to keep our ears safe and our bodies pumping!

Speaking of bodies pumping, the venue we dance in is big, and we cram in around 50-60 people each week. We dance with the doors closed to keep the light out and the sound in, and with that many people shimmying in the dark, the temperature goes off the hook! So, the other half of the funds will purchase 6 industrial fans to ensure we are kept cool whilst busting a move.

So, what's in it for you? We have a bunch of perks awaiting your donation! Perks range from $5 to $800, and in return for your donation you can get awesome treats like free entry to NLNL (even for life!), a private NLNL session for you and your crew, and the chance to guest playlist at an NLNL session! Most of our perks include a public shout-out on our social media pages, because we'd love to acknowledge your donation - however, we get that some of you may want to donate quietly, so we'll contact you first to make sure it's okay before shouting our thanks.



The Impact

No Lights No Lycra provides a safe, all-inclusive, drug and alcohol free space for all walks of life to belong and participate in an activity that leaves you feeling exhilarated! The darkness creates a certain kind of magic that forces you to forget about what you or the people around you look like, so that your brain can shut off and your body can move with the beat.

The upgrades to our equipment that your donation helps to fund means we can continue to provide this space. We have built up a strong base of dancers who rely on this weekly release for a healthy mind and healthy body. We believe the community needs places like this, for people of all ages to come together and get back in touch with the notion of playing, of moving how you feel, and all of the lovely chemicals that make your brain zing when participating in activities like this.

Your hugely valued contribution contributes to a global movement of dancing in the dark, and a local community dancing like no-one’s watching.



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it’s not always the best time to be parting with your cash. If you feel as passionately as we do about this, please share our campaign on social media, tell your friends and family and neighbours and pets about us, help us get the word out any way you like (sky-writing especially appreciated) - anything you can do to support this cause means the world to us!

Want to know more about No Lights No Lycra?

Check out this story from The 7:30 Report from last year for a bit more insight on just what happens at these events!

story:
ABOUT

What is that tripod device that drone racers use?

That's called a ground station, it's used for getting better reception in what are called 'multi-pathing' environments where you have a lot of racers on similar channels and interference affecting video reception.  They aren't required for most flyers who try to stay mobile, the goggles have a receiver in them and so does the controller.

How long does it take to charge up the batteries?

Battery charging will take about 20-30 minutes per battery, you can charge faster but there a risk you will be shortening the battery life.  Most racers have 10 or more batteries so once they charge up at home they have hours of flying in the field.

How long is the flight time?

Flight time on most racing drones is between 3 and 8 minutes depending on how aggressive you are flying.  You will find this feels like a long time because of the adrenaline rush, and a rest will be required to calm your nerves.

What's the maximum range? 

Maximum 'control' range starts at about 1-2km, you can upgrade to a crossfire TX and increase your maximum range to up to 100km of theoretical control.   There is also 'video' range, so at max power the video transmitter on the atom is capable of 5km or more with standard antennas.    Battery range is another factor, the Atom is estimated to be able to fly between 2-3 km's and back before running out of battery. Range is dependent on clear line of sight, so make sure you are not flying behind too many large dense objects or you may lose video/control or both and have what's called a "failsafe" event where your drone will disarm and power down as a safety measure.  Most drone racing or recreational flying happens within a few hundred metres of the pilot, and most countries have rules against flying beyond visual line of sight.

What is the Owner's Pack? Specifically, what are the carbon fiber frame, canopy, camera mounts, triumph antenna, and mounts?

The Owners Pack is for owners of the original V1 Atom, and you can see these pieces on the pictures and renders of the Atom V2 everywhere on the site.

The Carbon Fiber Frame is the main black plate that everything secures to, the canopy is the poly carbonate shell that protects the electronics, the camera mounts hold the FPV camera in place and at desired angles inside the canopy.  The triumph antenna is the FPV/Video antenna on the back/top with the bulb on top, this transmits your video in a circularly polarized fashion allowing it good penetration of objects.  The triumph mount is the bracket and cable that the antenna uses to bolt into the canopy itself, which then in turn connects to the video transmitter in the brain of the Atom, via a special flexible antenna cable.

- Can the drone fly stable and still in the same spot or is it more geared towards flying forward and fast?

The Atom is designed for manual control and surfing the skies, but it can be hovered in position just not automatically via GPS.  We recommend practice and then you will simply be able to put the Atom in any position in the sky you wish.  By using a camera angle mount with very low degree of angle you will be able to hold position quite well, or by flying in what's called "Line of Sight" or "LOS" mode, meaning you watch the drone as you control it rather than using the FPV equipment to see what it sees.

How do you take photos? (Example, selling a house) Do you have to take a Screenshot after you play the HD recorded video?

The HD camera can record to an SD Card, and capable of taking up to 2K resolution video, meaning you would be able to take high resolution individual frames from the video at around 4 megapixels.

Why Crowdfunding if you are already selling the Atom V1?

RotorX was formed by a small group of FPV pilots/friends that got together regularly to fly for fun, it wasn’t long before we wanted to see how small we could make an FPV racing drone to let us fly in more places than our larger, expensive, noisy and fragile drones could handle.  Our experience as pilots and technical ability as engineers and designers put us in the unique position of being able to design products that were so far ahead of the curve that we were regularly called crazy and dreamers.  Fast forward 12 months and RotorX motors and propellers are some of the most heavily cloned drone products in the market.  RotorX micro drones the RX155 raiju and RX122 atom have led a trend in the community towards smaller safer racing drones, that was recently validated by the FAA ruling on no registration required for drones less than 250grams.  Our lack of an international distribution network and financing to create large volumes of our cutting edge designs left the door open for an army of zombie cloning companies that wanted to capitalize on our popularity and designs.  We need Indiegogo to help us keep creating next level products while also pushing down costs to the customer, so that more people can afford to get into drone racing safely and share in the amazing experience of being a FPV drone pilot.  Whether it is for racing competitively, with friends or just for fun!


What flight modes does the Atom V2 racer come with?

Because the Atom is designed for many different skill levels, the default mode will have low power self leveling flight mode that is a good starting point for getting used to the basic controls.  There will be several pre-programmed switches for intermediate and advanced levels of flight that will allow you to really surf the skies and race if you so desire.


Does the Atom V2 have GPS, Return to Home, Follow me mode and Wi-Fi control to my smartphone?

The simple answer is NO to all of those, for many reasons that we will try to explain.  You don’t have to look very hard to find drones that have had situations where these “automated” control modes have failed, and there are many ways they can fail.  Solar flares, poorly designed hardware/software, cloud cover, and obstacles like trees and mountains are just a few of the reason why even the most expensive GPS controlled drones are susceptible to “fly-aways” let alone the cheap, low quality - but affordable - ripoffs, that flood the market.  At RotorX we feel like why should we rely so heavily on a system so proven to fail so often? Why should a robot have all the fun of flying?  The Atom, like most pure racing drones, lets you fly in what’s called manual/rate/acro mode meaning you are absolutely in control of every movement that the drone makes, and as soon as that control link is broken the drone is no longer able to operate (called failsafe) without you, a human.  How can you fly like a bird if you are using waypoints or a smartphone? These flight modes give the operator a false sense of security about their skill level and their drones reliability/handling.  Wi-Fi controlled drones have an incredibly short control range, and extremely delayed video stream that makes FPV piloting clumsy and impractical for racing.


What differences are there between the Atom V1 and Atom V2 Racer?

The Atom V1 was launched on RCGroups exactly 1 year ago, and the discussion about it has now over 10000 comments and half a million views.  The V1 Atom was the first of it’s kind and required a complicated mix of over 10 individual components from different suppliers designed for much larger racing drones, meaning assembly of the Atom V1 takes around 5-10 HOURS of complicated soldering, setup and assembly, meaning only the most advanced drone builders could attempt to put them together as intended.  The Atom V2 Racer requires less than 30 minutes of assembly, and comes preconfigured and set up for operation as soon as it’s plugged together, the DIY kit only requires soldering of the motors to the central brain, and the RTF kit obviously is fully assembled and tuned for perfect flight.


Why should I buy an RotorX Atom Racer over any other drone?

Very rarely does a drone come along that is this easy to use, upgrade and enjoy at a reasonable price while also being made from the highest quality components currently available.  The Atom is designed to be safe enough to learn to fly on, while quiet enough to fly without causing undue disruption to your surrounding area, meaning you can fly away from people and private property purely for fun without fear of disturbing anyone.  Additionally the Atom is a platform that is as durable as a drone should be, not just surviving many crashes without even needing to replace a propeller, but a drone that could last a lifetime if taken care of with minimal maintenance.  The modular design allows part replacement in minutes with no soldering!  When you are ready the Atom V2 is a racing machine, especially if built in the PRO configuration for ultra fast racing or carrying the HD Camera.


What kind of HD Camera is in the upgrade package?

RotorX has designed a custom HD camera solution that will only work on the Atom V2 Racer, unfortunately because it is not in production yet we can’t share too many details except that it will be extremely light weight, designed to survive crashes, and record 1080p quality video onto a micro SD card.


Why does the RTF kit cost $699 retail? I have seen bigger racing drones online for less.

There are a few things to consider when purchasing a RTF racing drone. Do you have a controller/transmitter? FPV Goggles or groundstation to fly in First Person View? Generally a high quality RTF racing drone with everything needed to get you flying is around $1000. Our kit is comparison is very cost effective, especially for the race calibre quality of the components included.


The Atom costs the same or more than some 250mm sized racing drones. 

Shouldn’t a micro racing drone half the size cost half as much?

This is a common misconception. We have built a drone that performs just as well or better than large, more dangerous racing drones. We have had to develop the same components and high quality electronics into a much smaller package. This in fact increases cost, rather than lessening it, due to the more intricate manufacturing process required to create quality micro and nano scale drone parts


Why should I buy your micro drone, rather than a larger more common 250 sized racing drone?

There are many reasons why a micro racing drone is better than it’s larger counterparts.For Example:

  • Crash resistance - A sub-250gram racing drone has less potential energy, and as such is less likely to cause damage to the drone, or the object it crashes into.

  • Safety - Again due to the smaller size and lighter weight, an Atom is less likely to maim or kill someone if they are unfortunate enough to walk in your path whilst flying. This doesn’t mean it is smart or safe to purposely fly them into other pilots or bystanders

  • Registration - Due to FAA regulations, sub 250gram drones do not require registration by the FAA. Meaning you can buy and fly without having to forgo privacy by having your contact details listed publicly with the FAA.


What does RTF and DIY mean?

RTF means Ready to Fly, meaning the Drone itself is assembled, and a controller is provided meaning that you just need to connect the battery to make it go(after reading the instructions)!  DIY obviously means some assembly required, in this case it’s quite limited.  Do not be too daunted by this, there are hundreds of customers available for guidance and no question is unanswerable.


What does the RTF basic kit come with?

  • Atom V2 Racer
  • Controller with built in FPV screen and video receiver with battery
  • Atom Racer Batteries are not included in product shipment, but you will receive notification of where to purchase batteries locally and cheaply before your drone arrives.  This is due to a recent change in international shipping requirements for Lithium Polymer batteries.

Will we still offer our current RX122 V1 Atom kits?

Yes, but in limited supply, focus will be making Atom V2 parts available before kits are delivered


Is the Atom safe for kids?

Being micro, the Atom is safer than current full sized racing drones. Though it is still a very powerful drone, so we recommend users 14 and above.  The PRO upgrade is really not as beginner friendly at the Racer standard kit using RX1105 motors and propellers


Do I need tools?

With any racing drones, you will eventually need to modify and repair. Basic soldering iron, allen keys, pliers, screw drivers etc will get you out of trouble. Alternately, our Pro bundle comes with a small tool kit.


Where can I get help in building my DIY Atom?

There are many people that will help you with your build online, either provided as a service to build it for you

https://rotorxracing.com/pages/forums-links-to-the-best-places-to-discuss-rotorx-and-engage-with-the-community


Do I need to be an experienced builder to build the Atom DIY?

The DIY Atom is suitable for beginners, but some basic soldering is necessary to install the motors. Even if you get the ready to fly version, it is important to have basic soldering skills in case you need to replace components or want to upgrade to the larger motors in the future.  If you are worried that you can’t solder at all, a post campaign service will be offered to presolder the components.


Why don’t you list the exact electronics? Your tech specs are very vague.

Due to the high volume of companies copying our products. We cannot reveal exact specifications until we have the first actual units delivered to customers.

Who are your partners?

MultiGP - Community based racing league, 300+ chapters worldwide meaning there's always a race near you. http://www.multigp.com/

DRL - Drone Racing League - FPV racing drones. The top pilots in the world. Epic courses. Join us for the entire DRL 2016 Season where we’ll crown the world champion as the best FPV pilot on the planet. http://thedroneracingleague.com/

Fatshark - FPV Goggles - Makers of the best First Person View goggles for drone racing

MQC - The Mini Quad Club is a Facebook group and a great place to share your videos of flight, connect with the worlds best pilots or just find tips and friends to fly with. http://www.facebook.com/groups/miniquadclub 

TBS - Team Blacksheep - Makers of the finest drone racing electronics in the world, masters of radio frequency and efficient long range control and video systems. Without them the Atom v2 wouldn't exist! - http://www.team-blacksheep.com/

TECHNICAL

Atom Racer Frame/canopy:

  • RotorX RX122 Atom V2 3K Carbon Fibre frame

  • Custom molded canopy made out of crash resistant polycarbonate, with interlocking camera mounts

Electronics :

  • RX122 Atom Racer custom stacked electronics

  • STM32 F3 Flight controller running Betaflight/Cleanflight  (Fastest F3 Flight Controller available) - Pre-tuned for the Atom

  • OSD (On Screen Display) displays Battery Voltage, Amps and Timer among other features that allow you to configure you new racing drone.

  • 600TVL CMOS FPV Camera, 120 deg Field of View for optimal view angle

  • Regulated and filtered power for Cam and VTx (5V/12V/VBatt switchable)

  • Buzzer for finding lost models and indicating battery status

  • Addressable LED’s visually display Atom Racer status

  • TBS Unify Pro VTX(25-800mw) with selectable Band Channel and Output power

  • Custom made Silabs F396 ESCs (Electronic speed controllers) Oneshot BlHeli preflashed and calibrated

  • Current Sensor, PDB, and connectors for add-on modules

Motors/Propellers

  • Custom made RotorX RX1105 Brushless motors and RotorX proprietary quiet and powerful propellers (RX2535)

  • Custom RotorX RX1306 Brushless motors (Pro Upgrade) proprietary ultra strong and powerful propellers (RX3040T)


Controller/Transmitter

  • Built for multirotors

  • Goggle port for power & video

  • Easy channel scanning capability to find your video feed

  • 40ch 5.8ghz receiver with FPV screen

  • Built-in 6400mah lithium Ion Battery

  • Built-in Long Range FPV circular polarized antenna

  • JR Module port for maximum compatibility with all protocols

  • USB Chargeable

SHIPPING

  • We plan to start shipping the first batch of DIY kits within 2 months from campaign completion

  • Shipping rates are based on an average to keep it simple and cost effective while still being able to ship worldwide with proper tracking and insurance

  • Perks will be sent with tracking information as soon as ready

  • DIY kits will ship first, followed by RTF packages


CUSTOMER SERVICE

  • RotorX has built a vast network of Atom builder/repairers. There is likely a customer/ repairer located near you to help get your Atom working again if you have any hardware related issues
  • Existing RotorX Reseller network will be able to get you any replacement parts quickly and cheaply if needed, and the modular design of the Atom means you will be able to self repair easily, or ship locally for repairs.
  • Forums - One of the best ways to get assistance with your new Atom is through our well established forums. https://rotorxracing.com/pages/forums-links-to-the-best-places-to-discuss-rotorx-and-engage-with-the-community

Contact support@rotorxracing.com

SAFETY AND REGULATION


General Drone Safety Tips

  • Follow community-based safety guidelines, as developed by organizations such as the Academy of Model Aeronautics (AMA).

  • Fly no higher than 400 feet and remain below any surrounding obstacles when possible.

  • Keep your Atom in eyesight at all times, and use an observer to assist if needed.

  • Remain well clear of and do not interfere with manned aircraft operations, and you must see and avoid other aircraft and obstacles at all times.

  • Do not intentionally fly over unprotected persons or moving vehicles, and remain at least 25 feet away from individuals and vulnerable property.

  • Contact the airport and control tower before flying within five miles of an airport or heliport.

  • Do not fly in adverse weather conditions such as in high winds or reduced visibility.

  • Do not fly under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

  • Ensure the operating environment is safe and that the operator is competent and proficient in the operation of the Atom.

  • Do not fly near or over sensitive infrastructure or property such as power stations, water treatment facilities, correctional facilities, heavily traveled roadways, government facilities, etc.

  • Check and follow all local laws and ordinances before flying over private property.

General personal safety and equipment tips

  • ALWAYS remove propellers when performing routine maintenance on Atom

  • Unplug battery to power down Atom when not flying

  • Always supervise charging of lithium polymer batteries, and preferably charge the batteries in a safe place in case of any potential problems due to battery damage.
story_txt:
ABOUT



What is that tripod device that drone racers use?
That's called a ground station, it's used for getting better reception in what are called 'multi-pathing' environments where you have a lot of racers on similar channels and interference affecting video reception.  They aren't required for most flyers who try to stay mobile, the goggles have a receiver in them and so does the controller.
How long does it take to charge up the batteries?
Battery charging will take about 20-30 minutes per battery, you can charge faster but there a risk you will be shortening the battery life.  Most racers have 10 or more batteries so once they charge up at home they have hours of flying in the field.
How long is the flight time?
Flight time on most racing drones is between 3 and 8 minutes depending on how aggressive you are flying.  You will find this feels like a long time because of the adrenaline rush, and a rest will be required to calm your nerves.
What's the maximum range? 
Maximum 'control' range starts at about 1-2km, you can upgrade to a crossfire TX and increase your maximum range to up to 100km of theoretical control.   There is also 'video' range, so at max power the video transmitter on the atom is capable of 5km or more with standard antennas.    Battery range is another factor, the Atom is estimated to be able to fly between 2-3 km's and back before running out of battery. Range is dependent on clear line of sight, so make sure you are not flying behind too many large dense objects or you may lose video/control or both and have what's called a "failsafe" event where your drone will disarm and power down as a safety measure.  Most drone racing or recreational flying happens within a few hundred metres of the pilot, and most countries have rules against flying beyond visual line of sight.
What is the Owner's Pack? Specifically, what are the carbon fiber frame, canopy, camera mounts, triumph antenna, and mounts?
The Owners Pack is for owners of the original V1 Atom, and you can see these pieces on the pictures and renders of the Atom V2 everywhere on the site.
The Carbon Fiber Frame is the main black plate that everything secures to, the canopy is the poly carbonate shell that protects the electronics, the camera mounts hold the FPV camera in place and at desired angles inside the canopy.  The triumph antenna is the FPV/Video antenna on the back/top with the bulb on top, this transmits your video in a circularly polarized fashion allowing it good penetration of objects.  The triumph mount is the bracket and cable that the antenna uses to bolt into the canopy itself, which then in turn connects to the video transmitter in the brain of the Atom, via a special flexible antenna cable.
- Can the drone fly stable and still in the same spot or is it more geared towards flying forward and fast?
The Atom is designed for manual control and surfing the skies, but it can be hovered in position just not automatically via GPS.  We recommend practice and then you will simply be able to put the Atom in any position in the sky you wish.  By using a camera angle mount with very low degree of angle you will be able to hold position quite well, or by flying in what's called "Line of Sight" or "LOS" mode, meaning you watch the drone as you control it rather than using the FPV equipment to see what it sees.
How do you take photos? (Example, selling a house) Do you have to take a Screenshot after you play the HD recorded video?
The HD camera can record to an SD Card, and capable of taking up to 2K resolution video, meaning you would be able to take high resolution individual frames from the video at around 4 megapixels.

Why Crowdfunding if you are already selling the Atom V1?


RotorX was formed by a small group of FPV pilots/friends that got together regularly to fly for fun, it wasn’t long before we wanted to see how small we could make an FPV racing drone to let us fly in more places than our larger, expensive, noisy and fragile drones could handle.  Our experience as pilots and technical ability as engineers and designers put us in the unique position of being able to design products that were so far ahead of the curve that we were regularly called crazy and dreamers.  Fast forward 12 months and RotorX motors and propellers are some of the most heavily cloned drone products in the market.  RotorX micro drones the RX155 raiju and RX122 atom have led a trend in the community towards smaller safer racing drones, that was recently validated by the FAA ruling on no registration required for drones less than 250grams.  Our lack of an international distribution network and financing to create large volumes of our cutting edge designs left the door open for an army of zombie cloning companies that wanted to capitalize on our popularity and designs.  We need Indiegogo to help us keep creating next level products while also pushing down costs to the customer, so that more people can afford to get into drone racing safely and share in the amazing experience of being a FPV drone pilot.  Whether it is for racing competitively, with friends or just for fun! 
What flight modes does the Atom V2 racer come with?
Because the Atom is designed for many different skill levels, the default mode will have low power self leveling flight mode that is a good starting point for getting used to the basic controls.  There will be several pre-programmed switches for intermediate and advanced levels of flight that will allow you to really surf the skies and race if you so desire.
Does the Atom V2 have GPS, Return to Home, Follow me mode and Wi-Fi control to my smartphone?
The simple answer is NO to all of those, for many reasons that we will try to explain.  You don’t have to look very hard to find drones that have had situations where these “automated” control modes have failed, and there are many ways they can fail.  Solar flares, poorly designed hardware/software, cloud cover, and obstacles like trees and mountains are just a few of the reason why even the most expensive GPS controlled drones are susceptible to “fly-aways” let alone the cheap, low quality - but affordable - ripoffs, that flood the market.  At RotorX we feel like why should we rely so heavily on a system so proven to fail so often? Why should a robot have all the fun of flying?  The Atom, like most pure racing drones, lets you fly in what’s called manual/rate/acro mode meaning you are absolutely in control of every movement that the drone makes, and as soon as that control link is broken the drone is no longer able to operate (called failsafe) without you, a human.  How can you fly like a bird if you are using waypoints or a smartphone? These flight modes give the operator a false sense of security about their skill level and their drones reliability/handling.  Wi-Fi controlled drones have an incredibly short control range, and extremely delayed video stream that makes FPV piloting clumsy and impractical for racing.

Generally a high quality RTF racing drone with everything needed to get you flying is around $1000. Our kit is comparison is very cost effective, especially for the race calibre quality of the components included.
The Atom costs the same or more than some 250mm sized racing drones.
