story:
accéder à la version française

 

Centralize all vital dive information in one place, that is visible in the blink of an eye, at the right time, is the challenge we’ve raised.

Māoï was designed to become a diving assistant, which allows divers to focus on the essentials: their own diving experience.

 

Thanks to a patented optical system, your dive information are projected 2 meters before your eyes. Without any effort and without disrupting your underwater exploration, you have access to your vital information when you need them.

 

Māoï detects your dive phases and adapts its display accordingly. The depth and diving time are displayed throughout your dive, the ascent time during the exploration phase, the ascending speed and decompression stop are displayed when you go back up.... The information you need will only be displayed when you need it.  (Check below some examples of the context-sensitive display)

Māoï has a front-facing screen entirely dedicated to your buddy. It displays real time information to your teammate, visible at all times, allowing you and your buddy to enjoy a safety dive. (Check below some examples of the buddy display)

Māoï integrates a Bühlmann ZHL-16C algorithm with gradient factors. Our decompression models are being validated by an expert and independent certifying body. Māoï allows you to manage the stages of decompression, considering the number of dives made during the day. It calculates the NoDec time, the decompression stops, the no fly time...

 

Māoï is compatible with any type of visual correction (either on your mask or eyes) and fits with presbyopia. The brightness of the display adapts to your environment and you will not lose any crumb of your dive, Māoï knows how to be discreet.

 

Get in a snap on your course. With Māoï you will love to steer yourself under water!

 

November 2017, DEMA Show, Orlando (Scuba diving industry fair-trade). Out of water trials of Māoï's prototypes. Have a look at the video and the happy faces :-)

 

 
"I was really wowed ! We are on the scuba-diving 2.0." - Alban Michon, Polar Explorer and Dive Expert
 
 
 
"It's much easier and cool than a classical dive computer" - Élodie
 
 
 
"You only have to push a button and have fun !" - Elvira
 
 
 
"It's easy to use, not too heavy" - Evelyn
 
 

If you want to give Māoï as a Christmas present, please select the "Christmas Card" option and you will receive a Christmas Card to print. 

 
Today we are at the pre-production stage and we are on INDIEGOGO to raise the necessary funds to launch our production. We are convinced that our innovation will revolutionize your dive experience. Help us to make this adventure possible!
 

Make the information accessible to the diver in a simple way, at the right time, while allowing him to make the most of his dive, is the guideline of the Thalatoo team.

We bring together our experience, passion and hard work to create a product we are truly proud of and will improve your dive experience.

The idea of Māoï came right after a dive in Corsica (France) in June 2015.

Boris, too busy checking his diving information on his wrist dive computer on a decompression stop, misses a magnificent Barracuda. In September 2016 with Emmanuel, a long-time friend and colleague, they created Thalatoo with the aim to produce innovative diving equipment that is accessible to all, easy to use and allow divers to make the most of their dives safely.

 

Since June 2015, we have come a long way and we have lifted all the technical locks to bring this innovative product to life.

For over a year we focused our efforts on research and development. Our major challenge was to find a way to bring up readable information under water in front of the diver's eyes. We have identified several solutions to build our optical system, we have eliminated many because of their size and complexity. Some optics specialists have tried to discourage us by saying that the technical solution we were looking for would not work. But we kept on searching to find the right solution and our efforts paid off !

How does it work ? A mini-projector sends the information on the optical reflector, which reflects the light, enlarges the image and projects it in front of the eyes of the diver.

The development of our prototypes allowed us to test the readability of the information and to make the necessary adjustments. Our optical system is at the heart of our project, today our architecture is fully validated and 100% reliable.

 

Today we managed to develop fully functional prototypes, tested and improved with the help of hundreds of divers.

 

 

Māoï has been designed by divers and for divers.

Throughout the product development we worked together with European and American divers. They've tested our prototypes during trials sessions and we've collected a lot of feedbacks from them to improve MĀOÏ's features.

Photos from the workshop session in "Plongée Passion Frontignan" dive center, October.

 

Here is the mock up design of Māoï : fully engineered on the inside, beautiful and ergonomic from the outside. 

 

What are the accessories delivered with Māoï? In addition to your Māoï dive computer, you will receive the Māoï fixation system, a charger and USB cable to charge your computer and download your dive logbook.

Where will Māoï be produced? Māoï will be entirely produced and assembled in France. We rigorously selected our service providers to develop a reliable product with irreproachable quality.

Where do you ship? All over the world, shipping costs vary depending on your country of residence (from 15€ to 70€ for one Māoï depending how far you live, delivery costs are displayed in the order module as soon as you specify your country).

Is Māoï guaranteed? The legal guarantee of conformity applies for 2 years from the product delivery date. The guarantee applies in the following cases:

- The product does not conform to the description and / or does not have the agreed qualities

- The product is unsuitable for use

- The product has a manufacturing defect

Is there already a functioning product?  We developed fully fonctional prototypes, tested and improved with the help of hundred of divers. They work perfectly , even if  they don't have the final design. Thanks to the funds we'll raise on indiegogo we'll be able to go a step further and launch the production integrating the final design.

Will Māoï interfere with my field of vision? The optical reflector on which the information is sent, is completely transparent, it does not reduce or interfere with the diver's field of vision.

Do I have to change my dive mask? No, you would not have to change your mask. Māoï is an add-on device that you can fix directly above your mask current mask.

How is the information displayed during the dive? The contextual display allows Māoï to display the information in an intelligent way. Māoï detects your dive phases and adapts its display accordingly: the depth and duration of the dive are displayed throughout your dive, the ascent time during the exploration phase, the ascent rate and the decompression stop are displayed when you ... The 2 buttons located on the right of the device allow you to have access to the following information during your dive: Up button: compass - Down button: maximum depth, temperature, depth.

Does Māoï adapt to all types of vision? Māoï is very easy to read for divers, with or without a vision problem. It is particularly adapted to the problems of presbyopia and associates perfectly with the corrective lenses which a diver can have on his mask or with the lenses of contact.

Which decompression model do you use? We implemented a Bulhman model ZHL-16C with 3 levels of gradient factors so that the diver can adapt the computer to his state of health. Our computer has been tested by an external certification body. This test includes the verification of decompression protocols recommended by Māoï for recreational diving profiles.

Does Māoï remember the history of my dives? Yes, Māoï keeps in memory your last 100 dives.

Can I transfer my dive data? Yes, you can transfer your data to divelog.de dive software

How do I charge Māoï? Māoï comes with an usb cable that you can plug into the port to charge it.

What are the risk and challenges? We are far in the process of moving from prototype to production. We already produced serveral functional prototypes. Today we are confident with our product timeline, however we will let all backers know if any unexpected changes come up.

I do not find the answer to my question, what can I do? Feel free do drop us a line at hello@thalatoo.com  We will be happy to answer all your questions.

 

 

 

Centraliser toutes les données vitales de plongée à un seul endroit,  afin qu’elles soient visibles en un clin d’œil et au bon moment, c’est le défi que nous avons relevé.

Māoï a été conçu pour devenir un véritable assistant de plongée, qui permet aux plongeurs de se focaliser sur l’essentiel : leur propre expérience de plongée.

Grâce à un système optique breveté, vos données de plongée sont projetées à 2 mètres devant vos yeux. Sans aucun effort et sans perturber l'exploration des fonds sous-marin, vous avez accès à ces informations vitales dès que vous en avez besoin.

 

Māoï détecte vos phases de plongée et adapte son affichage en conséquence : la profondeur et la durée de la plongée sont affichées tout au long de votre plongée, le temps de remontée pendant la phase d'exploration, la vitesse de remontée et les stop de décompression  sont affichés lorsque vous remontez La vitesse remontée s’affiche lorsque vous remontez… L’information est visible quand elle est nécessaire.(Regardez ci-dessous quelques exemples d'affichages.)

Māoï dispose un écran tourné vers l'avant entièrement dédié à votre binôme.  Les informations principales de votre coéquipier sont affichées sur l'écran et sont visibles à tout moment, et vous permettent de pratiquer votre loisir préféré en toute sécurité (Regardez ci-dessous quelques exemples d'affichage de l'écran binôme.)

Māoï intègre un algorithme Bühlmann ZHL-16C avec gradient factors dont les protocoles de décompression sont en cours de validation par un organisme certificateur expert et indépendant. Māoï permet donc de gérer les phases de décompression en calculant le NoDec time, les informations de paliers, le no fly time…

Māoï est compatible avec tout type de correction visuelle et convient parfaitement aux presbytes. L'intensité lumineuse s'adapte à votre environnement et vous ne perdrez aucune miette de votre plongée, Māoï sait se faire discret.   

Accédez en un clin d'œil à votre cap. Avec Māoï vous allez adorer vous orienter sous l'eau !  

 

Novembre 2017, DEMA Show, Orlando (Salon mondial de la plongée). Regardez les réactions des plongeurs lorsqu'ils testent les prototypes de Māoï ! :-)

 

 
"J'ai vraiment été bluffé ! On est sur de la plongée 2.0." - Alban Michon, Explorateur polaire et Spécialiste de la plongée extrême.
 
 
 
"C'est beaucoup plus simple et plus sympa que l'ordinateur" - Élodie
 
 
 
"Il suffit juste d'allumer et de se faire plaisir !" - Elvira
 
 
 
"C'est facile à utiliser, pas trop lourd" - Evelyn
 

Si vous souhaitez offrir Māoï à Noël, sélectionnez l'option "Christmas Card" au moment de réclamer votre récompense. Ainsi, vous aurez une jolie carte à imprimer à déposer sous le sapin ;)

 
Aujourd'hui, nous sommes au stade de la pré-production. Nous sommes donc sur INDIEGOGO pour lever les fonds nécessaires au lancement de la production de Māoï. Nous sommes convaincus que notre innovation révolutionnera votre plongée. Aidez-nous à faire de cette aventure un véritable succès, accessible à tous !
 
Rendre l’information accessible à l’utilisateur de façon simple, au bon moment, tout en lui permettant de profiter au maximum de sa plongée est la ligne directrice des équipes de Thalatoo.
Nous mobilisons notre expérience, notre passion et notre travail pour créer un produit dont nous sommes vraiment fiers et qui améliorera considérablement votre expérience lors de vos plongées.

L'idée de Māoï est née juste après une plongée en Corse, en juin 2015.

Boris, trop affairé à vérifier ses informations sur sa montre-ordinateur de plongée a manqué le passage d'un magnifique Barracuda durant un palier de décompression. En septembre 2016, Boris créée alors avec Emmanuel, un ami et collègue de longue-date, la société Thalatoo. Les deux amis sont guidés par la volonté de produire des équipements de plongée innovants, accessibles au plus grand nombre et facile à utiliser. 

L'idée ? Les plongeurs doivent profiter au maximum de leur plongée, en toute sécurité.

 

Nous avons parcouru un long chemin depuis la naissance de l'idée de Māoï. Nous avons levé tous les verrous techniques pour donner vie à ce produit innovant.

Pendant plus d'un an nous avons concentré nos efforts sur la recherche et développement. Notre défi majeur était de trouver le moyen de faire apparaître des informations lisibles sous l'eau, devant les yeux du plongeur.  Nous avons identifié plusieurs solutions pour construire notre système optique, nous en avons éliminé un grand nombre du fait de leur encombrement et complexité. Certains spécialistes de l'optique ont tenté de nous décourager en nous disant que la solution technique que nous recherchions ne fonctionnerait pas. Mais nous ne nous sommes pas découragés et nos efforts ont payé !

Comment ça marche ? Un mini-projecteur envoie les informations sur le réflecteur optique, ce dernier réfléchit la lumière, agrandit l’image et la projette devant les yeux du plongeur. Le développement de nos prototypes nous a permis de tester et faire tester la lisibilité des informations pour apporter les ajustements nécessaires.

Notre système optique est au cœur de notre projet, aujourd'hui notre architecture est complètement validée et 100% fiable.

 

Aujourd'hui, nous développons des prototypes totalement fonctionnels, testés et améliorés avec l'aide de centaines de plongeurs volontaires.

 

Māoï a été conçu par et pour les plongeurs.

Nous avons co-développé le produit ensemble, avec des plongeurs européens et américains. Ces-derniers ont testé nos prototypes en plongée, au cours de séances de co-développement. Ainsi, nous avons pu améliorer les fonctionnalités de Māoï grâce à leurs nombreuses remarques et suggestions.

Photos prises lors d'une séance hébergée par "Plongée Passion Frontignan", Octobre.

 

Voici ci-dessous la maquette finale du produit fini de Māoï : ingénieux à l'intérieur, magnifique et ergonomique à l'extérieur !

 

 

 

Quels sont les accessoires livrés avec Māoï ? 

En plus de votre ordinateur de plongée Māoï, vous recevrez le système de fixation pour positionner Māoï au-dessus de votre masque, un chargeur et câble USB pour charger votre ordinateur et télécharger l'historique de vos plongées.

Où livrez-vous ? Partout dans le monde, les frais de livraison sont variables selon votre pays résidence (entre 15€ et 70€ pour 1 Māoï selon votre éloignement, les frais de livraison seront précisés dans le module de commande).

Où sera produit Māoï ? Māoï sera entièrement produit et assemblé en France. Nous avons rigoureusement sélectionné nos prestataires pour développer un produit fiable avec une qualité irréprochable.

Est-ce que Māoï est garanti ? La garantie légale de conformité est appliquée pendant une période de 2 ans à compter de la date de réception du produit. La garantie s’applique dans les cas suivants :

  • Le produit n’est pas conforme à la description et/ou n’a pas les qualités convenues
  • Le produit est impropre à l’usage
  • Le produit présente un défaut de fabrication

 

Avez-vous déjà des produits fonctionnels ? Nous avons développé des prototypes 100% fonctionnels, qui ont été testés et améliorés à l'aide de la communauté de plongeurs. Ils intègrent l'ensemble des fonctionnalités de Māoï. Le boitier avec le design définitif n'a pas encore été produit. Les fonds récoltés lors de notre campagne de financement participatif nous permettrons d'acheter les moules pour fabriquer le boîtier et de donner vie à Māoï avec son nouveau design.

Est-ce que Māoï va gêner mon champ de vision ? Le réflecteur optique sur lequel les informations sont envoyées est complètement transparent, il ne réduit pas et ne gênera pas le champ de vision du plongeur.

Est- ce que je dois changer de masque de plongée ? Non, nous avons développé Māoï pour qu'il s'adapte à tous les masques de plongée. Māoï se positionne au-dessus de votre masque, vous pouvez conserver votre masque habituel.

Comment est géré l'affichage des informations lors de la plongée ?  L'affichage contextuel permet à Māoï d'afficher les informations de manière intelligente. Māoï détecte vos phases de plongée et adapte son affichage en conséquence :  la profondeur et la durée de la plongée sont affichés tout au long de votre plongée, le temps de remontée pendant la phase d'exploration, la vitesse de remontée et les stop de décompression sont affichés lorsque vous... Les 2 boutons situés sur la droite de l'appareil vous permettent d'avoir accès aux informations suivantes lors de votre plongée : Bouton haut : compas - Bouton bas : profondeur maximum, température, profondeur.

Est-ce que Māoï s'adapte à toutes les types de vues ? Māoï est très facile à lire pour les plongeurs, ayant ou non un problème de vision.  Il est particulièrement adapté aux problèmes de presbytie et s'associe parfaitement avec les verres correcteurs qu'un plongeur peut avoir sur son masque ou avec les lentilles de contact.

Quel modèle de décompression utilisez-vous ? Nous avons implémenté un modèle Bulhman ZHL-16C avec 3 niveaux de gradient factors pour que le plongeur puisse adapter l'ordinateur à son état de santé. Notre ordinateur a été testé par un organisme de certification externe. Ce test comprend la vérification des protocoles de décompression préconisé par Māoï pour des profils de plongée loisir.

Māoï garde-t-il en mémoire l'historique de mes plongées ? Oui, Māoï garde en mémoire vos 100 dernières plongées.

Est-ce que je peux transférer mes données de plongée ?  Oui, vous pouvez transférer vos données vers le logiciel de plongée divelog.de 

Comment puis-je charger Māoï ? Māoï est livré avec chargeur et câble USB, vous pourrez le charger très facilement.

Quels sont les risques et défis ?  Nous sommes à un stade très avancés dans nos développements, et la prochaine étape est de lancer la production. Nous avons déjà produit plusieurs prototypes fonctionnels. Aujourd'hui, nous sommes confiants quant à la suite des développements et le respect de notre planning. Si des changements inattendus venaient à survenir, nous informerons très rapidement tous nos contributeurs. 

Je ne trouve pas la réponse à ma question, que dois-je faire ? N'hésitez pas à nous écrire à hello@thalatoo.com. Nous serons heureux de répondre à toutes vos questions.
story_txt:
accéder à la version française Centralize all vital dive information in one place, that is visible in the blink of an eye, at the right time, is the challenge we’ve raised.Māoï was designed to become a diving assistant, which allows divers to focus on the essentials: their own diving experience. Thanks to a patented optical system, your dive information are projected 2 meters before your eyes. Without any effort and without disrupting your underwater exploration, you have access to your vital information when you need them. Māoï detects your dive phases and adapts its display accordingly. The depth and diving time are displayed throughout your dive, the ascent time during the exploration phase, the ascending speed and decompression stop are displayed when you go back up.... The information you need will only be displayed when you need it.  (Check below some examples of the context-sensitive display)Māoï has a front-facing screen entirely dedicated to your buddy. It displays real time information to your teammate, visible at all times, allowing you and your buddy to enjoy a safety dive. (Check below some examples of the buddy display)Māoï integrates a Bühlmann ZHL-16C algorithm with gradient factors. Our decompression models are being validated by an expert and independent certifying body. Māoï allows you to manage the stages of decompression, considering the number of dives made during the day. It calculates the NoDec time, the decompression stops, the no fly time... Māoï is compatible with any type of visual correction (either on your mask or eyes) and fits with presbyopia. The brightness of the display adapts to your environment and you will not lose any crumb of your dive, Māoï knows how to be discreet. Get in a snap on your course. With Māoï you will love to steer yourself under water! November 2017, DEMA Show, Orlando (Scuba diving industry fair-trade). Out of water trials of Māoï's prototypes. Have a look at the video and the happy faces :-)  
"I was really wowed ! We are on the scuba-diving 2.0." - Alban Michon, Polar Explorer and Dive Expert   
"It's much easier and cool than a classical dive computer" - Élodie   
"You only have to push a button and have fun !" - Elvira   
"It's easy to use, not too heavy" - Evelyn  If you want to give Māoï as a Christmas present, please select the "Christmas Card" option and you will receive a Christmas Card to print.  
Today we are at the pre-production stage and we are on INDIEGOGO to raise the necessary funds to launch our production. We are convinced that our innovation will revolutionize your dive experience. Help us to make this adventure possible! 
Make the information accessible to the diver in a simple way, at the right time, while allowing him to make the most of his dive, is the guideline of the Thalatoo team.
We bring together our experience, passion and hard work to create a product we are truly proud of and will improve your dive experience.

The idea of Māoï came right after a dive in Corsica (France) in June 2015.Boris, too busy checking his diving information on his wrist dive computer on a decompression stop, misses a magnificent Barracuda. In September 2016 with Emmanuel, a long-time friend and colleague, they created Thalatoo with the aim to produce innovative diving equipment that is accessible to all, easy to use and allow divers to make the most of their dives safely. Since June 2015, we have come a long way and we have lifted all the technical locks to bring this innovative product to life.For over a year we focused our efforts on research and development. Our major challenge was to find a way to bring up readable information under water in front of the diver's eyes. We have identified several solutions to build our optical system, we have eliminated many because of their size and complexity. Some optics specialists have tried to discourage us by saying that the technical solution we were looking for would not work. But we kept on searching to find the right solution and our efforts paid off !How does it work ? A mini-projector sends the information on the optical reflector, which reflects the light, enlarges the image and projects it in front of the eyes of the diver.The development of our prototypes allowed us to test the readability of the information and to make the necessary adjustments. Our optical system is at the heart of our project, today our architecture is fully validated and 100% reliable. Today we managed to develop fully functional prototypes, tested and improved with the help of hundreds of divers.  Māoï has been designed by divers and for divers.Throughout the product development we worked together with European and American divers. They've tested our prototypes during trials sessions and we've collected a lot of feedbacks from them to improve MĀOÏ's features.Photos from the workshop session in "Plongée Passion Frontignan" dive center, October. Here is the mock up design of Māoï : fully engineered on the inside, beautiful and ergonomic from the outside. 

 
What are the accessories delivered with Māoï? In addition to your Māoï dive computer, you will receive the Māoï fixation system, a charger and USB cable to charge your computer and download your dive logbook.Where will Māoï be produced? Māoï will be entirely produced and assembled in France. We rigorously selected our service providers to develop a reliable product with irreproachable quality.Where do you ship? All over the world, shipping costs vary depending on your country of residence (from 15€ to 70€ for one Māoï depending how far you live, delivery costs are displayed in the order module as soon as you specify your country).Is Māoï guaranteed? The legal guarantee of conformity applies for 2 years from the product delivery date. The guarantee applies in the following cases:- The product does not conform to the description and / or does not have the agreed qualities- The product is unsuitable for use- The product has a manufacturing defectIs there already a functioning product?  We developed fully fonctional prototypes, tested and improved with the help of hundred of divers. They work perfectly , even if  they don't have the final design. Thanks to the funds we'll raise on indiegogo we'll be able to go a step further and launch the production integrating the final design.Will Māoï interfere with my field of vision? The optical reflector on which the information is sent, is completely transparent, it does not reduce or interfere with the diver's field of vision.Do I have to change my dive mask? No, you would not have to change your mask. Māoï is an add-on device that you can fix directly above your mask current mask.How is the information displayed during the dive? The contextual display allows Māoï to display the information in an intelligent way. Māoï detects your dive phases and adapts its display accordingly: the depth and duration of the dive are displayed throughout your dive, the ascent time during the exploration phase, the ascent rate and the decompression stop are displayed when you ... The 2 buttons located on the right of the device allow you to have access to the following information during your dive: Up button: compass - Down button: maximum depth, temperature, depth.Does Māoï adapt to all types of vision? Māoï is very easy to read for divers, with or without a vision problem. It is particularly adapted to the problems of presbyopia and associates perfectly with the corrective lenses which a diver can have on his mask or with the lenses of contact.Which decompression model do you use? We implemented a Bulhman model ZHL-16C with 3 levels of gradient factors so that the diver can adapt the computer to his state of health. Our computer has been tested by an external certification body. This test includes the verification of decompression protocols recommended by Māoï for recreational diving profiles.Does Māoï remember the history of my dives? Yes, Māoï keeps in memory your last 100 dives.Can I transfer my dive data? Yes, you can transfer your data to divelog.de dive softwareHow do I charge Māoï? Māoï comes with an usb cable that you can plug into the port to charge it.What are the risk and challenges? We are far in the process of moving from prototype to production. We already produced serveral functional prototypes. Today we are confident with our product timeline, however we will let all backers know if any unexpected changes come up.I do not find the answer to my question, what can I do? Feel free do drop us a line at hello@thalatoo.com  We will be happy to answer all your questions.   Centraliser toutes les données vitales de plongée à un seul endroit,  afin qu’elles soient visibles en un clin d’œil et au bon moment, c’est le défi que nous avons relevé.Māoï a été conçu pour devenir un véritable assistant de plongée, qui permet aux plongeurs de se focaliser sur l’essentiel : leur propre expérience de plongée.Grâce à un système optique breveté, vos données de plongée sont projetées à 2 mètres devant vos yeux. Nous avons implémenté un modèle Bulhman ZHL-16C avec 3 niveaux de gradient factors pour que le plongeur puisse adapter l'ordinateur à son état de santé. Notre ordinateur a été testé par un organisme de certification externe. Ce test comprend la vérification des protocoles de décompression préconisé par Māoï pour des profils de plongée loisir.Māoï garde-t-il en mémoire l'historique de mes plongées ? Oui, Māoï garde en mémoire vos 100 dernières plongées.Est-ce que je peux transférer mes données de plongée ?  Oui, vous pouvez transférer vos données vers le logiciel de plongée divelog.de Comment puis-je charger Māoï ? Māoï est livré avec chargeur et câble USB, vous pourrez le charger très facilement.Quels sont les risques et défis ?  Nous sommes à un stade très avancés dans nos développements, et la prochaine étape est de lancer la production. Nous avons déjà produit plusieurs prototypes fonctionnels. Aujourd'hui, nous sommes confiants quant à la suite des développements et le respect de notre planning. Si des changements inattendus venaient à survenir, nous informerons très rapidement tous nos contributeurs. Je ne trouve pas la réponse à ma question, que dois-je faire ? N'hésitez pas à nous écrire à hello@thalatoo.com. Nous serons heureux de répondre à toutes vos questions.

story:
Hello!

This is me, Sergio (and my wife Paola), I'm 33 years old...and I love skiing.

 

Well...as a skier, have you ever though why should you feel a sense of fatigue and frustration before the day on the snow has even began? When you have to carry sport equipment from the parking lot or from the hotel, up to the lifts (don’t you??) transporting your skis (plus maybe your sons’ or wife’s) on shoulders.

That’s a quite tiring and dangerous operation, while also wearing ski-boots that are not the most comfortable shoes.

For this reason, we recognized the need for a new way of moving our skis simplifying every skiers' life.

Here comes SKIDDI: a small simple egg-sized device easy to use, suitable for all ages, even for kids, that will make you save energy and feel more confident on the icy and snowy roads.

 

SKIDDI is a pocket-sized device that allows you, easily and fastly, to drag your skis as a trolley. And it's 100% MADE IN ITALY!

SKIDDI comes from a real need: to carry your skis in every situation, easily. You can use it whenever and wherever you want, and then bring it with you by storing it in your pocket.

 

 

Every time you carry your skis you have to deal with certain unpleasant situations:

- Physical fatigue (specially with cold muscles);

- Fall or slip on the ice, possibly hurting you or people around you;

- Difficulty in holding the equipment (in addition to the skis you also carry ski poles, bags or backpacks);

- Damage to people or things due to uncontrolled movements of the skis (given their considerable size).

SKIDDI facilitates your daily movements when you go skiing by:

- Lightening the load of the equipment;

- Reducing the size of the equipment;

- Lowering the center of gravity.

 

SKIDDI is very lightweight (90 grammes, about 3 oz). Moreover it has been conceived to be stored into your pocket.

SKIDDI is lighter than your phone and smaller than your wallet!

SKIDDI is a plastic device produced by Injection Molding, and is made of 4 main parts:

 

1. BODY (ABS)

2. CADDIE –and WHEELS (NYLON PA66 + 30% FV)

3. CLOSURE SYSTEM (rubber EPDM, water resistance, UV resistance, >300% elongation after fracture)

4.   EXTENSION: accessory for use SKIDDI with Twin-tip Skis

SKIDDI will be available in 6 amazing colors:

And any package includes your own SKIDDI, a useful waterproof pouch, the instructions card, and the TWIN-TIP SKIS Accessory.

SKIDDI IS A SOCIAL GOOD plus MADE IN ITALY

We reached the goal to develop a full Made in Italy production, which comes through home-made self-prototyping and grows into a social impact project. 

 

 

I choose to produce SKIDDI involving a main company (the manufacturer) that employs physically and socially disadvantaged staff. Even though production costs will be relevant if compared to those coming from Far East, I do believe that our generation must try to make business in a more social responsible way.

That’s the reason why I’ve spent weeks in selecting the best supplying partner I could find, to take also advantage of highly qualified skills, representing the best of Italian entrepreneurship. A top-class luxury package producer will make the package in Italy as well. Packages will be shipped to our manufacturing partner where SKIDDI will be assembled and packaged.

 

Sergio Pedolazzi: creator of SKIDDI and D-NAMIC head of product design projects.

Born in 1983, Sergio Pedolazzi began his activity as a "small maker" in his father's workroom, and immediately he showed a great attraction in technology and innovation. In 2012, thanks to his technical skills acquired during his studies, and thanks to his passion for skiing, conceived the idea of SKIDDI. The final prototype takes place in a couple of years, developed through an open-source 3D printer, which enables him to define the design of the product. In 2014, Sergio registered the patent for invention of SKIDDI and he is rewarded in the DesignWinMake.

Alessandro Scozzesi & Toni Panigalli: D-NAMIC funders and biggest fans of SKIDDI

For the last ten years D-NAMIC, the incubator where Sergio and Alessandro first met years ago, has been bringing passion, enthusiasm and huge effort to help creators and entrepreneurs to turn their ideas into business models first, and then into startup companies, accelerating their development, while taking part in all the risks arising.

Sergio brought his idea on table last year during a dinner, and since then the whole team worked hardly together to transform SKIDDI into a real product. 

JEYS: video making and editing 

THISTHESIGN: Logistics and shipping

 

CREDITS

This project has made possible thanks to the great effort and commitment of our close friends from:

BUGNION (intellectual property)

FABLAB MILANO (3D printing and prototyping)

MARCO BARBARINI (Branding) 

PLASTINOVA (injection moulding tool)

AIRONE COOPERATIVA SOCIALE (manufacturing)

MARBER (packaging)

SALE'S SOLUTIONS (Andrea Tortelli PR and MEDIA specialist)

story:
We are now ALREADY shipping Orders to all the Backers in Indiegogo !

 

 

 

FAQ

1 :   Are you sure by August 1, 2017 ,   The Orders will be shipped to Indiegogo's Backers ?

      YES ,  100% guaranteed ! 

 

2 :  What's the composition of the TRAVELA backpack ？

      Outside layer it's made of Jacquard Fabric ， Middle with 7mm EPE-Foam ,  Inside is made of high quality Polyester Fabric !

 

3 :  Can the package of TRAVELA backpack be returned if backer doesn't want it anymore after ordering from Indiegogo ?

       No ,  Considering the returning costs and transport fees ，We couldn't accept returning ， ALL our TRAVELA backpack were made with HIGH quality materials and great craftmanship ！

 

4： Is the import taxes / fees covered ？

         No ,  Backers should be responsible for the import taxes or fees per each country’s import policies

 

5： IF i donn't know how to use the backpack or some items of the accessories ，how to deal with it ？

        Donn't worry ,  We have all the relative videos to show you , Moreover ,  We are always available by email : sales@heartpd.com

story:
Hey everyone, my name is Christian Anderson. I am a photographer and coffee shop blogger; I live in Colorado. What originally started as an idea between myself and brothers Tim and Tommy Thwaites (owners of Coda Coffee) 3  years ago grew into a dream trip. Traveling across the country to visit coffee shops with the purpose of sharing with everyone fine art images and stories from shop owners, managers, baristas, and maybe even a patron.

“Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.” – Mark Twain

Last fall, I decided to move forward in making my dream a reality, and nervously purchased a camper trailer. I call her, "The Green Bean," and she's everything I need to make the trip - 2003 Toyota Tundra with a Phoenix slide-in camper. Then I went out on a limb and 30 coffee shops agreed to be part of the adventure; over 9,000 miles across 20 states and British Columbia!

I leave the first week of June, 2016. You can check out the list of coffee shops that I'll be visiting, in the Gallery section.


While I've been able to get the Green Bean just about ready for long-term travel and set aside some money to pay for trip expenses, I need to raise $8,680.00 in additional funding, in order to complete this project. This is the absolute bare minimum that I need, to make this trip a reality.

I've always felt encouragement and support for this project, however I now need a little help from my friends. This is why I'm asking for your contributions, whether it's a dollar or twenty thousand dollars. Anyone have $20k? Anything you can provide would be a blessing.

If I'm unable to reach my goal, I will still utilize the funds raised and start the adventure. This campaign will help me cover the following costs:

  • Truck and Camper Trailer - Covered
  • New Tires - Covered
  • Generator - Covered
  • Computer - Covered
  • Backup Hard Drives - Covered
  • Cell Phone - Covered
  • Specialty Camera Lenses - Covered
  • Groceries - $1,375.00
  • High-Resolution DSLR Camera (remaining funds needed) - $741.00
  • Campsites (assumes no guerilla camping) - $2,600.00
  • Gas (10,000 miles, 17 miles/gallon, $3.00/gallon) - $1,764.00
  • Gas for Generator - $170.00
  • Propane - $120.00
  • Truck and Trailer Maintenance (oil changes, tire rotations, etc) - $420.00
  • Truck Timing Belt and Water Pump - $760.00
  • Travel (r/t train from my sister's in PA to Brooklyn, NY and housing) - $340.00
  • Mail Forwarding - $150.00
  • Laundry - $90.00
  • Entertainment (Redbox rentals, movie theater) - $75.00
  • Misc. Storage (shelving, cabinet liners, etc.) - $75.00
  • Total - $8,680.00
Any funds raised above and beyond the goal will go towards the emergency fund for those unforeseen events.

"If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on." - Sheryl Sandberg


Depending on what you can contribute, it will be a combination of my thanks, a sticker, a t-shirt, fine-art prints, and a fine-art book of my favorite 20 images from the road.


I realize that some people may not be able to help fund The Green Bean Adventure. That doesn't mean you aren't able to help. It would be wonderful, if you could share this project with your friends, family, colleagues, or even complete strangers. You can share this project via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, face-to-face, emails, the water cooler, eHarmony, and even text messages!


Join me on my adventure by following my blog and social media channels.

www.greenbeanadv.com

www.instagram.com/greenbeanadv

www.facebook.com/greenbeanadv

www.twitter.com/greenbeanadv


For those of you who have been there since the beginning (listening to the many iterations of the trip) to those who are just joining, thank you so much for your support. I love you guys!

story:
As cycling enthusiasts we love to ride, often times into the evening. But riding at night requires careful preparation to stay safe. A front and rear light is a must but can be expensive and difficult to install. And even with proper bike setup, typical cycling lights still cannot guarantee safety especially when changing lanes and turning. 

Front light, turn signal, taillight, you name it.


That’s why we created Speednite. It can increase safety by 50% compared to traditional headlights. It's a complete, integrated lighting system built into the bike steering stem and includes headlight, taillight, and laser direction turn signals. This complete set of smart lights makes riding at night convenient while increasing visibility to keep you safer.



A test video from our Japanese customer



Ride with a Better View

The light  moves with the head sensor



Speednite smart stem

When riding at night, it’s crucial to have a clear view of all road conditions. But typical bike headlights simply point straight ahead without the ability to adjust. Speednite has a powerful 800 lumen front headlight controlled by a head sensor attached to the helmet. It tracks your head position and automatically adjusts the light beam up or down to the angle that you are looking. By changing vertical angle by up to 90° Speednite puts the light beam right where you need it.
 

There are four LED modes available (Full Light, Half Light, Quick Flash and Slow Flash) for any riding conditions, all conveniently controlled by physical buttons or through the Speednite app.

 

Be Visible to Other Road Users

A turn signal makes your intention more clearly
 

Anytime your go for a ride, it's vital to make yourself visible to other road users. Accidents most often occur when turning or changing lanes. However, it can be unsafe to use traditional hand signals, which force the rider to remove their hands from the handlebars and are difficult or impossible to see in the dark.
 

Turn signal & rear light shows the turning direction​

Speednite makes your intentions clear with super bright laser turn signals that shine on the ground in the direction of your intended turn. The laser indicators can be seen clearly by other cyclists, pedestrians and car drivers.

 

Speednite is the first lighting system with automated turn signals that are triggered by the cyclist’s head motion through a tiny head sensor. The helmet mounted sensor tracks the user’s head movements and shines a warning laser light onto the ground in the direction of the turn. At the same time, the taillight indicates the turning direction with a blinking light for added safety. 

 

Emergency SOS Function

It can call the emergency contact automatically


If the worst does happen, Speenite provides added features for the cyclist’s safety. The head motion sensor can detect unusual motions that are associated with a crash. In that unfortunate event, the SOS signal lights will be turned on and flash rapidly. At the same time, the Speenite App will automatically alert a pre-set emergency contact for help.

 

Keeps your Helmet Lightweight
 

Speednite keeps lightweight and safe

Traditional helmet lights point their light beam in the direction the head moves, but they are heavy and add weight to the head in a way that impacts your riding experience. Helmet lights can also break easily during crashes. Speednite keeps your helmet lightweight and your headlight on the bike where it belongs. 



Lightweight Head Sensor  

It moves across 90 degrees


The main safety functions of Speednite are controlled by the head sensor including the front headlight and the turn signals. The front headlight moves up or down across 90 degrees in relation to your head position.

When you are ready to make a lane change or make a turn, a slight movement of the neck left or right will initiate the laser turn signal, illuminating the road with a bright stripe of light on that side, making your intentions clearer to motorists and other road users.

 

Remote & Manual Controls


 

Speednite also has physical buttons for more convenient use. With them, the angle of the front light can be manually adjusted, just in case the head sensor is low on battery. There are four LED modes available (Full Light, Half Light, Quick Flash and Slow Flash) that can be controlled by the button/app.

If manual control is preferred, a small remote can be attached on the handlebar and its function works the same way, controlling the angle of the headlight and the LED modes.

 

Smartphone App


Along with its powerful safety features, there are more detailed functions inside the Speednite app. It acts as a bike computer and shows the major metrics for your riding including speed, time and distance and connects with other BLE heart monitor devices. It also allows you to set the configuration for the vertical movement angle of the front light, the turning range of your head that triggers the right or left signals, and the sensitivity of the head sensor. 

Speednite App is able to record and save your riding data for training purposes and its bike computer functions and data can sync to popular riding app Strava.

 

Automatic Rear Light



The rear light provides added safety with Full Light or Flash Light modes and has an Auto Brake Light function that is triggered when a sudden brake event occurs. 

Bluetooth & Accessories



With Bluetooth built-in, Speednite works with other popular third-party BLE tools such as heart rate sensors, speed sensors, cadence sensors, and more. It tracks cycling metrics automatically, including speed, RPM, BPM, heart rate, etc. 

 

Affordable Safety


 

At only $129, Speednite is a complete and affordable cycling lighting system and the first to be controlled automatically with a head sensor. Other front headlight and rear taillight combos often costs more than $200 and don’t provide the convenience or control of Speednite.


 

Compatible with Most Bikes



The 90mm length of the Speednite stem is perfect for mounting on most bikes. For other bikes, an adapter is available. Speednite is simple to use and easy to install on any bike. 

 

IP65 Weatherproof


 

Speednite has a high level of protection against water and dust so that you can enjoy your cycling no matter if it’s raining or shining. 


3000mAh Built-in Lithium-ion Battery

 

Equipped with a rechargeable Lithium-ion battery, Speednite meets the needs of sport, travel and commuting and a single charge lasts up to 30 hours.




 



 

How to Use

The head motion sensor is quite small that can be attached to any helmet. 

Please find the installation video here.

When you are ready to make a lane change or make a turn, a slight movement of the neck left or right will initiate the laser turn signal, illuminating the road with a bright stripe of light on that side, making your intentions clearer to motorists and other road users.
 
Remote & Manual Controls
 
Speednite also has physical buttons for more convenient use. With them, the angle of the front light can be manually adjusted, just in case the head sensor is low on battery. There are four LED modes available (Full Light, Half Light, Quick Flash and Slow Flash) that can be controlled by the button/app.
If manual control is preferred, a small remote can be attached on the handlebar and its function works the same way, controlling the angle of the headlight and the LED modes.
 
Smartphone App
Along with its powerful safety features, there are more detailed functions inside the Speednite app. It acts as a bike computer and shows the major metrics for your riding including speed, time and distance and connects with other BLE heart monitor devices. It also allows you to set the configuration for the vertical movement angle of the front light, the turning range of your head that triggers the right or left signals, and the sensitivity of the head sensor. 
Speednite App is able to record and save your riding data for training purposes and its bike computer functions and data can sync to popular riding app Strava.
 
Automatic Rear LightThe rear light provides added safety with Full Light or Flash Light modes and has an Auto Brake Light function that is triggered when a sudden brake event occurs. 
Bluetooth & AccessoriesWith Bluetooth built-in, Speednite works with other popular third-party BLE tools such as heart rate sensors, speed sensors, cadence sensors, and more. It tracks cycling metrics automatically, including speed, RPM, BPM, heart rate, etc. 
 
Affordable Safety 
At only $129, Speednite is a complete and affordable cycling lighting system and the first to be controlled automatically with a head sensor. Other front headlight and rear taillight combos often costs more than $200 and don’t provide the convenience or control of Speednite. 
Compatible with Most Bikes
The 90mm length of the Speednite stem is perfect for mounting on most bikes. For other bikes, an adapter is available. Speednite is simple to use and easy to install on any bike. 
 
IP65 Weatherproof


 
Speednite has a high level of protection against water and dust so that you can enjoy your cycling no matter if it’s raining or shining. 
3000mAh Built-in Lithium-ion Battery
 
Equipped with a rechargeable Lithium-ion battery, Speednite meets the needs of sport, travel and commuting and a single charge lasts up to 30 hours.



 
 How to Use
The head motion sensor is quite small that can be attached to any helmet. 
Please find the installation video here.

story:
Green Olive Village Resort

 


Cost expected: 650.000€ (50% provided by EE program for starters 50% by crowdfunding) Total Space: 1200 square meters ground

Resort Description 
16 small separate houses of which 8 will be maisonettes of and 8 will be detached houses. Every house will come with a private garden. There will be a common garden as well of approximately 200-250 square meter.

Target Group
Adults only.

What we have already:
*What we currently own: the field.

*Construction layout and housing floor plan is prepared.

*Business plan is ready.

*Our mechanics are ready to work.

The Destination

Thasos, sometimes spelled Thassos (Greek: Θάσος), is a Greek Island tourist destination in the North Aegean Islands group. Thassos is the ideal holiday destination for people looking to have a great time as it has a mix of peace and tranquility as well as various other options for recreation. There are a number of ancient ruins to visit and there are also beaches and nightlife.

 

Green Olive Village, which will be situated in the beautiful Rachoni Village of Thassos. The uniqueness of this resort will be that it would offer a quiet, peaceful and restful surroundings of the mountains, with activities that can be arranged and the sea with beautiful beaches and crystal clear waters close by. This project is the brain child of two very talented and young sisters- Margarita and Katerina. The sisters have inherited a field of 1200 sq ft which has been in the family for generations and now; it is theirs to manage and develop. Meg and Katerina plan to develop the land into a resort. 

The uniqueness of this project is their combined love for the area. It has a more family-like feel as it is in the village and not in a seaside settlement like most impersonal hotels in Greece and it also has different things to offer. The sister have tried to combine the benefits of a home and a rest house as well as aim to strengthen local small businesses. Everyone comes to Greece to experience the hospitality and the relationship the locals have with each other. This is the soul of the idea.

Project Description
The houses are standalone houses: 8 of them  are located on the ground floor only and 8 of them on 2 store level. Equipment in the house will be modern with a minimalist design with natural materials, will have a fully functioning kitchen for everyday use, air-conditioning, steam shower cabinet or rainy shower depending on the house option, interior Greek art and solar panels for energy production. The houses will be using about 60% renewable energy supply.


All the houses will have their private garden with external open plan bathtub. We will encourage activities to the common garden with big terrace, BBQ, mini movie theater, mini golf, ping pong table, Giant Jenga and fire pit and relaxation area. Additionally there will be available a garden with organic fruits and vegetables where guest can purchase directly items. 

 

Floor plan of the maisonette.

Extras

A cook will be available to book, massage options will be available to book and and enjoy at the facilities as well as hairdresser and manicure and pedicure. Concierge will include boat trips, hiking, mountain biking, horse riding, restaurant bookings and beach bar reservations. The hotel will be managed remotely from us regarding reservations, payments and concierge. On the field will be available a Supervisor 2 shifts per day, Housekeeping and a Gardener. 

Contingency Plan
If we won't reach our optimal crowdfunding goal (raising 100% of the target amount) we'll proceed to building less houses compared to the original plan. Every house expected cost is 40.000€ fully equipped and furnished, included automated system for check in and check out.

What is in there for you/Rewards:

€10.- Thank you
€25.- Personal hand written thank you letter with cart postal from Thassos.
€50.- Free accommodation for a day of your stay.
€100.- 10% discount of your stay.
€150. Free accommodation for two days of your stay.
€200.- 10% discount of your stay and a free boat tour around the island.
€500 30% discount of your stay, free boat tour around the island and a basket of organic food supplies.
€750 50% discount of your stay, free boat tour around the island and a basket of organic food supplies.
€1000 50% discount of your stay, free boat tour around the island and private cook for 1 day.
€1500 Free accommodation for a week, basket of organic food supplies and a bottle of finest wine.
€2000 Give your name to one of the houses and Free accommodation for a week, free boat tour around the island and a basket of organic food supplies.

Other ways you can help us

If you would not be able to help now, or in the future, there are other ways you can assist or contribute.

Endorse Us - Share our campaign. Copy & Paste our campaign link above to your: Facebook, Tweet It (Twitter), Pin It (Pinterest), Picture It (Instagram), Blog It(Blogger/WordPress/Tumblr...), or Link It (Linkedin). 

If you have any questions or inquiries, don't hesitate to get in touch! Thank you for your time reading and participating.

story:
Introducing BeachBox - The world's first portable shower and storage box in one. Designed with a unique hybrid of features that gives you a storage box, shower tank, and changing lid in one modular design.

 

 

 

BeachBox is designed to keep you and your gear clean and organized. It's the ultimate wingman for outdoor enthusiasts.

 

 

 

Perfect for surfers, campers, windsurfers, jet-skiers, fishermen, mountain bikers, trail runners, hikers and beach-going families with sandy kids! 

 
 
 

But don't just take our word for it. The highly curated website 'uncrate' featured it as a product of the day.

 

 

And the team at Globo Surf put it through its paces and came up with flattering results. Overall rating 95%!

 

 

You decide how you use it! Store all your gear inside so it's ready to grab and go for a day's adventure. Or load it up with essentials before road trips. It can even house up to four shower tanks!

 

 

If you like getting dirty, sandy, muddy, or sweaty then BeachBox is for you! 

 
 

 

It's perfect after a session of this... 

 

 

or this...

 

 

even this...

 

 

and of course after a session of this...

 

 

It's completely modular and packs up neatly, ready to grab and use whenever needed.

 

 

BeachBox is ideal after a day at the beach. You'll find it especially useful if you have kids that like to get wet and sandy! Use the portable shower tank to give them a warm rinse after a long day in the sand. Also handy for cleaning beach toys and storing your wet gear for the ride home. 

 

 

Every BeachBox comes with a two gallon, custom-designed, removable and insulated shower tank, and a non-slip changing lid. 

 

 

The manual pump shower tank is easy to use, easy to refill and offers a full and pressurized flow to wash off sand, salt and dirt. 

 

 

The insulated cover keeps water temperate, offering a perfect warm rinse after a cold ocean session, early morning hike or mountain bike ride. 

 

 

The sturdy, non-slip base allows you to stand inside the BeachBox to rinse. Or you can stand on the non-slip changing lid and shower off there.  

 

 

Keep your wetsuit or other gear out of the dirt, mud or sand!

 

 

 

Inside BeachBox has a designated dry area for towels and clothes. The mini storage tubs are there to store all your essentials: sunblock, surf wax, keys, sunglasses, fishing gear, tools, snacks, etc. It's also useful for holding plates and utensils for those camping trips.

 

 

Headed to the great outdoors for the weekend? Don't forget your BeachBox! Pack all of your camping gear inside and throw it in your car, van, RV or truck as a handy storage box as well as your campsite shower.   

 

 

Treat it as your personal campsite shower and avoid dragging dirt or sand into your tent or RV.   

 

 

BeachBox can hold up to 4 tanks allowing you to store plenty of water at your campsite. It's perfect for river, ocean or lakeside camping and especially great for rinsing off kids and dogs. 

 

 

Not much of an outdoorsy person? BeachBox is still for you! Use it as a disaster kit and fill it with all the essentials you need like blankets, flashlights, canned food, etc. And on top of that you would have 2 or 3 shower tanks ready to go. Genius!

 

 

The insulated shower tank is custom-designed to slot into any BeachBox. You can fit 4 shower tanks into any BeachBox if necessary - they slot perfectly into each corner.

 

 

The shower tanks have a durable, neoprene 7-foot hose, an easy-to-fill screw top, an insulated cover for temperature control, and a sleek geometric design that doesn't roll around in your car.

 

 

We are a family company and spend long days at the beach surfing and getting our feet and butt cracks sandy with our kids. Days of fun are followed by piles of sandy toys, wet towels and wet clothes in our car. BeachBox was invented as something to solve our post-beach day mess. 

 

 

Our girls have been our guinea pigs throughout the prototyping process. Playing in the BeachBox, enjoying the warm, gentle shower, and even turning it into a tea party table for all their dolls. 

 

 

Also, as a working professional who needed to get cleaned up and into the office quickly after early morning surf sessions, I was searching for a solution to keep my gear tidy, while keeping myself tidy, too. I found beach showers to be either non-existent, broken, too crowded, or nowhere near where I parked my car. At times they'd also be shut down due to water restrictions.   

 

 

From all of this BeachBox was born! 

 
 

 

The journey to this moment has been long and not without its ups and downs. We have failed a few times (which is what it's all about) and put the box through a lot of research and development. We've taken our time (3.5 years to be precise) making the choices we think make for the best version of BeachBox. We are extremely happy with the result and we know you'll love it too.

 

We've tested every component over and over again. 

Below we were testing how much pressure the tank can withstand, we were looking for air leaks and 'ballooning' on the bottom of the tank. 

 

Here we were testing for pressure and flow.

This was our first T1 sample.

 

We are huge fans of design, so not only was the functional design of the box and shower tank really important to us, the aesthetics were as well. We were stoked to finally settle on a color for our final product. In the future we hope to offer multiple colors and textures, allowing the user to fully customize their BeachBox. 

 

This is the final color choice:

 

 

BeachBox is the real deal! This is not a CAD file or 3D rendered concept. BeachBox is ready to go and ready to manufacture. We are also patent pending.

 

SHIPPING & FULFILLMENT:

This is, without doubt, one of the most important parts of our entire campaign. We are a startup and not yet shipping in bulk order, yet we've turned over every stone to source the smartest and most cost-effective solution to getting a BeachBox to you. 

REST OF WORLD: 

Due to high shipping costs, we are currently unable to complete global fulfillment at this time. However, if you are really passionate about purchasing a BeachBox and do not see your country on the list above, email us at beachboxsurf@gmail.com and we will do our best to work out a solution to get it to you. 

MEDIA OR PR INQUIRIES:

Please contact the team at beachboxsurf@gmail.com

RISKS & CHALLENGES:

We are perfectionists and we've done our homework. We have partnered with engineers, designers and product sourcing specialists with over 25 years experience in the industry so we feel extremely confident this product will meet or exceed your expectations.

Parts are under warranty for 12 months against manufacturers defects. No warranty against wear or abuse.

story:
We, Rock&Rope and Pyrénaline teams wish to make this dream come true and share it with y'all! We aim to gather rope-jump, highline and BASE-jump activities at Tre Cime di Lavaredo one of the most highlighted peaks in the European climbing. Embark & Jump with us in this adventure!   

// Les équipes Pyrénaline et Rock&Rope veulent partager un rêve avec vous, celui de rassembler les disciplines outdoor du saut pendulaire, de la highline et du BASE jump, sur le mythique spot Tre Cime en Italie. Embarquez avec nous dans cette aventure hors-normes!



Tre Cime di Lavaredo, Dolomites, Italy, is an unique and legendary spot.
Three peaks, the highest one - Cima Grande, 2999 m - is quite famous among outdoor activities lovers because of their outstanding look and picturesque trekking routes lying around them. The gorge is also widely known among rock climbers and BASE-jumpers communities. But despite the impressive heights, the exits (spots applicable for jumping) keep some exclusivity and only attract real enthusiastic sportsmen because of the difficult approach to the top. 

// Il s'agit du spot légendaire Tre cime di Lavaredo, dans les Dolomites.
Trois pics, dont le plus haut - Cima Grande 2999 m- est populaire parmi les amoureux de montagne, et c'est certainement grâce à son aspect sauvage & spectaculaire, ainsi qu'aux treks qui se trouvent autour. Si le lieu est très connu dans le milieu de la grimpe et du BASE, avec des hauteurs remarquables, il y reste un certain privilège car le sommet n'est pas si facile à atteindre.

The expedition will take place between August 24th and September 15th, 2016.
The main goal of the project consists is sharing worldwide this adventure with the making of an outdoor adventure film telling the story of this ambitious multisports expedition.
With more than 450 meters of total fall, for the first time a huge rope-jump will be rigged in particularly technical conditions, by gathering an international and highly-skilled pool of rope jumpers, BASE-jumpers, highliners and rock climbers.
No need to mention that jumping from such hard & high exits have never been performed before! All those disciplines and people will be bound together in one synergistic effort to make it real.
// L'expédition aura lieu entre le 24 Août et le 15 Septembre 2016.
L'objectif principal est de raconter cette aventure hors du commun à travers un film qui sera diffusé mondialement.
Nous allons durant cette expédition, grâce à des équipes de professionels rope-jumpers, base jumpers et grimpeurs, monter un saut pendulaire (ou rope-jump) permettant une chute totale de l'ordre de 450 m, et pourquoi pas tenter de battre un record.

Vladimir Cellier from "Baraka Flims", the world famous outdoor film maker, will be in charge of filming this performance.
// Ce n'est autre que Vladimir Cellier, le prodige de "Baraka Flims", à l'origine de films outdoor reconnus, qui sera en charge de filmer l'expédition.


That was mostly all about our project, but now let's talk about what you will get! And we have some great news for you.. 

// Voilà pour notre projet, maintenant parlons de ton rôle dans cette aventure ;)

We propose you to support the filming of our project through a contribution of 10 dollars.  For your help you will :

// Soutiens la création du film avec un montant initial de 10 dollars et reçois en échange:

  1. Get a free copy of "Mont Rebei Project" film (available right now, see teaser above) or of the oncoming "Tre Cime Project" film (if you're patient!) as a courtesy of Baraka Flims. Link for download will be sent to you.                     // Un téléchargement gratuit du film de l'aventure "Tre Cime project", ou bien pour les impatients le film "MontRebei Project" déjà disponible et qui retrace l'histoire de notre dernier gros projet (voir la bande annonce ci-dessus)
  2. We don't forget anyone who helps us, and will put your name in the thanks part of the film credits                                                                                                         // On n'oublie personne! Ton aide est précieuse, et ton nom sera dans les remerciements du futur film "Tre Cime" project
  3. Get free printable HD pictures taken during Tre Cime expedition                       //De superbes photos HD du projet te seront envoyées
  4. You can ask for a friend/family/lover dedication in the film, it can be fun       // Vous pouvez également demander une dédicace à un proche, qui sera integrée au film
  5. Another great surprise...follow our FB page and know further about it... ;)      // Une autre grosse surprise...suis notre page FB pour en savoir davantage ;)


About the crews // Qui sont les équipes?:

Rock&Rope

Ukraine. Twice world record-holder in rope-jumping in free fall/total fall depth: 280/330 meters, established in Norway in 2010 together with the Russian rope-jumping team RAPT; 330/420 m was later established in Spain in 2014 in cooperation with Pyrenaline and High Jump teams. Conquered many object (cliffs and rocks) in Ukraine, Greece and France.
// Ukraine. Deux records du monde en rope-jump 280/330 meters, établi en Norvège en 2010 avec les russes RAPT. Puis 330/420 m établis en Espagne avec les Pyrénaline & HighJump. Ont conquéri plusieurs objets en Ukraine, France et Grèce.

Pyrenaline

France. The most experienced and skilled rope-jumping team in France, who tried to break the world rope-jumping record in free fall depth in Norway in 2013 together with the Polish team Dream Jump, and finally broke it in Spain with Rock&Rope. If they have performed the very first rope jumps in Pyrenean Moutains, they have also enjoyed jumping around Norway, Greece, Spain & Switzerland.
// Les toulousains sont l'équipe la plus expérimentée en France, avec une tentative de record en Norvège en 2013 avec les DreamJump, puis le record établi en Espagne avec les Rock&Rope. S'ils ont fait les tout premiers sauts Pyrénéens, leur passion les a aussi amenés en Norvège, Grèce, Espagne et Suisse.

Baraka Flims (Vladimir Cellier)

France. The world famous outdoor film company, managed by Vladimir Cellier, who filmed outdoor films references such as Petzl RocTrip Argentina, Rockin' Cuba, Petzl Roctrip China, Metronomic, Mont Rebei Project and many others. Winners of many outdoor cinema festivals. 
// France. Mondialement reconnu pour leurs productions outdoor, orchestré par Vladimir Cellier, qui a filmé notamment les Petzl RocTrip à Cuba, en Argentine et en Chine, le projet MontRebei et plein d'autres. Gagnants de plusieurs festival outdoor et montagne. 
We start this campaign to cover all filming process for this project and be able to share it with people accordingly.
// Cette campagne doit permettre de couvrir les dépenses relatives à la production du film retraçant l'aventure, afin de le partager sans limite!
Other ways you can help // Autre soutien

Don't hesitate to support the project by sharing our campaign with your friends and your mum!

// N'hésite pas à partager cette campagne avec tes amis et ta maman!

In anyway, keep tuned to get the freshest news of this project through our FB page and the release of the film itself! To be continued... :)

// Dans tous les cas on vous invite à suivre nos aventures sur la page FB, la sortie du film, et plein d'autres surprises ... ;)
story_txt:
We, Rock&Rope and Pyrénaline teams wish to make this dream come true and share it with y'all! We aim to gather rope-jump, highline and BASE-jump activities at Tre Cime di Lavaredo one of the most highlighted peaks in the European climbing. Embark & Jump with us in this adventure!   



// Les équipes Pyrénaline et Rock&Rope veulent partager un rêve avec vous, celui de rassembler les disciplines outdoor du saut pendulaire, de la highline et du BASE jump, sur le mythique spot Tre Cime en Italie. Embarquez avec nous dans cette aventure hors-normes!



 Tre Cime di Lavaredo, Dolomites, Italy, is an unique and legendary spot.Three peaks, the highest one - Cima Grande, 2999 m - is quite famous among outdoor activities lovers because of their outstanding look and picturesque trekking routes lying around them. The gorge is also widely known among rock climbers and BASE-jumpers communities. But despite the impressive heights, the exits (spots applicable for jumping) keep some exclusivity and only attract real enthusiastic sportsmen because of the difficult approach to the top.  // Il s'agit du spot légendaire Tre cime di Lavaredo, dans les Dolomites.Trois pics, dont le plus haut - Cima Grande 2999 m- est populaire parmi les amoureux de montagne, et c'est certainement grâce à son aspect sauvage & spectaculaire, ainsi qu'aux treks qui se trouvent autour. Si le lieu est très connu dans le milieu de la grimpe et du BASE, avec des hauteurs remarquables, il y reste un certain privilège car le sommet n'est pas si facile à atteindre.The expedition will take place between August 24th and September 15th, 2016.The main goal of the project consists is sharing worldwide this adventure with the making of an outdoor adventure film telling the story of this ambitious multisports expedition.With more than 450 meters of total fall, for the first time a huge rope-jump will be rigged in particularly technical conditions, by gathering an international and highly-skilled pool of rope jumpers, BASE-jumpers, highliners and rock climbers.No need to mention that jumping from such hard & high exits have never been performed before! All those disciplines and people will be bound together in one synergistic effort to make it real.// L'expédition aura lieu entre le 24 Août et le 15 Septembre 2016.L'objectif principal est de raconter cette aventure hors du commun à travers un film qui sera diffusé mondialement.Nous allons durant cette expédition, grâce à des équipes de professionels rope-jumpers, base jumpers et grimpeurs, monter un saut pendulaire (ou rope-jump) permettant une chute totale de l'ordre de 450 m, et pourquoi pas tenter de battre un record.
Vladimir Cellier from "Baraka Flims", the world famous outdoor film maker, will be in charge of filming this performance.// Ce n'est autre que Vladimir Cellier, le prodige de "Baraka Flims", à l'origine de films outdoor reconnus, qui sera en charge de filmer l'expédition.
That was mostly all about our project, but now let's talk about what you will get! And we have some great news for you.. 
// Voilà pour notre projet, maintenant parlons de ton rôle dans cette aventure ;)

We propose you to support the filming of our project through a contribution of 10 dollars.  For your help you will :
// Soutiens la création du film avec un montant initial de 10 dollars et reçois en échange:







Get a free copy of "Mont Rebei Project" film (available right now, see teaser above) or of the oncoming "Tre Cime Project" film (if you're patient!) as a courtesy of Baraka Flims. Link for download will be sent to you.                     // Un téléchargement gratuit du film de l'aventure "Tre Cime project", ou bien pour les impatients le film "MontRebei Project" déjà disponible et qui retrace l'histoire de notre dernier gros projet (voir la bande annonce ci-dessus)

We don't forget anyone who helps us, and will put your name in the thanks part of the film credits                                                                                                         // On n'oublie personne! Ton aide est précieuse, et ton nom sera dans les remerciements du futur film "Tre Cime" project

Get free printable HD pictures taken during Tre Cime expedition                       //De superbes photos HD du projet te seront envoyées

You can ask for a friend/family/lover dedication in the film, it can be fun       // Vous pouvez également demander une dédicace à un proche, qui sera integrée au film

Another great surprise...follow our FB page and know further about it... ;)      // Une autre grosse surprise...suis notre page FB pour en savoir davantage ;)






About the crews // Qui sont les équipes?:


Rock&RopeUkraine. Twice world record-holder in rope-jumping in free fall/total fall depth: 280/330 meters, established in Norway in 2010 together with the Russian rope-jumping team RAPT; 330/420 m was later established in Spain in 2014 in cooperation with Pyrenaline and High Jump teams. Conquered many object (cliffs and rocks) in Ukraine, Greece and France. // Ukraine. Deux records du monde en rope-jump 280/330 meters, établi en Norvège en 2010 avec les russes RAPT. Puis 330/420 m établis en Espagne avec les Pyrénaline & HighJump. Ont conquéri plusieurs objets en Ukraine, France et Grèce.


PyrenalineFrance. The most experienced and skilled rope-jumping team in France, who tried to break the world rope-jumping record in free fall depth in Norway in 2013 together with the Polish team Dream Jump, and finally broke it in Spain with Rock&Rope. If they have performed the very first rope jumps in Pyrenean Moutains, they have also enjoyed jumping around Norway, Greece, Spain & Switzerland. // Les toulousains sont l'équipe la plus expérimentée en France, avec une tentative de record en Norvège en 2013 avec les DreamJump, puis le record établi en Espagne avec les Rock&Rope. S'ils ont fait les tout premiers sauts Pyrénéens, leur passion les a aussi amenés en Norvège, Grèce, Espagne et Suisse.


Baraka Flims (Vladimir Cellier)France. The world famous outdoor film company, managed by Vladimir Cellier, who filmed outdoor films references such as Petzl RocTrip Argentina, Rockin' Cuba, Petzl Roctrip China, Metronomic, Mont Rebei Project and many others. Winners of many outdoor cinema festivals. // France. Mondialement reconnu pour leurs productions outdoor, orchestré par Vladimir Cellier, qui a filmé notamment les Petzl RocTrip à Cuba, en Argentine et en Chine, le projet MontRebei et plein d'autres. Gagnants de plusieurs festival outdoor et montagne. 

We start this campaign to cover all filming process for this project and be able to share it with people accordingly.// Cette campagne doit permettre de couvrir les dépenses relatives à la production du film retraçant l'aventure, afin de le partager sans limite!
