 Don't hesitate to support the project by sharing our campaign with your friends and your mum!
// N'hésite pas à partager cette campagne avec tes amis et ta maman!
In anyway, keep tuned to get the freshest news of this project through our FB page and the release of the film itself! To be continued... :)
// Dans tous les cas on vous invite à suivre nos aventures sur la page FB, la sortie du film, et plein d'autres surprises ... ;)

story:
[texte en Francais en dessous - in French bellow]

https://escapehiking.com/

Manon Marchand, founder of Escape Hiking for Women, was born and raised in France. 

Just a few years ago she was working in Paris as a Public Relations Director, living a comfortable city life, certain that sports and nature were not for her. But a pivotal moment came to pause and look at her life, and she decided she needed change, needed an adventure. 

She left Paris for 8 months of traveling and backpacking by herself in India and Nepal. There she hiked the Annapurna Base Camp trail in the Himalayas. Having no hiking experience, ten days of intense physical exertion at a 15,000 foot elevation in winter conditions was the the personal challenge that changed her life forever. 

She discovered untapped physical and mental potential and came back home with renewed self-confidence and a plan to redesign her life. She now lives in New York city with her husband and works as a certified hiking-and-camping guide. 

Escape Hiking for Women is Manon's new challenge: to offer the possibility to live this kind of experience to all women; the possibility to feel wilder, stronger and more confident. That's also why we need YOU!

The Escape concept:

Escape is a woman-owned and women-led company dedicated to NYC women who want to: 

- Live a new adventure far from the city and their daily life

- Connect with the outdoors on a deeper level

- Have an unforgettable experience of sisterhood.

We offer women 2-day weekend trips into the wilderness. Hiking, backpacking, tent camping with a group of 5 women and a professional guide, licensed by the New York State. 

Every woman can go on an adventure, even if they have never hiked or camped. And they don’t need a man to join them. 

The first Escape's weekend will be on June 24th 2017.

Why are we launching a crowdfunding campaign?

We know what it is to live in the city and we know how difficult (even impossible) it can be to plan an outdoor getaway: What if I don't have hiking/camping gear? Where can I go if I don't have a car? What trails or reserves allow for overnight camping? And so on.

Escape's goal is to connect ALL women with the outdoors, not only the ones who are ALREADY experienced hikers or comfortable being out in the wild. We have to think about the women who really want to get beyond their comfort zones, want to experience being in the outdoors, but never did it.

What do they need? An all-inclusive service.

We provide round-trip transportation from Manhattan and back in Escape's van with an awesome experienced driver (a woman of course!), 3 meals a day, professional hiking-and-camping guides, unforgettable weekends with themes and dedicated consultants (yoga, mindfulness, hike in French, art, etc.). 

We realized there was an unanswered need for a packaged outdoors experience: many women who aren't used to the outdoors don't own a backpack, a sleeping bag, a tent, a head lamp...and they don't want to buy them just for 1 or 2 weekends a year. 

The solution? In order to connect ALL women with the outdoors we have to provide all necessary hiking-and-camping gear that is high quality, durable and designed FOR women. This is how we can bring women together--especially those new to the outdoors--for an amazing experience in the wilderness. 

Buying well-made, durable sleeping bags, mats, pads, hiking sticks, tents, headlamps, individual First Aid kits, rain protection, backpacks, hiking poles and other core supplies for our groups has a cost: $10,000. 

How can you be a part of our "Every woman deserves an Escape" challenge and help Escape to buy the gear needed for each client?

You can donate right now via this website, just click on the "BACK IT" button. 

If you aren't able to help financially at this time but you still want to support us, please share this campaign, tell your friends and family, etc.

Thank you to all the present and future women of the wild!

"Do not follow where the path may lead, go instead where there is not path and leave a trail"-Ralph Waldo Emerson

--------------------------------------------

 

Manon Marchand, fondatrice de Escape Hiking for Women, est née et a grandi en France.
Il y a quelques années, elle travaillait à Paris en tant que Directrice de communication, vivant une vie urbaine confortable.

Alors qu'elle prend le temps de faire une pause et de faire le point sur sa vie, elle décide qu'elle a besoin de changement et d'aventure. 

Elle quitte Paris et voyage seule pendant 8 mois en Inde et au Népal. C'est au Népal qu'elle se lance un défi un peu fou : partir à l'ascension de l'Annapurna Base Camp (Himalaya). Elle n'a aucune expérience particulière, n’est absolument pas ce qu’on peut appeler une « sportive » et ces dix jours d'efforts physiques intenses à 4200m d'altitude dans des conditions hivernales sont un défi personnel qui va changer sa vie pour toujours.

Elle se découvre un potentiel physique et mental qu'elle ignorait et revient avec une confiance en elle toute neuve et un plan pour la suite de sa vie.

Elle vit aujourd'hui à New York avec son mari et travaille comme guide randonnée/camping, certifiée par l'Etat de New-York.

Escape Hiking for Women est le nouveau défi de Manon: offrir à toutes les femmes la possibilité de vivre ce genre d'expérience, de se sentir plus sauvage, plus forte et plus confiante. C'est aussi pourquoi elle a besoin de vous !


Le concept Escape:


Escape est une entreprise créée et pensée par une femme, dédiée aux New-Yorkaises qui ont envie/besoin de:
- Vivre une nouvelle aventure loin de la ville, du stress, du paraître et de leur vie quotidienne
- Se (re)connecter avec la nature 
- Partager une expérience inoubliable entre femmes.

Nous offrons des weekends de randonnée (2 jours-1 nuit minimum pour vraiment déconnecter) en pleine nature pour des groupes de 5 femmes accompagnées d'une guide certifiée.


Toutes les femmes peuvent bénéficier des bienfaits de la nature, même si elles n’ont jamais fait de randonnée ou de camping. Et elles n'ont pas besoin d'un homme pour les accompagner.

Le premier week-end Escape est prévu le 24 Juin 2017.


Pourquoi cette campagne de financement?

Nous savons ce que c'est que de vivre à New York. Nous savons combien il est difficile (voir impossible) de planifier une escapade en plein air : que faire si je n'ai pas de matériel de randonnée/camping ? Où puis-je aller si je n'ai pas de voiture ? Où puis-je camper ? ...


L'objectif d'Escape est de connecter TOUTES les femmes avec la nature, pas seulement celles qui sont déjà randonneuses et ont l'habitude de ce genre d’expérience.

Nous devons penser aux femmes qui veulent sortir de leur zone de confort, découvrir quelque-chose de différent, se faire du bien, faire une pause, prendre une vraie bouffée d'air frais pendant plusieurs jours mais ne l'ont jamais fait.


De quoi ont-elles besoin? D'un service tout-compris.

Nous offrons le transport aller-retour depuis Manhattan avec le van Escape et notre conductrice (une femme évidemment !), 3 repas par jour, des guides professionnelles, des week-ends inoubliables dont certains à thèmes avec des consultantes dédiées (yoga, pleine conscience, randonnée en français -French touch oblige-, art-thérapie, etc.).


Nous avons constaté qu'il y a un facteur capital qui bloque de nombreuses femmes qui souhaitent partir en randonnée mais ne l'ont jamais -ou presque jamais- fait: elles n'ont pas le matériel nécessaire ou approprié. Elles ne possèdent pas de sac à dos, sac de couchage, tente, lampe frontale, cape de pluie ... et ne veulent pas investir juste pour un ou deux week-ends par an.


Notre solution ? Fournir le matériel de randonnée et de camping nécessaire. De bonne qualité, durable et conçu pour le corps des femmes (la plupart des sacs à dos notamment ne sont pas adaptés aux formes féminines et sont très inconfortables).

C'est grâce à l'achat de ce matériel spécifique que nous pourrons offrir à toutes les femmes les joies de l'aventure en pleine nature. 


L'achat de sacs de couchage, de tapis de sol, de bâtons de marche, de tentes, de lampes frontales, de trousses de premiers secours individuelles, de protection contre la pluie, de sacs à dos... pour chaque membre de nos groupes a un coût : 10 000 $ (9.096 Euros).


Comment pouvez-vous faire partie de notre défi « Chaque femme mérite une Escape» et aider Escape Hiking for Women à acheter le matériel nécessaire pour ses clientes?


Vous pouvez faire un don dès maintenant via ce site, en cliquant simplement sur le bouton "BACK IT".


Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de nous aider financièrement mais souhaitez nous soutenir différemment, partagez cette campagne via les réseaux sociaux, parlez-en à vos amis, votre famille, etc.

Merci de la part de toutes les actuelles et futures 'femmes sauvages’ !


« Ne suivez pas un chemin tout tracé, allez plutôt là où il n'y a pas de route et créez votre propre sentier ». Ralph Waldo Emerson

story:
My Story

On the night of Easter Sunday 2013, I embarked on a Mission Trip to Nicaragua, helping to lead a group of 40 others. We went with the goal of buidling a community center by a Catholic Church also built by missionary hands in a small town near Chinandega, Nicaragua.  We also ran a carnival for children that lived in a garbage dump, handing out clothing, and food, and playing games with the kids.  The experiance was amazing and I knew right away I needed to come back and not just next year.  I found out right after the trip was over that another group was coming to Nicaragua in the middle of May.  They were going to finish what we started.  I saw a window of opportunity and after finally getting their okay for joining the group, I will be heading back in just a few days.
The trip begins May 15th, and ends May 23rd, 2013.

What I need

This is all very short notice.  I am seeking help in reimbursing my flight costs and accomodations / food / transportation costs.  I am going out on a limb because I know God wants me to go again. I trust it will all work out.

  • Flight Costs: $800
  • Accomodations, transportation, food costs: $250
  • Extra money will go towards the projects down there and next years mission trip (I am planning to go again with a large group).

The Impact

I am going on this journey because of a powerful experiance I had just last month.  I know God asks us to take a step at a time and we often times can't see any further ahead.  But I know he wants me to go.  I hope to see our finished project of the Community Center, helping on its final stages, and also to aid the local people there, bringing them closer to God in whatever way God wants to use me, showing them that God loves and cares for them too!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute right now but you can help by getting the word out there and using the Indiegogo Share tools!
story_txt:
My Story
On the night of Easter Sunday 2013, I embarked on a Mission Trip to Nicaragua, helping to lead a group of 40 others. We went with the goal of buidling a community center by a Catholic Church also built by missionary hands in a small town near Chinandega, Nicaragua.  We also ran a carnival for children that lived in a garbage dump, handing out clothing, and food, and playing games with the kids.  The experiance was amazing and I knew right away I needed to come back and not just next year.  I found out right after the trip was over that another group was coming to Nicaragua in the middle of May.  They were going to finish what we started.  I saw a window of opportunity and after finally getting their okay for joining the group, I will be heading back in just a few days.
The trip begins May 15th, and ends May 23rd, 2013.

What I need
This is all very short notice.  I am seeking help in reimbursing my flight costs and accomodations / food / transportation costs.  I am going out on a limb because I know God wants me to go again. I trust it will all work out.

Flight Costs: $800
Accomodations, transportation, food costs: $250
Extra money will go towards the projects down there and next years mission trip (I am planning to go again with a large group).



The Impact
I am going on this journey because of a powerful experiance I had just last month.  I know God asks us to take a step at a time and we often times can't see any further ahead.  But I know he wants me to go.  I hope to see our finished project of the Community Center, helping on its final stages, and also to aid the local people there, bringing them closer to God in whatever way God wants to use me, showing them that God loves and cares for them too!

Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't contribute right now but you can help by getting the word out there and using the Indiegogo Share tools!

story:
Coalatree's original Haswell Survival Knife was made in extremely limited quantities and sold out in no time. We've spent the past four years searching the globe for a way to bring this unique, one-of-a-kind survival tool back, without sacrificing an ounce of quality or craftsmanship.

\
 

Choose your reward below. A limited number of left-handed sheaths and Diamond Jim handcrafted sheaths are available. And yes, the Haswell Knife is on track to ship by Christmas!

The Haswell Knife is built to last from quality materials and makes no compromises in construction or durability. Made with high-forged Carbon Steel and reinforced with brass rivets, the knife will last a lifetime.

The Scandi grind blade is perfect for bushcraft and outdoor survival. The wedge-shaped edge allows for maximum efficiency in cutting, batoning, shaving, and more.

“Straight out of the frontier days,” and they weren’t kidding. We’ve teamed up with Utah’s most skilled master leatherman, Diamond Jim Davis to create a special edition sheath, made entirely by hand just like the cowboys used them.

The sheaths are entirely handmade from start to finish, using the same tools from the days of yore. That means no electricity and no BS—just old fashioned, tried-and-true tools.

Because this process is so labor-intensive, we’re offering a small run of Haswell Knives with Limited Edition, Diamond Jim Handcrafted Leather Sheaths. Don’t miss your chance to snag these special collector’s items!

story:
Please help Candace get a lightweight, functional laptop to take around the world next year!

Candace is an incredible young lady with a passion for helping others. As a Christian filled with the loving Spirit, she has always found it easy to empathize with those around her and has shown compassion for everyone she knows in their times of need, even if she's only known someone for a few days. That's why she applied to join The World Race in 2015! She knows from experience that she has exactly the passion and the mindset to visit 11 countries in 11 months, sharing the Gospel and sharing herself to help as many people as possible. 

Upon acceptance to The World Race 2015 Route 5 (because those at Adventures in Missions have faith in her abilities and commitment to the Lord), Candace had to start focusing hard on finding support. One thing that would be a great blessing for her is a laptop. The one she has been using at home for work projects has given out, and she can't afford to buy another before her trip. This is one of those expenses that isn't a necessity of life, but it will make a huge impact on her mission's success! 

With a laptop, Candace will be able to stay in touch with family, friends, and supporters during her journey. Not only will this keep her uplifted, but it will bring comfort and peace to her loved ones back home knowing that God is shielding her from any and all dangers around the world. Additionally, it will allow Candace to remain faithful to supporters who want updates, who need to be periodically reminded that their funds are being used for a great cause. It will give Candace a means of continuing to raise money so she can stay in the field and help more people. In this respect, donating to this campaign is giving Candace a means to make a living next year. She's leaving behind her home and her comforts as well as her career. But she's an ambassador of hope, and it's up to us, her community, to employ her in global outreach. 

Your Support Will Be Appreciated!

Please take a look at our list of perks and check back often to see our progress and new perks that may be added as the overall campaign grows! When you support a missionary, you spread the good news through their travels as well as through your own community. You lead by example. Claim a perk that announces your faith! You might be surprised by how contagious your passion can be. 

Anything you contribute helps, even if we don't reach a certain amount. Candace and her team will work to make up any difference and purchase the laptop before she leaves the USA. If you would like to continue to view Candace's progress and offer support for her travels after this campaign has ended, please bookmark http://candacevandoren.theworldrace.org. You can even enroll in a monthly donation!

You Can Make a Difference TODAY

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help by sharing this campaign! Share it on every social platform, at work, at school, at church, and at home. 

At the very least (financially) and truly at the very most, please pray for blessings!

Therefore do not worry, saying, "What shall we eat?" or "What shall we drink?" or "What shall we wear?"  -Matthew 6:31 NKJV

story:
The Situation.

     The rural village of Khanikhola, roughly 26 km away from Kathmandu, was devastated during the Nepal Earthquake. A community of 3,000+ residents is now homeless with ongoing rescue efforts for those trapped in the remote corners of the village. As you can see from the footage above, Kathmandu is in utter disarray. The situation is far worse for Nepalis living outside in the mountainous regions of the country. The full scale of the destruction is only beginning to come to light. 


 The people of Khanikhola are immensely resilient people. However, this recent natural catastrophe is further compounded by the prolonged state of poverty the entire country is immersed in. Given the lack of infrastructure, there is simply no way for Nepal to rebuild itself alone. 

 

Hope is not lost.We can help. 

The Goal: Short Term and Long Term Assistance

  Short Term Aid: A portion of your contribution will go to meeting the immediate needs of the community. Initial reports indicate that tents, foods, water, and basic medical supplies are the most urgent items needed in the community.  

    In addition, around 50 families have taken shelter at Super Catalyst Academy, a local school. The school suffered minor damage, so your contribution will enable the school to finish construction of a biogas kitchen to be used to cook food for the community and well as improve the school’s restrooms for communal use. 

Long Term Development: The rest of the proceeds will go directly into construction projects aimed at stabilizing the infrastructure  in Khanikhola. As of now, information is sparse. Reports on the current conditions come out in trickles, so a full fledged plan has yet to materialize. But we’re getting updates every day and will post the finalized plan as it grows. 

Who we are. 

  Volunteers

        We are a collective of volunteers who, through the twists and turns in our lives,  found our way to Khanikhola. Most of us volunteered at Superb Catalyst Academy (SCA), a primary and secondary school focusing on increasing access to education. Khanikhola, like most of Nepal, is very rural. This means going to school is a daily struggle for Nepal’s youngest citizens. SCA’s outreach and assistance programs meant that low-caste, differently abled, and remote students could attend class. SCA has also been at the forefront of women’s empowerment by creating women-lead and oriented development programs. 

    Our work with this school has left a profound connection to Khanikhola. We are organizing across the globe to gather support for our dear friends. 

Local Team 


      Our efforts are being coordinated on the ground by Ajay Rimal and Shekhar Karki.  Ajay Rimal is the founder and principal of SCA.  Born and raised in Khanikhola, Ajay has committed his life to bringing a both non-discriminatory and  holistic education to the children of his hometown. His is now working with several relief groups to use the funds to purchase critical supplies and is one of the community leaders who will guide the next steps for Khanikhola.  
   Shekhar Karki is the current director of SCA. He has worked as both a Nepal Youth Leader and Lions Club Leader. His high reputation in the community has put him on the front line for disaster relief. He too will use his extensive network to draft a plan for the future of Khanikhola.

story:
We are getting married!

Dear friends and family, we are getting married and so excited that you are in our lives to share this joy! Here is more on us in case you are curious :)

Ann grew up in Shanghai, China, and came to the U.S. for college. She studied psychology in Greenville, SC. Expecting the U.S. to be the "free" country she heard about in China, South Carolina was quite an adventure for 4 years :) The most fun from these 4 years include her travels in Southern Africa, which further changed how she sees the world. Now she is a graduate student at Princeton, studying how we make decisions. The past 8 years have shaped Ann in a unique way, and she thought life couldn't get any better until...

Jeff grew up in Toronto, Canada. His friends from childhood and college are some of the most important people in his life. After studying computer science and neuroscience at McGill, he went on to pursue a Ph.D. in neuroscience at NYU, focusing on emotion and cognition. Now he is a researcher at Princeton, balancing work and life in the city of New York. He is fascinated with all aspects of life: nature, art, technology... and is never bored. And love came when he least expected...

The rest is history :) We have had the best 2.5 years of our lives because of each other, and now we want to share our commitment with you!

As you can see, two people with completely different upbringings and experience somehow found the perfect companion in each other. We are so lucky to have met, fallen in love, and committed to one another. Thank you so much for being our friends and family along our journey. And cheers to a new and exciting future ahead!

Why the honeymoon fund?

Why not a registry?

  • Really, don't get us anything! We have a casual engagement party and a tiny wedding. Your presence is really all we care about. If you must give us something... we want that to be part of our memory forever :)
  • As you know, we are moving to Shanghai in the fall. So a traditional registry also does not make too much sense. But an unforgettable honeymoon seems to be the perfect solution!

How else can you help?

Just be your amazing selves and keep being in our lives. And come visit us in Shanghai! 

PS.  If you want to send us a cheque the old fashioned way, that's ok too!

story:
Come and see, you have the key (Ita version)

Il progetto “Come and see, you have the key” si pone l’obiettivo di portare a conoscenza, sensibilizzare, comunicare attraverso le immagini, realtà e verità spesso non conosciute nel mondo civilizzato. Il reportage è la mia passione ed ho bisogno del vostro aiuto per portare in mostra, in alcune città italiane, uno spaccato di vita che ho conosciuto e fotografato attraverso gli occhi dei bambini.


“La comunicazione visiva è la trasmissione di un messaggio tramite un’immagine, che rappresenta in maniera metaforica la realtà. La comunicazione per immagini permette di raggiungere il massimo effetto comunicativo nel più breve tempo possibile, grazie al suo forte potere di richiamo, alla sua spesso immediata comprensibilità e alla facilità di memorizzazione. Può avvenire attraverso diversi strumenti quali la fotografia.”


Il progetto

Ho realizzato alcuni scatti fotografici all’interno di uno dei quartieri più poveri al mondo in India a Mumbay nel Dharavi, in collaborazione con l’associazione “Reality gives” la quale organizza diversi tour dentro lo Slum più grande dell’India, per dare la possibilità di visitare e toccare con mano la vera realtà indiana; i fondi raccolti, vengono utilizzati per promuovere iniziative all’interno del Dharavi rivolte per lo più a bambini, tra le quali quella di aver costituito una scuola che da la possibilità all’associazione di poter fronteggiare i costi per gli insegnanti.

(Per visitare il sito:

http://www.realitygives.org/get_involved_tour.php)

Il mio progetto, ha l’obiettivo di affiancarsi a tale associazione cercando attraverso le immagini da me realizzate, di raccogliere dei fondi innanzitutto da destinare all’associazione ed in secondo piano, ma non meno importante, cercare di portare a conoscenza da una parte e sensibilizzare dall’altra, la gente che parteciperà ed entrerà in contatto con me.


Il tuo aiuto

Ho bisogno di stampare le fotografie, e di poter organizzare diverse esposizioni fotografiche in giro per l’Italia (dove risiedo) e anche in Europa; l’ingresso alle esposizioni fotografiche sarà gratis per tutti e lascerò alle immagini il compito di sensibilizzare la gente, la quale potrà devolvere denaro per l’associazione “Reality gives” in India, ed entrare in contato con una realtà sconosciuta. Gli scatti potranno essere acquistati, così da innescare una raccolta fondi continua per poter arrivare con questa mostra in più luoghi possibili.

Per organizzare questo, ho bisogno di raccogliere 5000 euro che serviranno appunto per:

-  stampe delle fotografie 50 stampe fine art (100 cm per 60 cm);

-  spostamenti ed organizzazione di esposizioni fotografiche, di cui la prima nella città di Matera.


Grazie!

Ringrazio sin da ora tutti quelli che vorranno sostenere il mio progetto con una donazione o anche semplicemente pubblicizzando questa iniziativa; un grazie da parte dei bambini che vivono nello Slum Dharavi.



Come and see, you have the key (Eng version)

The project “come and see, you have the key” aims to show, through the images, situations and truths often ignored by the civilized world. Photo-reportage is my passion and I need your help to show, in some Italian cities, a slice of life I got in touch with and photographed through children's eyes.

Visual communication is the conveyance of a message through an image which represents reality metaphorically. This kind of communication allows to reach the best communicative effect instantly, thanks to its great power to draw the attention, its immediate power of understanding and memorizing.


The project

I have taken some pictures in one of the poorest neighborhoods in Mumbay (India), Dharavi, in collaboration with the association “Reality gives”, which offers the possibility to go on many guided tours in the biggest Slum of India, in order to give people the possibility to see with their own eyes the situation in which hundreds of people live.

The funds collected by “Reality gives” are used to support projects for the children living in Dharavi, such as the construction of a school.

(Click here if you want to visit their website:

http://www.realitygives.org/get_involved_tour.php)

With my project I would like to support this association and with my pictures I hope to collect funds, which will be given to “Reality gives”. Moreover, I hope my pictures will be useful to those who want to know more about people from Dharavi and want to have a part in the completion of this project. My pictures can be bought in order to activate a continuous collection which will bring this photography exhibition as far as possible.


I need your help

For this reason, I need to print some pictures and set up some photography exhibitions in Italy and Europe, with a free entrance and the possibility to make a voluntary donation. I will give my pictures the task of sensitising people towards the contents.

In order to do so, I need to collect 5000 E, which will be used this way:

-  to print 50 pictures (100 cm x 60 cm)

-  to cope with the travel costs for the first exhibitions in Matera.


Thanks!

So I thank all the people who want to support this project with a donation or want to publicize this campaign, and a big “thank you” from the children living in Dharavi.

communication is the conveyance of a message through an image which represents
reality metaphorically. This kind of communication allows to reach the best
communicative effect instantly, thanks to its great power to draw the
attention, its immediate power of understanding and memorizing.The project
I have taken some pictures in one
of the poorest neighborhoods in Mumbay (India), Dharavi, in collaboration with
the association “Reality gives”, which offers the possibility to go on many
guided tours in the biggest Slum of India, in order to give people the
possibility to see with their own eyes the situation in which hundreds of
people live.
The funds collected by “Reality gives” are used to support projects for
the children living in Dharavi, such as the construction of a school. 
(Click here if you want to visit their website:http://www.realitygives.org/get_involved_tour.php)With my project I would like to support this association and with my pictures
I hope to collect funds, which will be given to “Reality gives”. Moreover, I
hope my pictures will be useful to those who want to know more about people
from Dharavi and want to have a part in the completion of this project. My pictures can be bought in order to activate
a continuous collection which will bring this photography exhibition as far as
possible. 
I need your help
For
this reason, I need to print some pictures and set up some photography
exhibitions in Italy and Europe, with a free entrance and the possibility to
make a voluntary donation. I will give my pictures the task of sensitising
people towards the contents.
In
order to do so, I need to collect 5000 E, which will be used this way:
-  to print 50 pictures (100 cm x 60 cm)-  to cope with the travel costs for the
first exhibitions in Matera.
Thanks!

So I thank all the people who want to support this project with a
donation or want to publicize this campaign, and a big “thank you” from the
children living in Dharavi.

story:
The Slicks Travel System is a modular travel backpack with internal inserts designed to keep you organized and looking slick no matter where you are: at work, on the road, or exploring new places.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

That’s what we love about traveling, isn’t it? We’re never the same people at the end of the journey as we were when we started out.

But the luggage we bring with us stubbornly stays the same. Why is that?

Think about it: Right now, your closet is stuffed with pieces of luggage, each one with a single purpose.

 

 

Your carry-on roller bag is a box on wheels that has only seen the inside of airports and hotel rooms. You dread the wrinkles you have to iron out of your clothes when you get to your destination—that is, if the carry-on doesn’t get checked at the gate and then lost somewhere between connecting flights.

Your gym bag is a big, stinky sack of dirty laundry and toiletries all tossed together like a funk salad. When you go from the gym to work, you have to hide it under your desk or in the trunk of your car because it’s out of place in your buttoned-up office.

Your $500 hiking backpack is up on a shelf collecting dust. You bought it for a trip to Alaska. That was five years ago. It’s nice, but at 70 liters it’s too cumbersome and specialized to use as an everyday pack.

Your laptop bag is great for carrying your laptop. That’s it. But it’s a pain to get around with a laptop bag and a carry-on roller bag when you’re hailing a cab or riding the train to the airport.

Your cycling backpack makes your back sweaty and your clothes wrinkled. When you finally get to work, even after you change your clothes, you look like you’ve been biking through a torrential rainstorm.

Then there’s your well-worn backpack you’ve had for a decade. Its buckles are broken, there are holes in the bottom, and you have many painful memories of being the person at the front of the coffee shop line, dumping your personal effects onto the counter in a desperate hunt for your wallet.

So far, that’s six bags, each made for different functions, occasions and settings. Add to the mix your hydration pack for mountain biking, your briefcase, and the monogrammed fanny-pack your great-aunt gave you ---that’s a ton of baggage.

And what about all the emotional baggage? Stress, embarrassment, frustration, dread…

You don’t need all that baggage. 

You are one person on an amazing journey. 

You need one bag that transforms to reflect and simplify the many facets of your life.

That’s what the Slicks Travel System is all about.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Slicks Travel System is designed as a modular luggage system, available either as a base backpack only or in three tailored options (SUIT, TRIP & BIZ), each with additional internal inserts to expand the function of the pack.

 

 

Let’s take a look the many ways your stuff can fit into the Slicks Travel System (and the many ways the Slicks Travel System will fit into your life).

 

 

Cool, huh?

Checkout these two videos we made that demonstrate better how you can pack up your Slicks:

  • For 2-3 days business trips
  • For 3-4 days leisure holidays

Now let’s take a closer look at the base backpack. 

 

 

Let’s say you need a great travel bag that can meet the demands of all kinds of travel, be it your daily commute to work, leisure getaway or business trip. You’ve got that with our 30 Litre capacity Slicks backpack. 

First of all, take a look at the exterior design:

 

 

There’s a reason we call it “Slicks.” We wanted to eliminate all of the hanging bits and bobs (aka “slop” in the baggage industry) and bulky pockets associated with backpacks. The result is a sleek, modern-yet-timeless shape. 

 

You get two color options:  black with a yellow stripe for a sporty look or black with a black logo stripe for a professional look.

 

 

 

Instead of external pockets, we’ve created discreetly-positioned interior pockets behind hidden zippers.

 

 

For added security, we have designed zipper pockets where you can stow the zipper pullers, making it difficult for thieves to easily access your valuables.

 

 

When needed, you can additionally lock up the main compartment and laptop compartment to secure your pack contents.

 

The front duffle-bag style pocket is a great spot for bulky and irregular shaped items that are the bane of most bags.

 

 

On the side, hidden behind a flap, you will find a dedicated compartment for your shoes.

 

 

The pack keeps your laptop safe and within easy reach thanks to a dedicated laptop compartment that fits devices up to 15-inches and is suspended for even better protection.

 

 

Need to do a quick change to a hipster street look or Mr. Professional? No problem- we've got you covered with Slicks.

Just stow away one of the shoulder straps and sling the other one over your shoulder to use your Slicks as a trendy messenger bag.

 

 

Or just unclip both the straps and tuck them away, and voila: your Slicks is an elegant attachè.

 

 

Here's how Slicks (and you!) transform:

 

 

And yes, unlike many bags claiming to be carry-ons, the Slicks pack is compliant with the latest IATA carry-on size recommendations.

 

 

The 600D PU-coated Nylon material is water resistant, but just for peace of mind, the pack comes with a seam-sealed, light-weight rain cover stashed in a hidden side pocket, ready to slip on in the event of a downpour.

 

 

And if you find yourself cycling at night or crossing roads in foggy weather, we have got plenty of reflective bits on the pack, zipper and rain over to keep you safe. And shiny.

 

 

Now let’s crack this baby open and see what’s on the inside:

 

 

You’ll notice that in addition to the classic “open from the top” access found in most backpacks, you can also open the Slicks like a suitcase and lay it flat — the clamshell style makes packing easier. 

 

 

Oh, and what’s this? More pockets? Yep: a pocket for storing valuables, another one for documents, and a mesh pocket as well.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Now that we’ve gotten to know the base pack, let’s acquaint ourselves with what makes the Slicks Travel System a System: the modular inlays. 

 

 

Are you always on the move, commuting from work to play or vice versa? The SUIT option is designed for anyone who needs to look dapper while they’re on the road.

With the SUIT option, the Slicks backpack comes with an ingenious removable Suitcover that keeps your business suit and shirt secure and wrinkle-free in your bag.

 

 

 

 

Check this out: a nifty collapsible hanger for easy storage. 

 

 

 

 

Are you a road warrior? The TRIP option is the perfect travel companion for work or for adventure. It combines the backpack with a removable Tripcover, a clever and compact double-sided mobile wardrobe for organising your clothes and toiletries.

 

 

There are loads of hidden compartments--some you may not discover until your second or third trip!

 

 

The front side of the Tripcover features two large zip-around compartments, each with additional zip-pockets - perfect for stashing your socks and underwear.

The top large pocket of the Tripcover is designed to pack your clothes, like your jeans and t-shirts.

 

 

It also houses a detachable “stink-proof” water-repellent laundry bag, roomy enough to contain a small pile of soiled clothes.

 

 

In the lower pocket of the Tripcover, you will find the essential 'dopp-kit'. The hanging washbag has every pocket imaginable including a super-sneaky spot for your contact lens case (no more blind groping around a hotel bathroom).

 

 

The dopp-kit is designed to also fit in the 'duffle-style' outside pocket of the backpack --- you end up with more space in the Tripcover to pack clothes. And it gives you easier access to it at airport security or for in-flight use.

 

 

The back of the Tripcover opens like a suitcase and there’s enough room in here for two or three shirts; there’s even a pocket for your tie.

 

 

The first thing you’ll notice inside is something you don’t see anywhere in travel gear: a Shirtcover with a collar protector--that’s right: no more crumpled collars. By the way, the Shirtcover was inspired by our co-founder, Curdegn’s inability to fold a dress shirt. We know he’s not alone in his exasperation. 

So to the millions of “folding challenged” out there: this one’s for you:

 

 

 

 

You’re all of these things: a career-driven professional, an adventure-seeking explorer, and a homebody who wants to relax in the park on a Sunday. For all of those aspects of you, we’ve created the BIZ option: an all-rounder featuring the Slicks backpack, the Suitcover, and the Tripcover. 

With BIZ, you are ready to configure your Slicks endlessly to adapt to your changing travel needs: business, leisure or commute.

 

Here's a summary of all the four options that make up the Slicks Travel System:

 

 

We’re pretty sure we could stop here and let you get your sweet InDemand deal on a Slicks, but we want you to be absolutely certain that Slicks is going to make your life on the road more organized and stress-free.

 

 

Let’s hear some stories from people who’ve gotten a chance to try out the Slicks Travel System. This is just a sampling of the rave reviews our test-nomads are sending back from the field.

Check out Peter. He was the first beta-user of a SLICKS Travel System (BIZ option), and for the past six months, he’s been putting it through its paces in every travel scenario you can imagine. In fact, he lived out of the SLICKS as his only bag for a two-week trip through Europe!

 

 

Say “Hi” to Mathias. He literally wrote the book on bicycle commuting. He started cycling to lose weight: he started at 350 lbs and within a year, lost 150 lbs. His daily trip is 14 miles each way. Every day. Year-round. Through all weather. In Minnesota.

 

 

Meet Kerry Hayes, editor and creator of airportlifestyle.com. She fell in love with travel so much that she married a commercial airline pilot. They both tried out the Slicks BIZ, and this is what they have to say:

 

 

 

 

 

Here is a summary of the InDemand pre-order options you can choose from:

 

 

 

 

Full disclosure: 

 

 

As in, when you think of Swiss people climbing and skiing Alpine mountains and making the world more efficient, more neutral, and more punctual—we’re totally those guys (okay, so we don’t yodel. Otherwise—Swiss through and through).

Think Swiss Army Knife and CERN Large Hadron Collider: we have a national obsession with designing products that reflect and simplify the multifunctional and multidimensional nature of life. The Slicks Travel System is the natural evolutionary step in Swiss design.

 

 

As a product design house with engineers and industrial designers, we have over a decade of experience in designing and developing all things Swiss for our global partners. But that’s not where we stop - we also actively project manage production and global shipping logistics with leading contract manufacturers in Asia from our branch office in Taiwan. 

So we truly understand what it takes to scale up production and manage global logistics - we are not just a bunch of dorky designers. We’re also a bunch of production geeks.

 

 

We designed, developed and engineered a little gadget called the World Travel Adapter Pro+ for our partner, SKROSS. It’s the world’s safest and most compact 3-pole outlet adapter that connects to all 2- and 3-pole devices in 150-plus countries worldwide. It’s one of the most popular travel adapters globally and it won the prestigious Red Dot Design Award. It’s an ultimate embodiment of everything that is clever from Switzerland. But enough bragging. 

So we understand what it takes to design and produce a brilliant product that not only solves problems encountered by travelers, but we also know what it takes to create something that will sell like hotcakes. Compact, efficient, beautifully-designed Swiss hotcakes. (We call them crepes.) 

 

 

When our co-founder and lead designer, Remo, was a young Swissling in Industrial Design School back in 2004, he wanted to create a way to make hiking backpacks move more naturally with the human body. His patented design, the Flexible Link based backpack carrier, earned him an award in the prestigious Swiss National Design Competition: he used the prize money to start our product design and development company, FLINK in 2005 along with Curdegn, our CEO. 

We later went on to create several backpack designs for German bike ergonomics manufacturer, ERGON and other global partners. In other words, designing backpacks is our passion.

 

 

Oh, right. In 2011, we created an early version of the Slicks backpack to solve a common problem for business professionals: creating a way to both carry a suit wrinkle-free and all their work stuff while commuting. So we came up with the first Slicks backpack with a suit protector insert. It proved to be very popular and got rave reviews from industry experts.

After we started to use the original Slicks bag for activities like overnight travel or just walking around town, we realized there were more possibilities to explore. So we improved the overall design of the Slicks backpack and designed a series of modular inlays. The result was a pack that could go anywhere, for any purpose. Thus, the Slicks Travel System was born.

 

As mentioned above, being Swiss means we have a cultural imperative to be outdoorsy. We’re mountain bikers and climbers (no kidding - that's really Remo pictured above!), we’re skiers and snowboarders, we’re avid travellers  and we’re also parents and business owners. 

Whether we use them as a place to stash our gear, a change of clothes, spare diapers, or important business documents, backpacks go pretty much wherever we go. And we needed a backpack like Slicks Travel System to reflect our lifestyles, which are multifaceted.

 

 

Here is the nitty gritty of the Slicks Travel System:

 

 

 

 

 

Just in case you missed something, as we tend to gush endlessly about the glory of the Slicks Travel System. As its creators, we simply can't help it. It’s our baby.

 

 

 

 

Yes:

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for coming this far with us on the journey to making Slicks a reality. Just the fact that you’ve taken the time out of your busy internet-browsing schedule to check out our project means more to us than you can know. 

Even if you’re just window-shopping, please: let your friends know about this amazing bag. If one of them becomes a Slicks user, they’ll never stop thanking you AND you’ll have a happier, less-stressed, well-traveled friend with loads of stories to tell about their journeys.

From the Slicks team to you, may you always love your journey.

story:
Well hi!

Thanks for clicking.
My name is Rachel Price, I'm 21 and graduated college a few weeks ago. 

I was kind of confused at what my future held next, because unlike many graduates and friends around me I had no internship, job, or fiancé lined up.

I soon discovered that the typical internship or 9-5 job was not all there was to life. There's a huge beautiful world out there for us to check out, serve and cultivate.

What came next was radical and crazy for me, but I felt God calling me to excitedly yet nervously click on the 'apply' button to The World Race. 

The World Race is an 11 month trip to 11 different countries with an organization called Adventures in Missions.

I'll be leaving my home, family and friends in January 2013 and returning the following December. Through adventures, ministry, community, and self-discovery, my team and I will develop broken hearts that propel our hands to act for God’s kingdom around the globe.

On the Race we will partner with churches and ministries in local communities to proclaim the Gospel, build churches, feed orphans, and bring help and hope to women and children trapped in slavery and prostitution. I get to be uncomfortable. I'll have to cram a year into my backpack and live in strange, dangerous places. But God is worth it. All these things seem big when I compare them to me, but when compared to God--He suddenly gets the chance to display His power and accomplish much through my weakness.

I am so excited to see you join me on this adventure and see what God has mapped out!

Follow the experience of the Race on my blog: http://rachelprice.theworldrace.org/

 

What I Need & What You Get

So traveling around the globe costs some money. ALL funds go straight to my online donation pool at Adventures in Missions. You can even donate straight to them at my blog (http://rachelprice.theworldrace.org/)...but it's cooler to do so here so you can recieve a perk. 

And by the way...my perks are awesome! Some of my cool friends decided to handmake a few nicknacks as their 'donation' to my trip, along with my own artistic creations.

Any left over funds I have will go straight to supporting another racer if I don't raise what I need. But I know that God called me to do this, and am pretty confident He won't stop until His work in this is accomplished! 

The Impact

"There is a generation of radicals whose heartbeat is to see a changed world. It's a generation that's dissatisfied with the status quo and is actively rising to the challenge of seeing the world transformed through tangible expressions of God's love. World Racers are seeing lives changed in nations all over the world."

This will be a huge & lifechanging trip for not only me, but my team and the lives we get to watch change. I want to practice childlike humility, daily surviving only on Christ. I hope to tell little children how there is MORE....more to their slavery, more to their lives, more to be. There is a wild Love and a God who works in ways we dont usually expect. I cant wait to really grasp this fact and spread it in foreign communities.

Other Ways You Can Help

There's a ton of things outside the funding process I need! I would love to hear of your expierences, advice, stories and thoughts. Have you done this trip before? Worked on the mission field? Know of a good place to purchase gear, or what things you think I might need on the trip? All of these things will help so much. 

 

Thank you, for joining me on this adventure.
story_txt:
Well hi!
Thanks for clicking.My name is Rachel Price, I'm 21 and graduated college a few weeks ago. 
I was kind of confused at what my future held next, because unlike many graduates and friends around me I had no internship, job, or fiancé lined up.
I soon discovered that the typical internship or 9-5 job was not all there was to life. There's a huge beautiful world out there for us to check out, serve and cultivate.
What came next was radical and crazy for me, but I felt God calling me to excitedly yet nervously click on the 'apply' button to The World Race.

Know of a good place to purchase gear, or what things you think I might need on the trip? All of these things will help so much.

story:
INDIA 2014!

  Hello! My name is Grace Wunderlich and I am a sophomore at Lincoln Christian High School. This summer, from July 18th to August 3rd , I have the amazing opportunity to travel to India with a group to do missions work. This will be my FIRST missions trip! I am more than excited to finally get to go to another country, to share the Love of God with people. We will be making a 24-hour Journey to Hyderabad, India, where we will work with a missionary organization called OM (operation Mobilization).

  The team that I will be traveling with has been making this happen since 2004. Starting with the youth from Christ the servant church in Norfolk, NE. In the past 9-10 years they raised money and built a Christian school from the ground up in Udamarri, India. Starting with only Kindergarteners, they’ve now expanded all the way up to 11th graders! They also were able to build a second story addition to their school and have been learning english starting in preschool, so we will be able to communicate with them! We will be teaching crafts and music as well as teaching them about Jesus and how to share Him with their friends and families.

  I am so blessed to have the opportunity not only to travel to the other side of the world but to share the love and grace of our lord and savior. I cannot wait to see what God has planned during this missions trip. I am not only excited to hopefully help make an impact on India, but I am also very excited for India to make an impact me and my walk with God.

>Details of this trip:

The dates are July 18th -August 3rd. I will need to raise around $2,800 for the trip. As I begin to prepare for my first missions trip, I would very much appreciate your financial support, but way more importantly, we need your prayers! I am SO excited to see what God does through my team on this trip, and to see how God grows me.  

>Some things to pray for:

-Godly team unity, to make the focus about sharing the Gospel to the best of our abilities.

-That we would all be able to raise the money without stress.

-That the Holy Spirit would move through us, and we wouldn't be a hindrance to that.

Proverbs 16:8 says “I keep my eyes always on the LORD, with HIM at my right hand I will not be shaken.” I trust that he will protect my team and I while we do what he has called us to do! So yes, pray for our safety, but more importantly pray for our impact there, and that we will accomplish great things through him and him alone.

story:
THE MOTION SERIES - ARC

The Arc is a small and lightweight active pack that combines a bunch of sleek features which makes it a perfect companion for your daily life and everything besides.

 

THE MOTION SERIES - ELLIPSE  

The ELLIPSE is the bigger brother of the ARC and shares the same materials and a lot of its features. A larger volume, extra pockets and a more complex stretchable layer with dual compression make the difference, while following the same principles.
story_txt:

story: Last week my dad discovered that someone had lit the interior of his van on fire, burning the seats and blackening the windows. As most of you know, my Dad has had a pretty tough last five years including job loss and cancer. Recovery has not been easy. To me - seeing my Dad bop around town in that green van was a sign of his remaining autonomy and connection to community. He was often delivering furniture or vouchers to folks in need (and hopefully occasionally taking care of himself). If you feel moved to donate to help bring back the van I, and my family, would be very grateful. Much love and thanks, Anneka

story:
A Laser for a Makerspace

We're Make Lehigh Valley, a community of artists, hackers, makers and more who believe we can do even cooler stuff by getting together with other people doing cool stuff.  Our space is inside Hive4A at the Bridgeworks Enterprise Center in Allentown, PA.  You can find out all about us at www.makelehighvalley.com.

After a very successful crowd-sourcing campaign to fund our 3D printer (thank you!) we have decided to look for your help again in purchasing a 60W CNC laser cutter/engraver!  We've raised $2000 dollars so far which includes member contributions, corporate sponsorship and scrap recycling and need just another $1000 to make the purchase.

We've decided on a Red Sail X700 which will be shipped for free to the harbor in NYC for pickup.

What We Need & What You Get

We need just $1000 in order to complete our fundraising.  All those who contribute will have their name (or a handle of their choosing) laser etched and added to a plaque that will hang in our space above the laser.  Contributions of $25 can also choose to receive a laser cut acrylic key chain with an etched QR code of your choosing, and $50 can get a laser cut acrylic Raspberry Pi case etched with a custom message of your choosing.

After our 60-day campaign we will order the laser, which may take up to six weeks to arrive in NYC.  We'd like to allow ourselves at least a month or so to get acclimated and make the plaque and rewards, so we've set an initial delivery date for items at the end of December 2014.

Funds beyond our goal will go toward stock material for cutting available for use at our space, and potentially a spare laser tube.

**Update Raspberry Pi B+ Case**

Now that the Raspberry Pi model B+ is out we will be offering a case for the B+. You will be able to specify at the end of the campaign if you want a case for a model B or a model B+ if you have purchased the Raspberry Pi case perk. 

Why do you need a laser?

The completion of our 3D printer launched a ton of great projects at Make Lehigh Valley and really put into perspective exactly how much you can accomplish with the right tools.  We've already got a list of projects to cut on the laser building and cannot wait to receive it!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute to our cause, you can certainly still help out by making sure everyone you can reach knows about our campaign!  Remember though, a contribution of just $5 ensures your name is etched into history at Make Lehigh Valley!

story:
Building on Success

In the 2012 Motorcycle Cannonball Run, our 1929 BMW R11 was definitely a long shot. It had the smallest engine with the lowest horsepower in our class, and we were matched against teams that had previously run in the 2010 coast-to-coast event. 

We did, however, have a great rider in Norm Nelson, and an outstanding support team to back him up. Completing the run from New York to San Francisco would be difficult, but not impossible.

Not only did the motorcycle finish the run against all odds, but we made a perfect score! In the tie breaking system we finished 3rd overall, beating nearly 100 motorcycles from all over the world. We were the highest finishing foreign motorcycle in the history of the event, and the smallest displacement bike in the top 20 finishers. 

Our Goal is to Win

We’re going to do it again in 2014. The same rider, the same team, and a different motorcycle (1928 BMW R52) that will give us a better chance to win the tie breaker and secure 1st place overall. We are more experienced, better prepared and confident that we can win.

Getting Ready for the Run

We will put almost a year of hard work into the effort, combined with an investment of nearly $250,000 in the value of our motorcycle, support vehicles, parts & tools and the time of out team members. It's quite a grind, but major accomplishments always require extraordinary effort. 

    Join Us on HMS Team 23

    Although we have already made a big investment in our effort, we still need help from our friends to support us with the expenses of the event. Entry fees, fuel for the motorcycle and support team, motel expenses and all the other funds needed to compete coast to coast in the Cannonball really add up. By joining us on HMS Team 23, you can be an important part of the event, both with your enthusiasm and your contribution. Please become part of HMS Team 23 and help us make motorcycling history!

story:
Our webstore is now live! Please checkout: www.vivivacolors.com

 

It is the easiest and the most convenient watercolor set to paint on the go. It's a set of 16 transparent, beautiful watercolors. Each sheet is made of a super saturated layer of the color deposited on paper. They're a joy to pick up with a brush: simply pick and paint and you get this really intense, vibrant color.

Courtesy: Parka Blogs

 

Crimson, Deep Pink, Vermillion, Flesh, Chrome Yellow, Gold Ochre, Burnt Umber, Burnt Sienna, Light Green, Sap Green, Viridian, Peacock Blue, Persian Blue, Violet, Magenta, Slate Black.

Infinite possiblities....

Courtesy: Tillith

 

 

Our art has a timeless beauty... shouldn't our art instruments too?

 

Your Viviva Colorsheets are precious, I wanted to give it a precious housing. I've designed a premium, crafted wooden case for the Viviva Colorsheets which you can personalize with a laser engraving of your name and a message or a quote. The case is reusable, there's an elastic inside which lets you slip the case over any Viviva Colorsheets and Voila, you've got a lovely cover for your set.

 

Please Note: Please fill the form from the link in the updates to customize your wooden case

 

 

It's an elegant piece of art which enhances the gifting appeal of the Viviva Colorsheets

 

Now that we are fully funded, we have already begun production of the colorsheets on a large scale so that the backers get to experience these colors soon. Over 4500 orders have already been fulfilled and the backers love the colorsheets! 

 

 

 

Want to sell Viviva Colorsheets in your store? We offer retail and wholesale pricing.
For more details, write to us at 
aditya@vivivacolors.com | rohan@vivivacolors.com

Get rewarded for referring people to the campaign! Here are the reward tiers for successful referrals:

  • 1 referral: A free Indiegogo Special Edition Wooden Case
  • 2 referrals: A water brush (different tip size than perks)
  • 3 referrals: A Viviva Colorsheets

Note: the special edition case cannot be personalized with a name or message.

 

How do I refer people to this campaign?

Anytime, someone supports this campaign using your special link, it's considered as a referral. In order to get your special link just follow these two simple steps below.

Step 1:  Log into your Indiegogo account
Step 2: Use any of the share buttons just below the campaign video. This image below highlights how the share buttons look.

And you can view your referrals from the 'My Profile' tab of your Indiegogo account (top right by clicking on your account name)

 

 

Please don't forget to log in before sharing

 

 

 

We had sent a few samples to the Urban Sketchers, Naples 10x10 Workshop and the members fell in LOVE with the colorsheets!

 

 

 

Hear the leader, Simo Capecchi share her experience

 

For English subtitles, just turn them on in settings

 

Here are a few paintings made with Viviva Colorsheets

 

 

 

 

    

Hello, I'm Aditya, the founder of Viviva Colors. I am a 3rd year medschool student in Seth GS Medical College and King Edward Memorial Hospital in Mumbai, India, the land of colors! I have always been fond of water coloring, but after joining medschool I found that I hardly ever painted. It was so inconvenient to carry all the equipment - the pans, tubes, palettes… ughhh! I knew there had to be a better way to do it and while studying one of the diagnostic techniques that involves picking a substrate off a paper, I had a brainwave: What if I tried to make a sheet with water colors on them. The idea stuck and I started looking for a way to do it. It took me a year but I finally found an expert on dyes and worked with him to develop the technology. I got in my brother Rohan to help me with setting up the supply chain and branding over the last few months and now the only thing left is to buy the raw materials in large enough quantity to bring the price point down (I'd have to sell my kidney for making them in very small volumes).

 

Rohan (L) and Me (Aditya) at Rohan's engagement just before the campaign in Feb 2017

 

  

The biggest challenge is going to be mixing of colors to keep true to the intended hue and shade, especially as the batch size increases. I will be taking the utmost care to ensure color fidelity.

The idea stuck and I started looking for a way to do it. It took me a year but I finally found an expert on dyes and worked with him to develop the technology. I got in my brother Rohan to help me with setting up the supply chain and branding over the last few months and now the only thing left is to buy the raw materials in large enough quantity to bring the price point down (I'd have to sell my kidney for making them in very small volumes).
 

Rohan (L) and Me (Aditya) at Rohan's engagement just before the campaign in Feb 2017
 
  



The biggest challenge is going to be mixing of colors to keep true to the intended hue and shade, especially as the batch size increases. I will be taking the utmost care to ensure color fidelity.

story:
XOSS SPRINT GPS ongoing test

 

The Apperance

The App

The Connection

The Function

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   

 

 

  

 

 

 

Why We Make XOSS SPRINT

Most of the members of our team were bike app developers. We are all avid riders and lovers of the cycling culture. We created XOSS SPRINT because we found that there were no cycling computers on the market that offered the functionality we want at a good cost. We figured, why not make a cycling computer that is as powerful as a mainstream GPS computer, with the ease of use of a smartphone app?

We are a group of young avid riders. We want more people to enjoy riding in this era of tech. We launched our app three years ago, allowing people to monitor and share their rides. So far our app has more than 6 million users.

At the same time, we never stop to accumulating experience in hardware. We developed a smart bike called BiCi, speed and cadence sensor Qi and heart rate belt, etc. These products allow our users to better combine the smartphone with riding.

In the accumulation of these products, we want to develop a more practical and suitable GPS cycling for more riders, so we started to develop XOSS SPRINT one year ago.

We developed a smart bike called BiCi, speed and cadence sensor Qi and heart rate belt, etc. These products allow our users to better combine the smartphone with riding.In the accumulation of these products, we want to develop a more practical and suitable GPS cycling for more riders, so we started to develop XOSS SPRINT one year ago.

story:
Sanierung eines denkmalgeschützten Fachwerkhäuschens zu einem schnuckeligen Ferienhaus mitten im Oberharz  :)

Fertigstellung geplant spätestens Ende 2019 – und dann könnt ihr hinfahren und dort Urlaub machen!

  • Ausreichend für 2-3 Familien plus Kinder: es wird 3 kleine Schlafzimmer mit je 2-3 Betten geben, für kleinere Kinder Babybettchen PLUS ein großer Abenteuer-Dachboden und Schlafgalerie für größere Kinder (ca. 8 weitere Betten)
  • Dann komplett saniert (100 qm), 2 Bäder und Küche
  • Mit großer Sauna und Ruheraum
  • Holzpelletheizung mit großem Sichtfenster im Ruheraum
  • Gemütlicher Holz-Kaminofen in der Stube
  • Urig, gemütlich und kreativ eingerichtet
  • Sehr familienfreundlich -  Große Spielesammlung und viel Kinderausstattung
  • Weber Gasgrill im Hof

Ich freue mich über Eure Teilhabe und finanzielle Unterstützung! Mir macht es Spaß, einen besonderen Wertschöpfungsprozess im Bereich Ferienimmobilie zu begleiten. Dies wird ein einzigartiges Projekt mit vielen kreativen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten! Umgesetzt wird es sowieso – warum also ein Crowdfunding?

  • Ich möchte die Geschichte der Sanierung mit anderen teilen und einen Teil der Kosten aus dem Haus selbst „vorab“ generieren
  • Jetzt schon Werbung machen, und neue Wege gehen
  • Crowdfunding mal ausprobieren! Ich habe auch schon öfter über Tauschprojekte nachgedacht, oder zB. Urlaub gegen Handwerksleistungen
  • Spaß haben und nette Leute kennenlernen

Für das Geld, die ich von euch für die Sanierung erhalte, erhaltet ihr 4 Tage in dem dann fertiggestellten Ferienhaus. Macht einen Romantikurlaub! Packt die Familie ein! Ladet noch ein oder zwei befreundete Familien ein und ab geht es in den Kurzurlaub in den Harz! 

Jedenfalls könnt ihr das Haus zu einem Bruchteil des späteren regulären Preises nutzen. Selbst wenn ihr nur zu zweit fahrt, ist das ein Superdeal. Falls ihr zu sechst seid, ein Megaschnäppchen. Zu acht oder mehr….vergleicht die Preise! Es kommt lediglich noch eine ortsübliche Endreinigung dazu, die dann vor Ort bezahlt wird.

Zusätzlich erhaltet ihr schon jetzt exklusiven Zugang von meinem eigentlich privaten Sanierungs-Blog, wo ich die gesamte Sanierung und diese Aktion im Detail begleite und ihr also jederzeit wisst, wo WIR gemeinsam stehen !

What’s the Deal?

Nach Sanierungsende (spätestens Ende 2019) ...

4 Übernachtungen inkl. Sauna, das ganze Haus für euch, Bettwäsche und Nebenkosten inklusive (Endreinigung exkl. - ortsübliche Höhe, vor Ort zu zahlen)

  • Deal 1 für bis zu zwei Personen: „Romantik-Elbi“ 100 Euro
  • Deal 2 für bis zu 6 Personen: „Familien-Elbi“ 150  Euro
  • Deal 3 für bis zu 12 Personen: „Gruppen-Elbi“ 250 Euro

Außerdem könnt ihr gegen einen geringen Beitrag auch nur meinem Blog folgen und so Teil des Projekts werden ("Tip Deal").

FAQs

Hhm tja, wer renoviert das denn und wird das auch sicher fertig??

         Ja, das klappt schon :) - auch wenn ich mir wirklich viel zutraue und auch kann, habe ich zu einigen Renovierungs-Aufgaben keine Lust oder Zeit, oder mir fehlt so spezielles Werkzeug, dass es sich nicht wirklich lohnt. Für die beauftrage ich dann die echten Fachleute. Der Zeitrahmen ist mit 2 Jahren schon sehr weit gefasst, hier ist schon ein Puffer eingeplant. Ich werde darauf achten, dass Elbi kostenmäßig keine zweite Elphi  (die Namensähnlichkeit ist rein zufällig :) wird und zeitmäßig kein zweiter BER!

Elbi...– wie ? Ist das überhaupt ein Urlaubsort ?

         Aber sicher! Elbingerode (5000 Einwohner) hat sogar eine eigene Touristeninformation, die schräg gegenüber von Elbi liegt. Braunlage am Fuß des Wurmbergs und der Wurmbergseilbahn gelegen ist 15 Minuten in die eine Richtung, das schöne Wernigerode mit seiner Altstadt 10 Minuten in die andere Richtung. Ganz in der Nähe ist die Rappbodetalsperre und natürlich rundum viel Natur und zu entdecken im Naturpark Harz. Je nach Jahreszeit ist hier Wandern, radfahren oder Wintersport angesagt!

Hast du denn überhaupt Ahnung von Ferienvermietung?

         Keine Sorge! Nebenberuflich bin ich leidenschaftlich gerne Gastgeberin :) - und habe auch Erfahrung in diesem Gebiet. Seit 2015 besitzen wir ein Ferienhaus auf Mallorca, welches wir über unsere eigene Website  http://www.strandhaus-mallorca.de anbieten. Von März bis Oktober sind wir vollständig ausgebucht, da wir schon viele wiederkehrende Gäste haben und weiterempfohlen werden.

Seit Mitte 2017 haben wir außerdem eine Ferienwohnung in der Altstadt von Koblenz (meiner Heimat <3 ), Diese bieten wir über airbnb an. Die gesamte Gästekommunikation und -organisation mache ich selbst, ebenso alle bereits abgeschlossenen Arbeiten (Planung, Renovierung, Einrichtung etc.) habe ich allein gemacht.

Was passiert, wenn nun doch irgendetwas Unvorhersehbares passiert und ich keinen Urlaub machen kann?

         Sollte es irgendetwas sein, was den Urlaub von meiner Seite aus nicht möglich macht (…keine Ahnung, Elbi wird von Außerirdischen hoch gebeamt oder ich widme mich vorrangig meinem "neuen Schloss", so dass Elbi liegen bleibt), dann zahle ich euch euren Crowdfunding-Betrag einfach zurück. Alles andere wäre ja nicht fair. Falls IHR nicht fahren könnt oder wollt, könnt ihr den Deal verkaufen oder verschenken! Allerdings bitte ich darum, dass ihr den Elbi Besuch innerhalb der ersten 2-3 Jahre nach Fertigstellung plant.

Wie läuft das denn später mit dem Buchen?

         Ganz unkompliziert! Da ihr mit mir – über meinen Blog – im Kontakt steht, sind wir ja schon mal gemeinsam auf der Ziellinie. Bevor ich das erste Angebot starte, frage ich alle Elbi-Supporter nach ihren Terminwünschen!

Seid dabei und unterstützt das Abenteuer Elbi!

story:
With your help we hope to build capable adaptive mountain bikes that we can sell from approximately £2,000 and up.  That's £1,000 cheaper than any other hand-cranked bike, and half the price of any other adaptive mountain bike!!!  Please read on to find out more about what we are doing, and why...

 

About me:

Hi, my name is Chris Jones.  I suffered some life-changing injuries whilst serving in the British Army, which caused me to re-think a lot of the things I used to be passionate about doing, and meant I had to find new ways to do the things I love.  One of those things was mountain biking, and in 2011 I decided to find a way to go mountain biking again.  This is always going to be tricky when you’ve lost almost 50% of the mobility in both your legs, but having spent years watching my Wife and Son head off across the moor on their bikes, I was determined to find a way to join them.  After some extensive searching of the internet I learned that almost all of the hand powered bikes available were designed for road use, and the cheapest hand-powered bike I could find cost £3,000.  Those bikes that claimed to be designed for off-road use were mostly road frames with off-road tyres on, which meant they were suitable for canal paths and other well made tracks, but wouldn’t handle the kind of terrain I wanted to ride on Dartmoor, and bikes specifically designed for off-road use started from £5,000.

 

Having bought myself a hand-cranked, off-road bike, and discovered first hand just how poor their performance really is, I decided that disabled people deserve to have high-quality, affordable mountain bikes, just like everyone else.  As a result I have spent the last 10 months working with a professional design engineer to develop a bike that is not just a proper mountain bike, adapted to suit a variety of disabilities, but which will sell for less than half the price that a disabled person would currently have to spend on an adaptive mountain bike.  We believe this is the first time that an adaptive mountain bike has been designed in this way; from scratch by a professional engineer, first and foremost as a mountain bike, and then as an adaptive bike.

 

Your money will help us to now bring that design to life, and allow us to test it fully before bringing it into production for the millions of disabled people in the UK, and around the World, who simply want to ride a bike through the countryside with their friends and family.

 

Your investment and reward:

We now need to raise £40,000, which will allow us to achieve the following:

  • Completion of the design to a manufacturing spec, allowing the design to be put straight into production once testing is complete.
  • Construction and testing of prototype bikes, tested not just for the range of conditions they can handle, but for the range of disabilities they can accommodate.
  • Addition and testing of existing adaptive components to fit an even wider range of disabled riders.
  • By completing all of the above we will be ready to put the bikes into production, hopefully by the end of 2013/early 2014.

In return for your money you will receive:

  • From £5, a hand-written letter of thanks.
  • From £50, a limited edition Merici Sports t-shirt from Supersaturated.

If we don’t raise the full £40,000 we will still put the amount we have raised into building the prototype, it just may take us a little longer than we’d planned as we will have to raise the remaining amount from other sources, which will take time and will detract from the main focus, that of testing the bikes.

The Impact

  • Disabled people are often excluded from normal daily activities, or at best will receive a marginalised, watered-down version of the experience that able-bodied people get.
  • Adaptive equipment often costs a vast amount more than the able-bodied equivalents, creating further barriers to disabled participation.
  • Most families with a disabled member will forego normal family activities so as not to isolate the person with the disability, meaning the whole family miss out on opportunities that normal families take for-granted.
  • By helping us to move forward with this project you will allow us to finally show disabled people world-wide that they need not accept the status quo.
  • Your support will allow us to show the world that people with disabilities will take up active sports if the right equipment is made available at the right price.
  • You can be part of a project that will give people with disabilities affordable, independent access to places they have simply not been able to get to until now.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support us financially, we really do understand that!  Please though, support us by simply spreading the word about what we are trying to do, which is most easily done using the share buttons on this page.  However you choose to support us, we would like to thank you for your help :-)

story:
Who I am

Well, as I'm not advertising this all that widely, I'm going to assume that anyone looking at it, already has a rough idea of the answer to this... but just in case you don't, I'll sum it up in brief.  I am:

  • A professional photographic model from England.  Very experienced in all genres from classic art-nudes, through to fashion, fetish and all things creative and artistic.
  • A nomad.  I travel everywhere.  Constantly.
  • An all round lovely person, who makes a cracking cup of tea!

I'm planning my first ever trip to Australia in October, but as it's a rather long way I'm hoping to get enough confirmed bookings to cover my flight before I leave.

I plan to start off in Sydney on 8th October, and then work my way around to other places depending on where the demand is!

I don't get a penny until I've reached my target for booking my flights... and if I don't reach my target, you automatically [b]get your money back[/b].

I [b]never[/b] no show. And can point you in the direction of countless models and photographers (and even a few Australia based friends) you can talk to to vouch for my reliability and professionalism.

What I Need & What You Get

My £2200 target is a rough estimate of how much I'll need to arrange my flights, visas, and a tiny bit extra to keep me afloat whilst I'm out there (busses, food, etc.).  I'm not really expecting there to be any profit from this, but I love to travel, see new places, meet new people, and most importantly, create some art!

Essentially, when donating here is exactly the same as just booking a model for a shoot in the normal way.  But please contact me to confirm the date and time slot before you pay on here, or I won't be able to guarantee that I'm free!

Once you've booked a shoot, I'll stay in contact with you to discuss all your concepts and ideas in advance and will do my best to bring all the clothing, hair styling, and make-up you require.

The price for these shoots include all the styles I work in, which can be seen on my website, where you can also find a lot more information about me and my work! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a trip that I'll be doing on an extremely low budget, with very little profit, so any ways I can cut costs whilst I'm there are always useful... if you have a spare room / sofa I can crash on, can feed me, or offer me transportation then this is always appreciated; if you're an artist/photographer I will happily give you a discount if I take you up on this offer.

Also... tell all your artist/photographer friends ^_^
