story:
The Qliplet is now shipping!  

Thanks to our backers at Indiegogo, we successfully launched the Qliplet and it is now available to everyone.   To show our love to Indiegogo, we are offering special pricing and free shipping to everyone on Indiegogo.  AND we are offering our limited inventory of the titanium model exclusively on Indiegogo.

 

Some of life's greatest adventures require lugging a lot of stuff. The Qliplet is a revolutionary carabiner with rotating hook so you can keep your hands free and do more in your life.

 

 

 

 

Technical specs
 
Materials:  Solid billet aluminum 6061 (aircraft grade); Nylon 6; stainless steel screw and rivets; rubber overmold
Finish:  Anodization
Method:  CNC (Computerized numerical control) machining for precision
Dimensions:  3" (width), 3.75" (length), 0.25" (metal arm thickness)
Weight:  2 oz.
Capacity:  50 lbs (inert weight only; not for climbing)
 

 

The open hook and the flexible joints allow extra versatility.
 

 

And the Qliplet's slim profile fits into narrow and small spaces.

 

 

We have spent nearly a year perfecting our design and engineering and building a relationship with our manufacturing partner to ensure a smooth production process without delays.  Because we are using CNC (computerized numerical control) machinery rather than die casting, there is no need for tooling which can take over a month.  We will be delivering your Qliplets early December, just in time for holiday travel and gifting.

 

 

 

 
The Qliplet was invented by Mina Yoo, a mom, inventor, entrepreneur and someone who loves adventures of all kinds.  When she had her first child four years ago and then started training to summit Mt. Rainier 5 months later, she realized that the only downside of many of life's most fulfilling adventures is that they require lugging a lot of stuff.  Mina decided to start a business, Lulabop, devoted to helping you LIVE more, while carrying less stuff.

 

 

 

Her vision first became reality last year when Lulabop launched a campaign for its first product to great success.  The Qliplet is a newly designed, smaller product created as a part of the original product line to give customers more options in size and style.  Please see FAQs for more detail on how the Qliplet is different from its older sibling. 

 

The Team

 

 

 

 

We know that there are some of you who are as geeky as we are and would love to know more about the design and manufacturing process.  In the process of coming to our current design, we made endless 3-D prints and several prototypes in the actual materials.  Luckily, 3-D printing is really cool!

 

The Qliplet arms are made using the same advanced CNC (computerized numerical control) technology that is used in jet aircraft and race cars. Each arm is precision-machined out of solid billet aluminum, then hard anodized for a gorgeous finish. Even the spring in the Qliplet is made using this super high precision machine.  Check out how it's made!

 

 

 


 

 

Over the past year, we've built several rounds of prototypes of the Qliplet.  We have put everything we learned about manufacturing, quality control and logistics from our previous product and created a process to ensure that all of our production goes as smoothly as possible. Our team  has visited numerous factories to select one that understands our high standards of quality for material and assembly. Our company already has a track record of delivering products to crowdfunding backers and has engaged in 7 production runs in as many months.  The quality of our existing product is high enough to have been placed in large retailers like REI and Big 5 Sporting Goods, and our capacity is robust enough to fulfill these orders.   
 
Despite our company's success so far, the reality is that producing goods in high enough volume so that they are affordable to all (we truly believe that the Qliplet will benefit EVERYONE's lives) requires capital.  With your help, we can bring the Qliplet to life!
 

 

 

There are challenges for sure when manufacturing a product.  Every lesson I have personally learned about manufacturing and delivery from my first product has been applied to the production planning for the Qliplet.  I have furthered added two team members, John and Andy, who have extensive engineering and production experience (over 40 years combined).  

Our team has also spent the past few months visiting manufacturers, interviewing them and reviewing their work to select the right partner.  Having selected one, we have received several samples of the Qliplet and have worked closely with them to ensure that communication lines, quality expectations and delivery timelines are crystal clear.  Andy, our manufacturing engineer, is based in Hong Kong and will maintain daily contact with our manufacturing partner and visit them at least weekly to ensure that we are on schedule and quality standards are met or exceeded.

 

 

 
1.  How is the Qliplet different from its older sibling the Qlipter?
 
Last year, the Qlipter launched as a highly successful crowdfunding campaign.

To our delight, the Qlipter received immediate high praise from customers and reviewers for innovative design and functionality.  

We also received several requests for a smaller version that would fit well in a palm and be more suitable for urban, parenting and travel uses.  The Qliplet is about 20% smaller than the Qlipter and is completely re-designed.  Our goal as a company is to give customers OPTIONS in size and style.

 

In terms of design, the Qliplet uses a completely different pivot system. Rather than having one rotation point and one folding point, the Qliplet has two folding joints and a rotating joint to help hanging items find their natural center of gravity.
 
Our closing mechanism has been redesigned as well so that the spring stay retains the hook when closed.  The foot of of the hook has a rubber overmold to increase grip when resting on surfaces.
 
Lastly, the Qliplet is made out of solid aluminum using CNC machining while the Qlipter uses a die-cast process.  This allows us to offer more colors and in a smooth, anodized finish.
 

2.  What's up with Go Girl Green?

You might be wondering about the Go Girl Green Qliplet model in honor of the Girl Scouts of Western Washington.  Although we are a small, start-up company, we wanted to find a way to give to back to our community.  While there are many great causes, we are currently supporting the Girl Scouts of Western Washington because as a mom of a little girl  and a volunteer content developer in the Cookie CEO program, I am personally aligned with the Girl Scouts mission of “building girls of courage, confidence and character who make the world a better place.”

 

 

In light of the Girl Scouts of Western Washington’s own recent IndieGoGo campaign (#forEVERYgirl), we wanted to help to support our hometown chapter and created a special model just for them.  Twenty percent of the funds raised for this model of Qliplet will go to the Girl Scouts of Western Washington. Once produced, with your help, a portion of each future Go Girl Green Qliplet sold will continue to be contributed to them, as well. So, please help to fund the Go Girl Green Qliplet during our campaign and support the Girl Scouts of Western Washington in fostering the strong and capable girls our future needs!
 
 
A little more excitement, please?
 
 
3.  How will you ship?
 
We will ship all units, international and domestic, using the US Postal Service. Within the US, for pledges over $50, we will ship via US Priority Mail with tracking.  
 
4.  How do we pick the color options?

 

After the end of the campaign, we will send you a questionnaire through which you can let us know what colors you would like and also confirm your address.

 

5.  Hey, why don't you get a rap song made about the Qliplet?

You read our minds!  Check this out!
story_txt:
The Qliplet is now shipping!  
Thanks to our backers at Indiegogo, we successfully launched the Qliplet and it is now available to everyone.   To show our love to Indiegogo, we are offering special pricing and free shipping to everyone on Indiegogo.  AND we are offering our limited inventory of the titanium model exclusively on Indiegogo.
 
Some of life's greatest adventures require lugging a lot of stuff. The Qliplet is a revolutionary carabiner with rotating hook so you can keep your hands free and do more in your life. 
  
 

Technical specs 
Materials:  Solid billet aluminum 6061 (aircraft grade); Nylon 6; stainless steel screw and rivets; rubber overmold
Finish:  AnodizationMethod:  CNC (Computerized numerical control) machining for precisionDimensions:  3" (width), 3.75" (length), 0.25" (metal arm thickness)Weight:  2 oz.Capacity:  50 lbs (inert weight only; not for climbing) 
 

The open hook and the flexible joints allow extra versatility. 
 

And the Qliplet's slim profile fits into narrow and small spaces.
 


 We have spent nearly a year perfecting our design and engineering and building a relationship with our manufacturing partner to ensure a smooth production process without delays.  Because we are using CNC (computerized numerical control) machinery rather than die casting, there is no need for tooling which can take over a month.  We will be delivering your Qliplets early December, just in time for holiday travel and gifting.  


  The Qliplet was invented by Mina Yoo, a mom, inventor, entrepreneur and someone who loves adventures of all kinds.  When she had her first child four years ago and then started training to summit Mt. Rainier 5 months later, she realized that the only downside of many of life's most fulfilling adventures is that they require lugging a lot of stuff.  Mina decided to start a business, Lulabop, devoted to helping you LIVE more, while carrying less stuff.
 
 


 
Her vision first became reality last year when Lulabop launched a campaign for its first product to great success.  The Qliplet is a newly designed, smaller product created as a part of the original product line to give customers more options in size and style.  Please see FAQs for more detail on how the Qliplet is different from its older sibling.

story:
Short Summary

 

Bicycle Angels is a unique charity that fulfills a special need.  Although we don't  raise money directly for charities, so far we have helped raise over $400,000 for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, Multiple Sclerosis Society, AIDS Lifecycle, Diabetes Society, Arthritis Foundation, and Crohn's and Colitis Foundation.  We are open to other charities and have communicated  with several others. 

We do this by loaning bicycles to individuals who want to participate in a fundraising charity bike ride, but don't have an adequate bike to use.  It's a free loan for up to one year.  Bike borrowers then go on to raise money for their selected charity, and simply return the bike when they are done with their charity event.

Our bike loans are vital to help raise money for great charities that would not otherwise be raised.   We've made over 150 bike loans, and are bikes are out getting used daily.

We are a IRS registered non-profit 501(c)3, so your donations are tax deductible!

What We Need

Our strategic plan is to increase our impact by expanding our services to additional cities.  Our first step forward is to open a San Francisco area location.  In order to do this, we need money for additional bikes (10 to start!) and to rent a location for operations.

The Impact

By adding a new location, we will help individuals raise more money for worthy charities such as those we've supported already.  

Also, when people complete an endurance cycling event, they gain these benefits:

  • Get exercise and improve their fitness
  • Make new friends
  • Achieve a sense of accomplishment in completing an endurance event and raising funds to help a great cause.

    Risks & Challenges

    Our main challenge is funding.  We operate on a very low amount of funds and have been sustainable as a one-location charity.  However we cannot continue to grow without financial support to open new offices and add to our fleet of loaner bikes.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't provide financial support, we also accept donations of new and old bicycles, bike parts, and accessories.  If your donation is not something we can use directly, we will sell it to help raise funds for our operations.

      We'd appreciate it you letting your friends and family about our efforts.  Please forward this information on to those who can help.

story:
Where did the 'Indy App' idea come from?

The National Yes Registry (NYR) have, since the NO vote, been forging contacts in surviving and dormant pro-indy local groups all over the country, in preparation for Indyref2.  During this time we developed our NYR networking concept and, one year ago, successfully crowdfunded to travel the country and hold 'face to face' meetings with those Indy groups. We then followed this with the first ever National Conference of Grass-root Yes Groups held in Largs on the 5th of December 2015, with over 60 delegates in attendance. Groups from Orkney down to Jedburgh, from St Andrews through to Skye and everywhere in between!  

Our Largs conference film and a full list of the original 20 'vanguard' groups can be viewed here https://vimeo.com/167142844

What will the Indy App do?

At our conference the groups discussed the requirements of a successful national grass-root network and we gained the support of 20 'Vanguard' groups to initiate the design and creation of our FREE National Yes Registry networking tool:

The Indy App

The Indy App will directly connect each autonomous group to their fellow Indy Groups throughout the country. No external mediation, no central power structure.

As each group joins the Indy App  for FREE, they will create a personalised 'front door' for easy access to their contact details by interested members of the general public. 

On the 'Indy App', each group will have their own 'Local Forum' where their entire membership can discuss, plan and organise their Indyref2 campaign strategies.

They will also be members, collectively as a group, of the 'National Forum' for sharing of ideas, resources, campaign strategies, merchandise orders, mentoring, social event organisation and much, much more... All at a local, regional and national Level!

How will it work?

On FREE download of the Indy App, interested individuals simply type in their postcode and the App will direct them to a selection of their nearest indygroups, to contact, join and be warmly welcomed into the Yes movement.

If no group exists locally, the Indy App will offer to put those interested local individuals into contact with one another in order to meet, discuss and then hopefully form a local group themselves.

The creation and delivery of the NYR Indy App, as a FREE resource, will enhance all aspects of our grass root Yes movement's campaigning capabilities over the coming months and years. Through its popular use, we hope to grow and encourage participation in the local group grass-root network to prepare ourselves, as a movement, for a flying start to Indyref2 and Scotland's independence! 

For more detail on what the Indy App is and does http://tinyurl.com/hjghekc


Strategy for Indy App launch on 18th of September 2016

In order to ensure that the Indy App release to the public coincides with the 2nd anniversary of Scotland's first Independence referendum, and all the accompanying media interest and free publicity that anniversary will generate, the Indy App has already been designed and its' construction is well underway.

This work is  being carried out as we speak, but payment for that work (and everything else) will have to come from this crowd fund, as Brexit forced all our plans forward by more than a month and a half and unfortunately for us this also included all our funding timetables! But, as the old saying goes, 'fortune favours the brave!'  Let's certainly hope so anyway... :-)


What your donation will help fund?

This crowd fund is to cover the costs incurred to realise the NYR 'Indy App' project. Some of the expenses include: the Indy App design and creation costs by professional coders, the production of support resources such as Tutorial films, live web seminars and Help films linked to each IndyApp function for ease of use by its members. We will also be creating each of the ‘front doors’ on the Indy App for the 80+ (and growing) local groups already expressing their wishes to participate. This will all be done in the run up to our public launch ready for searches by the general public on download come the 18th of September.  

We will also however need a much longer follow up 'tour of the groups' for after the public launch date. This later 'tour of the groups' will be designed to get everybody  organised and ready to access all the functions of the Indy App.  Specifically, ensuring each group knows how to post effectively on the 'National Forum'. Each tour will (as usual) be carried out by traveling and sleeping in 'the wee blue van', an integral member of our NYR team! :-)

For a fuller explanation of our roll-out strategy (both before and after our public launch on September the 18th) please read  this link http://tinyurl.com/zojrqzf 


NYR Indy App in Print

The National                                tinyurl.com/zocfc4m                                                                                                            tinyurl.com/zy82fdz

The Sunday Herald                        tinyurl.com/hxk482x                                                                                                                            tinyurl.com/hb5kdqf

The Sunday Post                            tinyurl.com/jysllxp


Our breakdown of project expenses:


Indy App

Design                                                                                                                             £1500

Coding +Delivery                                                                                                        £3000

Developments and updates                                                                                      £800

Films and Tutorials (incl. equipment and rental)                                             £1200

Start up server space                                                                                                  £550

Office rent + bills                  12 months x £195                                                   £2340

Van MOT                                                                                                                          £400

Travel and Tours                        Pre Launch                                                             £350

                                                         Post Launch                                                          £600

Internal IT                                     12 months                                                              £750

Perk badges                                                                                                                   £300

Total                                                                                                            £11440 

5% Indiegogo Fee                                                                                                         £572

5% Paypal/Credit card Fees                                                                                    £572

Total including Fees   ......................................................................   £12 584


'just for the record'

The Following costs (among others) have been absorbed by Edward M Smith and Jason Baird personally over the length of the project so far. This has been necessary to ensure that the NYR  'Indy App' grass-root concept has successfully reached its current stage of realisation.  These costs are rough guides only and here to simply place 'on the record' some of the true costs of a project of this nature.


'Vanguard Groups' These 20 groups have been absolutely instrumental in getting the project to this stage. They deserve full credit for their generous support (both moral and financial) and have our full gratitude. However, the initial funding short fall that arose due to support from 20 groups rather than the required 30 forced our absorption of that cost.

10 Groups x £30 stipend payment x 6 months                                               £1800


J Baird  6 months full-time min wage spread over a year

£6.70 x 8 x 5 = £268 per week x 52 / 2                                                             £6968

E. M. Smith  3 Months full-time min wage spread over a year                       

£6.70 x 8 x 5 = £268 per week x 52 / 4                                                             £3484


Total   (not including loss of professional earnings)  .........................  £12252

Each tour will (as usual) be carried out by traveling and sleeping in 'the wee blue van', an integral member of our NYR team! :-)For a fuller explanation of our roll-out strategy (both before and after our public launch on September the 18th) please read  this link http://tinyurl.com/zojrqzf NYR Indy App in PrintThe National                                tinyurl.com/zocfc4m                                                                                                            tinyurl.com/zy82fdzThe Sunday Herald                        tinyurl.com/hxk482x                                                                                                                            tinyurl.com/hb5kdqfThe Sunday Post                            tinyurl.com/jysllxpOur breakdown of project expenses:Indy AppDesign                                                                                                                             £1500Coding +Delivery                                                                                                        £3000Developments and updates                                                                                      £800Films and Tutorials (incl. equipment and rental)                                             £1200Start up server space                                                                                                  £550Office rent + bills                  12 months x £195                                                   £2340
Van
 MOT                                                                    
                                                      £400
Travel and Tours                        Pre Launch                                                             £350
 
                                                        Post Launch      
                                                    £600Internal IT                                     12 months                                                              £750Perk badges                                                                                                                   £300Total                                                                                                            £11440 5% Indiegogo Fee                                                                                                         £5725% Paypal/Credit card Fees                                                                                    £572Total including Fees   ......................................................................   £12 584'just for the record'The Following costs (among others) have been absorbed by Edward M Smith and Jason Baird personally over the length of the project so far. This has been necessary to ensure that the NYR  'Indy App' grass-root concept has successfully reached its current stage of realisation.  These costs are rough guides only and here to simply place 'on the record' some of the true costs of a project of this nature.'Vanguard Groups' These 20 groups have been absolutely instrumental in getting the project to this stage. They deserve full credit for their generous support (both moral and financial) and have our full gratitude. However, the initial funding short fall that arose due to support from 20 groups rather than the required 30 forced our absorption of that cost.10 Groups x £30 stipend payment x 6 months                                               £1800J Baird  6 months full-time min wage spread over a year£6.70 x 8 x 5 = £268 per week x 52 / 2                                                             £6968E. M. Smith  3 Months full-time min wage spread over a year                       £6.70 x 8 x 5 = £268 per week x 52 / 4                                                             £3484Total   (not including loss of professional earnings)  .........................  £12252

story:
My name is Regina Brooks

 I have recently joined The Academy of Fashion Australia Team, which is my dream come true. The Academy of designers train young teens who are still at school and who want to become designers.

 The Academy trains us how to put our designs on paper and teachers us colours and patterns as well as not to be afraid to be creative. 

As a fully figured Teen it’s hard to find clothes that is stylish and fits well. Since joining The Academy Team I have been made the Ambassador of the Fully Figured Teen clothing designs which is so exciting and at the same time scary.

The Academy taking myself to LA (USA) where there I and others would be able to introduce their garments that we have designed internationally.

 The Trip will be to LA in May. The money that we raise would go towards helping Teens in my situation made that trip.

Thank you for your support.

story:
NOMATIC was born and raised through crowdfunding. We have successfully funded and delivered four projects through crowdfunding platforms. In 2014 we launched the BASICS Wallet, in 2015 the BASICS Notebook, in 2016 The NOMATIC Travel Bag, and in 2017 The NOMATIC Backpack and Travel Pack. All of these past products are available at www.nomatic.com

Last year we shipped over 35,000 bags to customers all over the world. NOMATIC is quickly becoming a brand known for its highly functional bags and exceptional quality. Here is what our customers are saying about our last campaign, The NOMATIC Backpack and Travel Pack:

The NOMATIC Messenger and Laptop bags were designed for everyday use.  The main difference between the two is size.  The Messenger bag holds 15 liters while the Laptop bag holds 10 liters.  The Messenger bag has all the features found in the Laptop bag, plus a few added features as well.  First, let's run through a couple shared features on both bags, then we will dive into each bag individually.

  Magnetic Fidlock® Buckle

While both bags share some great features, each bag was specifically designed for its own unique purpose, and the location of these features varies on each bag. Below are some images that show the specific features and their locations in the Laptop bag.

The Messenger bag has all of the features that the Laptop bag offers plus a few more.  Below you will find some of the Messenger bag specific features, as well as the specific location of some of the shared features in the NOMATIC Messenger bag. 

Each NOMATIC Messenger Bag includes 2 customizable panels, allowing you to decide what and how you carry.  As you can see below, the dividing walls on the compartments panel can be adjusted to fit your needs from day to day. 

At NOMATIC we create the most functional gear ever to help inspire confidence for people who are living life on the move. We love creating innovative products that help people simplify, organize, and improve their lives. We are so grateful to all of our backers and supporters who have helped us successfully bring 5 products to life through crowdfunding. Thanks for all of your support!

 

PRODUCT WARRANTY 

Here at NOMATIC, we stand behind all of our products. Both the NOMATIC Laptop and Messenger Bags come with lifetime warranties. If we can't fix or repair a manufacture defect, we will replace the product, no questions asked.

RETURN POLICY

We offer a 30 day no risk return policy. If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product within 30 Days of receiving your order, simply send it back and we will refund you, no questions asked. But don't worry, we know you are going to love it!

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION 

NOMATIC cannot mark orders as gifts. This is illegal, so we will not be able to do this. 

Our prices DO NOT include VAT, GST or other country taxes. 

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all freight and duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Indiegogo. 

We found this handy tool, that can assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency: 

http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-and-tax-calculation 

For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will receive an email from GFS Gateway, First Mile, or your local customs authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs. Once you make that payment to the customs broker your order will be processed for final delivery. 

 SHIPPING PROCEDURE 

Within 24 hours of your order being shipped you will receive a tracking link with your shipping details. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package. We use a shared post shipping method to have your order delivered at an affordable price. Your order will ship out from our shipping facility in Salt Lake City, UT with a major shipping company, or with a tracking link from First Mile. 

Your order will be handled by UPS, USPS, RRDonnelley or DHL up to entry of your country. Once your order enters your country your order will be handed off to your local post office for final delivery. International transit will have a 7-21 Business day delivery time. U.S Domestic shipments will take 3-5 business days.

SHIPPING POLICY 

If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don't get it because you’re not there, wrong address, moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package.

story:
What's our story?

The uOttawa Quidditch Club was created in January 2011 by Clare Hutchinson and Tegan Bridge. Last year, the uOttawa Team earned themselves the title of second in Canada and made it to top 25 at WCVI. This year, with a growing pool of players, the club decided to create two teams: The Gee-Gees wearing the school's team name and it's sister team: the Ottawa Maple Rush. At Canada Cup III, The Gee-Gees placed in first and the Ottawa Maple Rush earned their world cup bid tying for third with McGill's A team. With two teams going to World Cup, your Canadian sweethearts need your help now more than ever. Every penny raised through this campain will help us bring 42 competitive players from snowy Ottawa to sunny Myrtle Beach. The funds raised will cover travel cost, hotels and food.

What do we need and why do we need it?

On this page, we are asking for $5000. This will cover the hotel fees for 4 nights in the mandated Stay and Play WCVII hotel for our 42 players and 2 coaching staff. Since your Canadians leaving from the great white north (in fact, we left an ice storm in order to go to WC last year) our players must arrive at least 24hours before competing in order to get used to the heat. Any dollar raised over our goal will go towards feeding our players and getting them there.

This year, we are offering a variety of perks: buttons, postcards, pictures, and even our very own jerseys! Who doesn't want to own a jersey!?!

The Impact

We know we aren't the only teams travelling to World Cup, and they all deserve your support, but we might just be your favourite Canadian teams. You helped us get there last year, and we were blown away by your generosity. Your support was inspiring and we were proud to represent you on the world stage - help us get there again.

The quidditch community recognizes our players by their dedication to travel to competition beyond their border and the traditional maple syrup bottle that they leave in their path. We believe you should help uOttawa Quidditch because we have proven ourselves to be dedicated to helping promote sportsmanship and school spirit both at the University of Ottawa and at quidditch tournaments worldwide. By helping our team, you will ensure a Canadian presence at the World Cup and you will help a dedicated and passionate group of people to achieve their goal. We have put a lot of hard work into this sport, and it's paid off with our two bids to World Cup: now all we need to do is get there.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Go out into the world and proclaim your love and support for the uOttawa Quidditch club!
  • Share this page on your social media pages!

Merci!

story:
Eclipse - Value Priced Big Sky Evolution tent

by Big Sky International

We have been designing tents for a number of years. We keep trying to push our designs to give our customers the most tent for the least weight, unfortunately, sometimes the cost has been out of reach for some of our customers so we decided to create a Value Priced version of Big Sky's award winning Evolution 2P tent... same great design but using value priced fabrics.

We created the World's Lightest Double Wall Freestanding tent and found that indiegogo was a good place to let people know about it so we thought we would try it for Big Sky's new Eclipse tent.

Specifications

Model: Eclipse 2P tent

Suggested use: lightweight backpacking

Sleeping capacity: 2

Tent and poles: prototype weight 1.6kg (3lb 9.4oz) with 40D PU coated fabric and aluminum poles

Vestibule area: 0.77 sq m + 0.77 sq m (8.3 + 8.3 square feet)

Interior dimensions: 230 x 135 x 120 cm (91 x 53 x 47 in)

Internal peak height: 107 cm (42 in)

Packed size: 15 x 45 cm (6 x 18 in)

Pole material: aluminum

Number of poles: 2

Fly fabric: 40D nylon silicone/PU coated fabric or SuprSil™ or SuprSil™-UL silicone coated nylon fabric

Interior fabric: no-see-um mesh netting

Floor fabric: 40D nylon fabric, PU coated and seam taped

Doors: 1

Rating: 3-season

Uses: light weight, backpack, camp, hike, trek, outdoor activities

Note: we will make the Eclipse 2P tent with different materials/fabrics so there will be a version to fit everyone's budget.

Big Sky fabric comparison table

Big Sky fabrics comparison table

$15 Contribution

Big Sky stake/peg kit: 4pcs Ultra-C™ stakes and 2pc Tube Steaks™ LW pegs plus See-Em™ sack. $15 contribution includes FREE shipping within Continental USA

$35 Contribution

Big Sky DreamSleeper™ Deluxe inflatable pillow. World’s most comfortable light weight inflatable pillow with Deluxe pillow case and pillow includes an attached self storing pouch. Weight: 117g (4.1oz) Colors: creamy beige, sky blue, or spring green. $35 contribution includes FREE shipping within Continental USA

Questions:

How much will the different versions of Big Sky's new Eclipse tent weigh?
Answer: The less expensive versions of Big Sky's new Eclipse tent will weigh more than the more expensive versions that use lighter weight, more expensive materials/fabrics. We have not made all the different versions yet so we cannot provide the exact weights yet. We estimate the Value Priced version will weigh about 1.6kg (3lb 9.4oz) for fly, interior, and aluminum poles.

How durable is the Value Priced version?
Answer: The Value Priced version is made with more durable fabrics/materials than the more expensive versions.

story:
Now that you really really want to go back to America. 

Imagine being actually received by mail.

 

 

Since 2017 , we have innovated the design, manufacture and shipping of designer quality suitcases with the most necessary smart features.

We have sold more than 40,000 product in South Korea last year. Now
we want to share this with the world. Your sponsorship will do so.


 

How did you get so cheap?

In traditional retailing, the product goes through a process of getting fattened by a broker. At SHAPL, we perform the most sparse process known to humans . We manage design, manufacture and shipping. It is an intermediary that no totals .

D2C is SHAPL Mission: customers to directly connect designers to consumers connected . This is a great people, great price with great stuff the transfer method is. SHAPL mission: Connecting

 

 

Who is Dr. Nah?

Dr. Nah knows good design . Dr. Nah noticed a bad design for his load . So dr. Nah has developed better baggage with a great design with us.

He is the former dean of Hongik University's Advanced Design International School (IDAS) . In addition,  Germany 's Red Dot Design Award and the Hong Kong of the  DFA Design for Asia Awards in the judges  selected were. Just things like that. he judges at the 

 

 

What is special about the SHAPL suitcase? SHAPL Suitcases?

Oh, there are some ...

 

Alphabet sticker

Make your travel bag. Let's take my baggage. And change that awkward encounter to Missed Connections.)

 

 

Bluetooth Tracker

Your luggage rolling away? Or, being rolled away? Get a push notification Immediately to a known location . Catch that damn guy.

 

 

Hinomoto wheel

Until you experience Hinomoto, you will not have a quiet experience. Luxury handling of four axles, eight wheels, 360 degrees and a suitcase of 1000 dollars.

 

 

Polycarbonate Heart



Very light, durable and modern.
When you take off for another country, it's not just you flying. Baggage is also flying.

 

 

TSA LOCK

You travel like a boss. Normally a high-end bag reservation,
our TSA locks can protect your TSA bag without breaking open things.

 

 

Double Coil Zipper

Did you hear the anti-theft zipper? The regular zipper opens under all common drivers.
However, the double coil zipper blocks the enemy.

 

 

Multipurpose division and cross-strap

Organize all your cool clothes in one space. Hide all the other amazing things in different compartments. Listen to your pocket. Keep peace. Hide away all your other amazing stuff in the other compartment. Stuff your pockets. Keep the peace.

 

Industrial quality

 

 

 

People who catch the eye.

 

 

 

And the backpack is super special too?

Oh, now scroll down to tell us.)

 

 

Bluetooth Tracker

Just as with our suitcase, you'll get notified of your
backpack’s last known location if it strays too far away.

 

 

EXTERNAL USB PORT

Don’t hassle with zippers and cords. Connect, plug, and go.
Even look up at the sky every once in a while.

 

 

WATER-RESISTANT FABRIC

When you’re traveling, nothing should limit you.
Just go where you need to go, and know that your stuff is protected from the elements.

 

 

WATER-RESISTANT ZIPPERS

Like really, protected from the elements. Water-resistant zippers aren’t commonly advertised because most companies cut costs on this expensive feature. Not us.

 

 

ANTI-THEFT POCKET

Maybe you’ll keep stuffing your cash in your socks.
But there are other ways of keeping your valuables out of reach too.

 

 

SPACIOUS INTERIOR

Wake up late? Minimize decisions. All your stuff stays with you,
in the 180° openable main compartment and zippable front panel.

 

 

17" LAPTOP COMPARTMENT

And if you absolutely must take your laptop with you,
we got you covered there too. It’s padded, top-loading, and separated. Easy.

 

 

REINFORCED LUGGAGE STRAP

There’s nothing quite like the satisfaction of a backpack that
just rolls with your suitcase.  Okay, not nothing, but it’s pretty nice.

 

 

SOME FOCUS, SOME DETERMINATION

 

 

YOUR PERKS FOR BACKING US

 

 

GLOBAL FREE SHIPPING

We have had almost 20,000 suitcases last year.
Shipments begin in early November and are expected to arrive between the end of November and the middle of December before Christmas.

 

 

Specification


 

About Us


 

We are SHAPLERS. We are passionate about good design and customer value.
D2C is the core of our creative vision for the world.
 

Thanks for helping us.

story:
COMBAR isn't just incredible because it's so versatile. It's incredible because it packs all these tools and still manages to be the best at all of them. And with all 5 tools it still weighs just 3.2 pounds.

 

 

So durable that every COMBAR comes with a full lifetime warranty.

 

 

         

 

We dropped it, ran heavy load tests, and immersed it in sand and water. Then we kept using it, good as new.

The COMBAR hammer pad was designed to easily hammer tent pegs and wooden stakes. The pattern on the pad allows traction and friction for various fieldwork tasks – like hammering bark to create strips of fiber for easy fire starting.

We designed the COMBAR axe for optimal function. We found that 90% of axe work was used for trail work like trimming small branches and chopping and splitting kindling. So we made our axe to both split and chop amazingly well. 

The spade's shape was designed after deep research into how it would actually be used. We found that spades were usually utilized for common field-work tasks, like rain ditches, firepits and digging out vehicles' wheels. So we designed a super functional spade with a unique shape that worked just as well.

We’re outdoor loving former IDF special-forces officers and family men. We’re adventurous, explore anything anywhere types. 

We set out to make something we wouldn't be able to live without. And that’s exactly what we did. After years of development and testing, we're now ready to produce the first batch. We’re very proud to introduce COMBAR to the rest of the world: an entire premium tool-set in one grip.
We do things every day that put our COMBARs through hell, because that’s the kind of work we believe in. And because COMBAR was designed to endure precisely that kind of satisfying work. Now it’s time for us to launch COMBAR so it can be held and utilized by its new rightful owners all over the world.

We couldn't have done it without our incredible hand-picked team of the best of the best:
Engineers: Yaniv Ofir, Avishai Naeh, Shachar Cohen, Phd. Lev Levin (Metallurgist), Daniel Shaki 
Product Design: Prime Total Product Design Studio 
Graphic Designers: Maya Avni-Rom, Naama Oren
Marketing & Branding: Steven Duke, Shachar Gerzon, Asaf Gury

story:
We are a small passion driven team that is excited to change the way you think about daily carry styles. Our journey begins with the versatile ideas of TAKUMI Pen. 

When we design our products, we focus on one simple rule: adapt for every adventure, trip and daily use. We observe the indispensable needs and integrate technical features with a simple and functional design. 

 Thus, the FLATPAC debuts.

Think about every time you've spent tons of time to pack while shopping and unpack again at home - and it happens everyday to keep you annoyed! 

 

 

Think about put your stinky apparel into the bag with all the other stuffs together after doing exercise. You don't even know how to pack your running shoes with all the other gears together. Bought groceries are mixed together with your notebook, phone or electronic devices.

Think about how much of your life and time have lost - and will lose EVERYDAY. To frustrate & compromise!

Think how many bags you need to bring when going to the beach or picnic and look clumsy when showing up. 

The FLATPAC takes intense bag-joy in overcoming these frustrations. 

 


This's FLATPAC that we want to provide people convenient, comfort, lightweight and flexible daily life.

Pack & Unpack In A Second: Creating one innovative construction to pack stuffs easily and unpack it like a mat.

Minimal Style: FLATPAC combines the benifit of tote bag & drawstring bag with delicate honeycomb pattern and various color.

3 Way Access & 4 Carry Style: For everyone, anywhere & anytime, FLATPAC will fit the different height for different using styles such as backpack or shoulder bag.

THE MINIMAL, EVERYDAY CARRY BAG THAT PROVIDES EVERYONE COMFORT AND VERSATILE EXPERIENCES TO PACK & UNPACK YOUR STUFFS ANYTIME. 

The FLATPAC™ is a beautiful, intelligent and adaptable bag designed for everyday use and all kinds of utilities.

It comes in Turkish Green, Navy Blue, Gun Black, Hermes Orange & Snow White. (Outer color: 5 options / Inner color: Snow White)

When something is wonderful, it means each tiny detail does its job perfectly and fits together flawlessly. This bag is totally, indubitably, unequivocally perfect. See Why:

That means: It totally fits your lifestyle and you can use it anytime and any moment.

What do all conventional daily use bags in common? It always takes time to pack & unpack everyday.

The FLATPAC is able to be flat opened that we learned from Japanese traditional furoshiki. So you can organize your personal belongings in a second and prompt to get anything with just a simple step. 

No more take time to look for your gears since everything is so clear to see and easy to reach. 

The FLATPAC also includes 8 separated pockets , with flap to protect your precious gears and prevents them falling outside.

Always being annoyed to pack your running shoes or sweaty apparels after sports. Or even wanna separate your fresh grocery from your gears. That's why we create pouch layer. 

Pouch Layer is with water resistant textile to prevent the objects from 2 different layers to be touch with each other.

The FLATPAC is also allowed you to reach your stuff from any direction. No matter you backpack or lay it on your shoulder, it is just that easy and prompt to take stuffs in a second.

The volume of FLATPAC reach up to 16 Liter Volume and it is perfect for a daily trip or become an organizer in your luggage when travelling.

 

The versatile FLATPAC provides 4 ways to match your lifetyle: Backpack, Messenger, Shoulder, and hand carry. 

The FLATPAC is made by ultra light textile and foldable to be slim size to bring with you all over the world.

 

Strap length adjustment to meet all kinds of situation. The straps of FLATPAC is able to adjust its length to fit your height and for different using styles such backpack or shoulder bag styles.

The textile we chose is originally used for outdoor activity. That means it provides water & dust resistant features to our FLATPAC and easy to wash for daily use.  

The FLATPAC weights only 110 gram and three FLATPACs are just equal to a canned soda.

Who are these great for?

The FLATPAC's versatile style makes them perfect for everyone to do anything, go anywhere, with any outfit. With a minimalist, stylish design, you can pack your clothes, shoes, underwear, gadgets or dirty cloth in it easier, and unpack them quicker than ever. The various color options will great fit for both men and women, even kids.

Commuters:  The FLATPAC's versatile style allows people to go out light and relax with your sport cloth or shoes.

Shoppers: The light weight and compact usage for people can pack and unpack the bag in a second, saving your time, getting more time to relax.

Runners: The separated pouch layer provide sport lover to carry their clean clothes, shoes or wet clothes together in one bag but seperated in each layer.

Travelers: The large volume of space is able for 2-to-3-days clothes or 1-to-2-days clothes with 1-to-2 shoes. And several pockets for gadgets or underwear.

Students: Won't having to think about what bags to take, your FLATPAC will be the perfect one to go with you do anything.

Parents & Kids: The FLATPAC is easy to open, pack and unpack any toys. Your kids will use this cloak bag to create their adventures.

 

  • Material: 68D Honeycomb Polyster with Water & Dust Resistant Treatment
  • Weight: 110 Gram (3.88 Ounce)
  • Packing Mode Size: 55 cm (21.7") x 60 cm (23.6")
  • Flat Bag Mode Size: Φ 19 cm  (7.5") x 60 cm (23.6")
  • Colour Ways: Turkish Green, Navy Blue, Gun Black, Hermes Orange & Snow White

story:
Haven’t you ever wanted to step outside of yourself, your life, your existence for just a moment to help you get a better understanding of what your purpose really is in life? Have you ever wished that you could experience something so meaningful that you would honestly be changed, for the better, forever? I believe that I have been given this very opportunity!

I am so excited to share with my friends the news that I will be heading on a mission trip to Nicaragua in December. I will be traveling with nine other people from my church. We will be doing several things while there but focusing on working with children that travel for hours carrying their spoons and bowls to come to a nutrition center that is far away from their homes. Here they will feel the love and kindness of strangers but most of all be introduced to the greatest love one could ever know – the love of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

I am trying to raise $1,500. Now this should cover my costs of the trip and then a little more. The "little more" will directly benefit those we will be serving while we are there. This money will only be used for this cause. If you prefer, donations can be made to the missions fund by contacting the church directly at 941-922-4434. Learn more about my church by going online to www.fccsarasota.com.

Now to some people you are already tuning out. I understand. All I can ask that you believe in our friendship enough to consider helping me as an individual do something that I truly believe in. To others you might be surprised. It is true, I am probably not the first person you would consider when you think of the term “missionary”. I ask you to rethink what is possible. I challenge you to consider that even though I have lived a colorful life that God still loves me. (And you too for that matter). That he finds the value in who I am as a human being… and he wants to use me, my talents, my compassion, to help others. Maybe it’s through sharing how far I have come. Maybe it’s through my storytelling abilities. But maybe, just maybe, it’s just by being your friend when you need me. Listening when you need an ear, driving you when you need a ride, watching your pets or kids when you need a helping hand, or just a hug when you feel like someone who needed a hug. Whatever our friendship means to you… this is me asking you to reach out and consider helping me with something bigger than all of us.

I plan on sharing my trip through the gift that I was given of writing. If you can’t give money, I of all people understand. I hope that you will consider following along my journey and maybe you will see that our own problems are so small in the big scheme of life. My greatest hope is that someone who can’t take a trip like this for whatever reason will still reap the benefits of following the journey with me and seeing it through my eyes.

No donation is too small, no prayers are too few, and your friendship does and will always continue to mean the world to me. Thank you for taking a moment to consider the possibility.

story:
What is SoxxyAir?

SoxxyAir is the only stylish compression sock that gives back.

SoxxyAir increases circulation, reduces jet lag, swelling, muscle soreness and helps decrease the risk of deep vein thrombosis (DVT).

Whether you’re traveling on a long-haul flight or on a train or jogging in the park, SoxxyAir will increase your circulation and keep you feeling and looking great all day long.  

SoxxyAir by Sarah Stabile:

Sarah created SoxxyAir while recovering from knee surgery.  During the three months she was on crutches, her doctor encouraged her to wear compression sox to help prevent blood clots, especially when flying. Sarah was frustrated with the lack of style, colors and designs available in compression sox and took matters into her own hands. www.soxxy.com

In 1999, Sarah launched Hi-Impact Communications, a PR and marketing agency with a solid track record working with Levi Strauss & Co, Virgin Atlantic, Virgin America, Air New Zealand, AirAsia, Panasonic, SKYY Vodka and Ian Schrager Hotels. www.hi-impactcommunications.com 


SoxxyAir charity sox:

Sarah partnered with five charities near and dear to her heart to create sock designs that give back.

Designing with a purpose allows Soxxy to give back in a more meaningful way. $8 from the sale of each sox will be donated to that specific charity.   

We will use the funds from this campaign to cover the initial production round of SoxxyAir charity sox.

  • Once you purchase your SoxxyAir perk, please send your size, charity sock style/s and mailing address to support@soxxy.com with subject heading:"SoxxyAir Indiegogo Campaign Order"

“Support a Cause, Support your Legs”


Boston Strong

One Fund Boston was formed by Governor Deval Patrick and Mayor Thomas M. Menino on April 16th, 2013, with the purpose of helping those most affected by the tragic Boston Marathon bombings. The greatest message we have received is that nothing can stop the generosity, courage, and unconditional love we have for one another.


Orion sox:

The Orion sock benefits the Michael Stabile Memorial Scholarship Fund at Trinity Pawling School. The fund provides financial assistance to students in the School’s Language Program. This specialized program works to alleviate dyslexia and learning disabilities; providing students with the opportunity to realize a full range of academic potential.


Jesse Lewis Choose Love sox:

Jesse Lewis was one of the first graders killed at Sandy Hook elementary school. He was a modern day hero at the age of 6.  Jesse’s Mom, Scarlett Lewis, recently published a heart-warming story about the loss of her son and the birth of the Jesse Lewis Choose Love foundation. “Nurturing, Healing, Love” are the words Jesse left behind on the family’s kitchen chalk-board. In the wake of such terror, it would be easy to become bitter and sarcastic, but Scarlett has chosen love and is developing programs to teach children about the power each of us has to change our thoughts and choose a life without fear and hate. http://www.jesselewischooselove.org/

Kristen Ann Carr Fund sox:

The Kristen Ann Carr Foundation (KACF) provides grants for cancer research and seeks to improve all aspects of cancer patient life with an emphasis on adolescents and young adults.

The Kristen Ann Carr Foundation honors the life of Kristen Ann Carr (1971 – 1993), a remarkable young woman who sought life and love. Established at Kristen’s request, the Fund continues in her spirit and convictions in its efforts. In memory of Kristen and with love for Barbara, Dave, Sasha + Wes, I created the KACF sock. Proceeds will be donated to the Kristen Ann Carr Foundation. www.sarcoma.com


Bob Woodruff Foundation sox:

Bob Woodruff Foundation's (BWF) mission is to ensure injured veterans and their families are thriving long after they return home. Yet even after they return to the love and support of their families and communities, many will struggle. Physical and hidden injuries can sometimes lead to unemployment, depression, substance abuse, even suicide.

BWF finds and funds innovative programs in communities where veterans, their families and caregivers live and work. www.bobwoodrufffoundation.org


WhyHunger sox:

WhyHunger was founded in 1975 by the late musician Harry Chapin and Bill Ayres (Executive Director). It is a grassroots support organization that works with more than 8,000 community-based groups around the country and across the world to fight hunger and poverty. From humble beginnings, WhyHunger remains committed to the belief that everyone deserves access to nutritious, affordable food and that together we can truly make a difference. Proceeds from sales of the WhyHunger sox will be donated to the foundation.  www.whyhunger.org

What Makes SoxxyAir different from other compression sox?

to create sock designs that give back.
Designing
with a purpose allows Soxxy to
give back in a more meaningful way. $8 from the sale of each sox will be donated to that specific charity.   We will use the funds from this campaign to cover the initial production round of SoxxyAir charity sox.Once you purchase your SoxxyAir perk, please send your size, charity sock style/s and mailing address to support@soxxy.com with subject heading:"SoxxyAir Indiegogo Campaign Order"“Support a Cause, Support your Legs”Boston StrongOne Fund Boston was formed by Governor Deval Patrick and Mayor Thomas M. Menino on April 16th, 2013, with the purpose of helping those most affected by the tragic Boston Marathon bombings. The greatest message we have received is that nothing can stop the generosity, courage, and unconditional love we have for one another.


Orion sox:
The Orion sock benefits the
Michael Stabile
Memorial Scholarship Fund at Trinity Pawling School. The fund provides financial
assistance to students in the School’s Language Program. This specialized
program works to alleviate dyslexia and learning disabilities; providing students with the
opportunity to realize a full range of academic potential.
Jesse Lewis Choose Love sox:Jesse Lewis was one of the first graders killed at Sandy Hook elementary school. He was a modern day hero
at the age of 6.  Jesse’s Mom, Scarlett
Lewis, recently published a heart-warming story about the loss of her son and
the birth of the Jesse Lewis Choose Love foundation. “Nurturing, Healing, Love”
are the words Jesse left behind on the family’s kitchen chalk-board. In the
wake of such terror, it would be easy to become bitter and sarcastic, but
Scarlett has chosen love and is developing programs
to teach children about the power each of us has to change our thoughts and
choose a life without fear and hate. http://www.jesselewischooselove.org/
Kristen Ann Carr Fund sox:The Kristen Ann Carr Foundation (KACF) provides grants for cancer
research and seeks to improve all aspects of cancer patient life with an
emphasis on adolescents and young adults.
The Kristen Ann Carr Foundation honors the life of Kristen
Ann Carr (1971 – 1993), a remarkable young woman who sought life and love.
Established at Kristen’s request, the Fund continues in her spirit and
convictions in its efforts. In memory of Kristen and with love for Barbara, Dave, Sasha + Wes, I created the KACF sock. Proceeds will be donated to the Kristen
Ann Carr Foundation. www.sarcoma.comBob Woodruff Foundation sox:Bob Woodruff Foundation's (BWF) mission is to ensure
injured veterans and their families are thriving long after they return home. Yet
even after they return to the love and support of their families and
communities, many will struggle. Physical and hidden injuries can sometimes
lead to unemployment, depression, substance abuse, even suicide.
BWF finds
and funds innovative programs in communities where veterans, their families and
caregivers live and work. www.bobwoodrufffoundation.org
WhyHunger sox:
WhyHunger
was founded in 1975 by the late musician Harry Chapin and Bill Ayres (Executive
Director). It is a grassroots support organization that works with more than
8,000 community-based groups around the country and across the world to fight
hunger and poverty. From humble beginnings, WhyHunger
remains committed to the belief that everyone deserves access to nutritious,
affordable food and that together we can truly make a difference. Proceeds from sales of the WhyHunger
sox will be donated to the foundation.  www.whyhunger.org

What Makes SoxxyAir different from other compression sox?

story:
Our Story

Hey everyone,

Our names are Harry and Mike, we have been good friends for four years now after going to college together. On the 23rd of August 2011, we're embarking on a 500mile cycle ride around the south coast of Wales to raise money for two charities: Caroline's Rainbow and Hazel's footprints. These charities educate teenagers about the importance of both experiencing new cultures and the potential dangers one can face from travelling. These causes are very important to us as a close friend of ours nearly died after he was brutally attacked and robbed in his hotel room in India.


The Impact

What happened to our friend sounds like a horror story but the fact is every year teenagers abroad are seriously injured or lose their lives from lack of awareness. Caroline's rainbow was set up from such a horror story, and aims to provide information about safety abroad. Hazel's footprints, is also set up in name of someone and provides travel grants to individuals who's planned trip is both safe and helps those less privileged than themselves. By rising money for these charities, we are helping them to carry on the great work they do. 


What We Need & What You Get

We will be filming our entire trip on two helmet cameras and a hand held camera. All the best bits will be turned  into a 45 minuet film that anyone who sponsors us can view for free. We will be doing a series of tasks which will get more stupid and more embarrassing with the more money we raise. These tasks will of course be filmed. We will also be taking photos for a naked calendar that will be released after our trip, which can be purchased for around £5.


You can keep up to date with everything we're doing via our blog: 

http://harryandmikeswrongwayround.blogspot.com 


Thanks, Harry and Mike

story:
WE ARE HOUSTON

Since organizing in 2005, Houston Roller Derby has grown into a league of more than 120 skaters. We have four home teams, an All Star travel team, a recreational league, and have recently added both Co-Ed and Junior Derby. 

The Houston Roller Derby All Stars are Houston’s dream team.

The league’s most talented and dedicated skaters cherry-picked out of its four home teams. These women train a minimum of three times a week and have played against numerous cities across the U.S. since 2006. They are currently ranked 33rd worldwide by the Women's Flat Track Derby Association (WFTDA).

Houston Roller Derby is gearing up for a truly amazing All Star season this year, but we need your support.

We are training like never before, and with our hard work and your support we will have the opportunity to represent Houston in one of the WFTDA Division One Tournaments this September!

A successful season requires a considerable amount of time, effort, and of course, money.  It takes a lot of Benjamins to send our All Star skaters all over the nation to represent the 4th largest city in the US. All of this means that we need to raise $$$ and we’re asking for your donations so our skaters can focus on their training.

Our All Stars are comprised of TWENTY amazing skaters, and here’s a little idea of how much money it takes just ONE skater to travel for an away game:  

--$35+ to buy her a roller derby helmet.

--$120+ to outfit her in our pink and black All Star uniforms.

--$500 per trip to send her to play out of state.

Not to mention every skater has to have the requisite skates, wheels, bearings, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, mouth guards and more, all of which can add up to over $700 per skater!  

  • Donate ANY amount and you get our undying love and support for all time!
  • Donate $25 and you get two HRD stickers and a koozie!
  • Donate $50 and you get all rewards of previous levels + an autographed All Star photo and a limited edition All Star pint glass!
  • Donate $100 and you get all rewards of previous levels + limited edition All Star t-shirt!
  • Donate $250 and you get all rewards of previous levels + a pair of VIP tickets to the bout of your choice!
  • Donate $500 and you get all rewards of previous levels + an invitation to a semi-private 2-hour session for skate lessons with an All Star skater! 
  • Donate $1000 and you get all rewards of previous levels + an honorary signed Houston All Star jersey with your name on the back!
  • Donate $2500 and you get all rewards of previous levels + a crash zone decal of your choice logo for our 2015 Season Opener game!

ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING you contribute helps us get one step closer to domination!  We sincerely appreciate all of your continued support and love!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not able to contribute funds but would like to sponsor in kind or volunteer, please write us at info@houstonrollerderby.com. We’d love to hear from you!

Tell your friends!

If you like this cause and want to help, please share this on facebook or twitter.

Thank you for your support! 

Houston Roller Derby

For more information about Houston Roller Derby, visit www.houstonrollerderby.org

Houston Roller Derby is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

story:
Short Summary

Gatherer of Heartbeats

I’m Lesley Nase, I grew up in the southern part of Vermont where my parents Mary & Larry Pratt started a campground 53 years ago called Camping on the Battenkill. In 1994 when my father passed away I came to live at the campground to help run it with my brother. That was until August of 2011 when tropical storm Irene damaged three-fourths of the campground. Two things happen at that time. My job at the campground changed from a fulltime paying job to a labor of love rebuilding the campground as there was no money to pay me. Camping on the Battenkill reopened for 2012 camping season with the help of family, many friends and other campground owners. I am forever grateful to all those who gave physical to help clear away debris, to those who helped connect us to other avenues of help in the form of loans and grants and especially to two campground owners who at the time of the disaster drove the length of state offering their knowledge on rebuilding. The campground is still recovering.

Out of Adversity

Natural disasters can be a way of looking at your life and taking stock. For me, Irene made me think about ways that I could give back to those who reached out a helping hand. When the Vermont Campground Association announced that in 2014 they would be celebrating their 50th year as a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting camping in the state, I had my answer. I could give back by telling the tale of camping in Vermont!  Here’s how:

  •   recording and videotape campground owners, Vermont State Park rangers and historical spots
  •   using my skills as a radio host, airing the camping stories on my show Books, Yarns & Tales
  •   team up with Northwest Access TV to run the video as a Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire series
  •   make a short documentary for the Vermont Campground Association’s 50 anniversary
  •  compile history of camping, campgrounds, area sights into book form

What Is Needed

To complete Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire I worked up a budget of $44,000. It encompasses the following:

  • Recording and computer equipment to facilitate interviews with campground owners, state parks, and historical spots in Vermont
  • Traveling expenses to film and photograph campgrounds, state parks and area attractions
  •  Editing and producing the radio shows, video series, documentary and book

The Impact

  • Listen to Books, Yarns & Tales to camping tales on WBTN at www.wbtnam.org

  • Watch Access TV to see Vermont Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire, to find out how go to www.northwestaccess.tv

  • Download  Vermont Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire DVD, (when available)

  • Buy Vermont Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire e-book, (when  available)

  • Best of all, come see the traveling sound booth to say ‘Hi’ and cheer me on!

Preserving Vermont’s camping history orally, visually and in book form is a wonderful way to share with family. Your money is a valuable resource in making this project a reality.

If I don’t reach my funding goal, I will cut back on the project to produce a smaller slice of camping history in Vermont.

With your help I can discover:

  • Who these stewards of the land are.
  • What inspired them to build, buy or rebuild campgrounds?
  • How has camping in Vermont changed over the years?
  • Where are these places in nature that have left the campfires burning as campers sit round telling tales?

Risks & Challenges

I have grown up in the camping industry, served on the Vermont Campground Associations board and visited most of the campgrounds in the state. I know what makes Vermont special to me, I am excited about sharing my love of camping and being out in nature with other people. Having a team of experts to call on from WBTN and Northwest Access TV is essential in making Campground Tales Heard ‘Round the Fire a reality.

Writing a weekly radio show, I know the value of researching material, keeping careful records, being prepared to interview people with on the spot questions. The challenges on the road are setting up the recording and videotaping equipment, sound checks, lighting and being able to view and edit. The last aspect of traveling the state is the weather.

As a tent camper, I don’t care what the weather is; I am prepared to keep dry and comfortable. Traveling with recording, photographing and editing equipment that needs to be up off the ground, secure and easily assessable is a different scenario.  A utility trailer will keep the gear secure and up off the ground, a canopy creates the setting for the recording booth and acoustical panels to line the inside for the optimum sound.

Other Ways You Can Help

With your help I can bring to life the story of camping for anyone who has packed up their gear and walked the land. It would be an irreplaceable loss to miss out on capturing the oral and visual history of camping in the state of Vermont.

Help spread my campaign to others would be a great assistance me in reaching my goal. Email people on your contact list, just copy and paste this link: www.indiegogo.com/projects/campground-tales-heard-round-the-fire/x/6574604 

Let friends and family know about the great creative campaign to collect oral and video history of camping in Vermont. I know there are some great Vermont camping tales that folks have to tell and I don’t want to miss any of them!

Share it on Facebook,Twitter or Pinterest.

For more ideas on how to share use Indiegogo’s share tools.

All pledges will receive a thank-you note and email udates from my travel blog.

Thank-you, I am grateful for all who take part in making Campground Tales Heard 'Round the Fire a success.

story:
In the background of the news, behind the focus on how Ed Miliband’s nasal voice is not fit to lead the country and the obsession with the ‘swarms’ of immigrants pouring in, a very real crisis has occurred in Malawi. It has experienced its worst floods in half a century, with 638,000 people, according to the UN, being affected.

I thought this would be a good place to start my blog as I spent 6 weeks volunteering in Malawi with the Tikondwe Youth Project. The organisation’s motto is ‘Accept what you can’t change. Change what you can’t accept’ and that is exactly what they have been doing in the community of Domasi, Malawi. Tikondwe has set up a number of schemes such as schools, feeding programmes, a teacher training programme for locals, all with the aim to encourage self-dependence in the community, so that it can learn to combat poverty.

Malawi isn’t nicknamed ‘the warm heart of Africa’ for no reason. From the very moment of stepping off the plane, at which everyone clapped as they were so happy it had landed, I felt welcome.  Even when crammed into a 12-seater minibus with 24 other people, with a live chicken to my left and a huge bag of smelly fish to my right, I still felt more comfortable and at ease than any bus in England. Anyway, rather than going on about how it was a life changing experience, which it was by the way, it is important not to forget the people that made my time there so special.

Malawi is one of the world’s poorest and least-developed countries, which is why the floods have been so devastating. The majority of Malawian’s homes are built using mud, meaning that they have been swept away by the floods, along with all their possessions. Not only that, but sources of income, in the form of livestock and crops, have been swept away or destroyed as well. Unicef have also warned that there is a serious risk of the spread of diseases, such as malaria, due to stagnant water and malnutrition. Although many in Malawi will simply say ‘osadandaula’ – no worries, it is very difficult to see how those who have already lost so much in the floods will be able to rebuild their lives again without the aid of others.

By donating to the Tikondwe Youth Project, it can be ensured that services will get to those who need it most, particularly as it has much experience with agriculture and the building of homes.
